items.title: Retain Bastian Köcher at Fellowship Rank VI
items.content:
Hey, I'm Bastian Köcher, a rank 6 Fellowship member. The Fellowship requires that members up to rank 6 apply for retention to stay at their rank; otherwise, they can be downgraded. Normally, these referendums are done within the Fellowship itself. To retain rank X, members of rank X+2 need to vote in favor of you. In my case, there are no members of rank 8+ who could vote for me. So, I need to use the Fellowship track to get approval from all the token holders.

At rank 6, I need to request retention every 6 months. This retention is for the time frame from March 2025 until September 2025.

My main focus is still on bringing `500ms` blocks (also known as `BastiBlocks`) to parachains. The feature development is mostly finished, and I’ve already started merging parts of it ([PR6137](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot-sdk/pull/6137), [PR8172](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot-sdk/pull/8172), [PR9002](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot-sdk/pull/9002)) into the `master` branch of the Polkadot SDK. I’m splitting the feature into multiple smaller pull requests to make the review process easier. The MVP development is done, and now it’s mainly about getting the feature ported to `master`. It should land on test networks around the end of the year.

On May 23, we were informed about a potential security vulnerability in Polkadot. I did the initial investigation, developed a fix, and helped [publish a release](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/releases/tag/v1.5.1) that addressed the issue, all on the same day. It was a critical bug that allowed anyone to stall the relay chain or parachains by sending a simple transaction. For more details, [read the postmortem](https://forum.polkadot.network/t/2025-05-23-polkadot-sdk-transaction-depth-limit/13248).

Besides my development work, I also gave a presentation about CorePlay [at Protocol Berg](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WfihFE2M5hA). CorePlay is an idea for a JAM service that will allow developers to write actor-like programs on-chain.

I'm often involved in discussions with builders/users in various public channels like Element, [Polkadot Forum](https://forum.polkadot.network/u/bkchr/summary), or [Stackexchange](https://substrate.stackexchange.com/users/73/bkchr) to help solve their issues.

Besides the work highlighted above, I'm also very active in maintaining the [Fellowship runtimes repo](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/issues/created_by/bkchr) by providing reviews, helping with releases, and proposing changes of my own. I'm also very active when it comes to on-chain voting in the Fellowship, such as opening retention and promotion proposals for many members. I have taken part in one in-person interview to promote Sebastian Kunert from rank two to rank three (the rank of a member, the first rank in which they get actual voting rights in the Fellowship).

Thank you!

items.title: Fellowship: Retain bkchr at rank 6
items.content:
Hey, I'm Bastian Köcher, a rank 6 Fellowship member. The Fellowship requires that members up to rank 6 apply for retention to stay at their rank; otherwise, they can be downgraded. Normally, these referendums are done within the Fellowship itself. To retain rank X, members of rank X+2 need to vote in favor of you. In my case, there are no members of rank 8+ who could vote for me. So, I need to use the Fellowship track to get approval from all the token holders.

At rank 6, I need to request retention every 6 months. This retention is for the time frame from October 2024 until March 2025.

Right now, my main focus lies on enabling parachains to build blocks faster than the relay chain block time. When parachains launched, they were able to build blocks every `12s` (i.e., every second relay chain block). With asynchronous backing, the block time of parachains went down to `6s`. With elastic scaling, it will be possible to use multiple cores on Polkadot (each core provides `2s` of execution and `5MiB` of data). Thus, a parachain could use 3 cores on Polkadot to produce blocks every `2s`. The solution I'm working on will make it possible to build blocks every `500ms` by splitting one proof of validation (`PoV`) into multiple smaller pieces. By building blocks every `500ms`, the latency of applications on top of Polkadot will be reduced.

Besides working on faster block times, I have been working on supporting [remote proxies](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/pull/535). Right now, proxies are local (and thus limited) to chains. So, if a user creates a proxy on the relay chain, this proxy cannot be used on a parachain. For normal proxies, this is not such a big problem because they can be replicated manually. However, when a user creates a pure proxy, it cannot be replicated without `root`. We have recently seen this issue popping up. People created proposals on Polkadot to get paid in stables to their pure proxy accounts. The stables are paid out on AssetHub, and if the given pure proxy doesn't exist on AssetHub, the funds are not accessible. I created [a guide](https://blog.kchr.de/polkadot/guides/force-create-a-pure-proxy-account/) on how to replicate these pure proxies between chains, but this is a manual process that requires `root` and is cumbersome. So, I implemented a pallet that will enable users to use their proxies across different chains. I explained how these proxies work in [this blog post](https://blog.kchr.de/ecosystem-proxy/).

Back in October, I wrote [RFC#123](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/RFCs/pull/123) to fix some longstanding issues around runtime upgrades in the Polkadot ecosystem. The problem only arises in the block that enacts a runtime upgrade. The runtime of a Substrate-based chain is stored in its own chain as a WASM binary. So, when the runtime is upgraded, this entry in the state is overwritten. When trying to read the state of the block that enacted the runtime upgrade, right now we are using the new WASM binary to decode the state entries. As the state layout can change with a runtime upgrade, the decoding may fail, and incorrect data is returned. In September last year, we saw [degraded parachain performance](https://forum.polkadot.network/t/2024-09-17-polkadot-finality-lag-slow-parachain-production-immediately-after-runtime-upgrade-post-mortem/10057) after a runtime upgrade on the relay chain because of this issue.

I'm often involved in discussions with builders/users in various public channels like Element, [Polkadot Forum](https://forum.polkadot.network/u/bkchr/summary), or [Stackexchange](https://substrate.stackexchange.com/users/73/bkchr) to help solve their issues.

Besides the work highlighted above, I'm also very active in maintaining the [Fellowship runtimes repo](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/issues/created_by/bkchr) by providing reviews, helping with releases, and proposing changes of my own. I'm also very active when it comes to on-chain voting in the Fellowship, such as opening retention and promotion proposals for many members. I have taken part in three in-person interviews to promote people from rank two to rank three (the rank of a member, the first rank in which they get actual voting rights in the Fellowship).

Thank you!

items.title: Proposal to remove ONLY the 20 current Head Ambassadors
items.content:
The following proposal is to remove ONLY the current 20 Head Ambassadors.
The Collective Programme, proposed and approved through the Ref #487 on the root track (https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/referenda/487), passed with 94.2% approval in favour (363 AYE). The community has been broadly supportive of the programme, however, based on the recent events, I believe that the current collective has failed in its duties. A reset is needed
Furthermore, in reference to 1195, the Fellowship has invested considerable time and effort in getting the current programme up and running, and eliminating it entirely would undermine these efforts. The programme itself has not failed

items.title: Remove all 20 Head Ambassadors and remove the Ambassador Collective
items.content:
The Polkadot Ambassador program, established under Referendum 487 ([https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/referenda/487](487)) has faced significant challenges since its inception. Concerns have been raised about the voting process, where a major voter approved all applicants without thorough evaluation. This has led to questions about the authenticity of some candidates and the due diligence performed in selecting Head Ambassadors. This is most evident in the fact that Michiko was elected as a Head Ambassador and later turned out to be a fake persona.

It is recommended that the entire program be reconsidered, modified, and subjected to a new vote.

Furthermore, there appears to be confusion among some Head Ambassadors about how Polkadot OpenGov works, including misunderstandings about tracks, voting mechanisms, and the nature of permissionless networks.

items.title: Proposal to Demote Don Diego Sanchez as Head Ambassador
items.content:
I am writing to address a series of serious incidents that I believe constitute significant violations of our code of conduct. As Head Ambassadors, we are expected to represent the Polkadot brand with the highest level of professionalism and integrity, we must take swift action to put our own house in order before society and law enforcement are compelled to intervene. Unfortunately, Don Diego Sanchez’s recent actions have failed to meet this standard, and his continued presence in this leadership position risks damaging the reputation of the Polkadot ecosystem.

**Incident Overview:**

``1.`` **Inappropriate Behavior on Social Media:** On August 24th, Don Diego Sanchez posted a tweet [link to tweet](https://x.com/SanchezCrypto/status/1827443054296625272) containing derogatory language, inappropriate emojis, and tags to major financial institutions, including Deutsche Bank, BBVA, and Banco Santander, compromising the reputation of the entire Ambassadors team.
This unprofessional and public behavior goes against the values we uphold as Head Ambassadors of Polkadot. Not only does it tarnish our credibility, but it also jeopardizes relationships with key players in the financial sector, with potentially long-lasting consequences for the ecosystem.

``2.`` **Misrepresentation and Malicious Intent:** Even more concerning is Don Diego’s deliberate misrepresentation regarding his proposal. He falsely claimed that, if approved, **four companies** would bring significant Business Development (BD) and marketing efforts to the Polkadot ecosystem. One of these companies, **Onyze**, is a firm with which I have a close personal relationship, allowing me to provide irrefutable evidence of falsehood in his claims.

Don Diego represents **Scorechain** in this proposal. After his misleading post, Scorechain personnel contacted the CEO of Onyze via email, requesting support for marketing and BD. The CEO of Onyze **explicitly rejected this request**, and this rejection occurred after the post had already been made. Despite knowing that Onyze had declined to support the proposal, Don Diego and his team have continued to present this false information without any corrections or edits to the post—**even to this day**.

This act of dishonesty is particularly egregious for someone in a leadership role. Don Diego knowingly lied to push forward his agenda, even after receiving a direct rejection from one of the companies he cited. His ongoing refusal to correct this information demonstrates a malicious intent to deceive both the Polkadot community and stakeholders.

**Violation of Code of Conduct:**

Don Diego’s actions clearly breach several core principles outlined in Polkadot’s code of conduct and the tenets of the Polkadot Fellowship:

``1.`` **Disrespecting Colleagues and the Community:**  His false accusations and offensive language have damaged internal and external relationships, eroding trust within the community.
``2.`` **Reputational Damage:** Publicly implicating financial institutions and fellow ambassadors in inappropriate ways risks long-term harm to Polkadot’s reputation and its strategic partnerships.
``3.`` **Deliberate Misrepresentation:**  Intentionally spreading false information to manipulate a proposal's success is a serious breach of ethical standards. This behavior is malicious and directly contradicts the role of a Head Ambassador, whose duty is to act in the best interests of the ecosystem.

**Proposed Actions:**

Given the gravity of these incidents, I propose the following immediate actions:

``1.`` **Immediate Demotion of Don Diego Sanchez from the Position of Head Ambassador:**  His actions demonstrate a clear lack of integrity, professionalism, and respect for the responsibilities entrusted to him. He should be immediately removed from this leadership position as he can no longer effectively represent Polkadot’s values.
``2.`` **Permanent Ban from Future Leadership Roles:** Due to the serious nature of his actions, Don Diego should be disqualified from holding any future leadership positions within Polkadot. His malicious intent and disregard for transparency disqualify him from acting as a representative of the ecosystem.
``3.`` **Public Apology and Reconciliation Efforts:** To mitigate any reputational damage caused, Don Diego should be required to issue a formal apology to the community and the financial institutions he implicated. This step would serve as an acknowledgment of his wrongdoing and an effort to rebuild trust with the community.

As ambassadors, we are held to the highest standards of integrity, transparency, and professionalism. Don Diego’s actions have violated these standards, and swift action is necessary to protect Polkadot’s reputation and ensure that our leadership reflects the values of the ecosystem.

* if anyone asks for proof can speak with Onyze directly and I will bridge the connection.

items.title: Reduce the Set of Head Ambassadors and Start an Effective Ambassador Program
items.content:
tl;dr - This proposal aims to make the Ambassador Program effective. We propose to lower the number of Head Ambassadors to 10 and move some of them to Senior roles (if they accept this solution). The proposing 10 Head Ambassadors have agreed on a 100-day plan to kickstart the program.

## Background

The Polkadot Ambassador Collective is a Web3 first. It is the first time an ecosystem has an on-chain body of elected representatives of the network. The ambassador program has to reflect the values, vision, and ambition of the Polkadot DAO. It is vital that the program becomes a success and an example to be followed.

After observing the very slow start of the Ambassador Program for several weeks and after some serious consideration, we have come to the difficult conclusion that the group of Head Ambassadors needs to be downsized to get the program finally started. In addition, we propose a 100-day plan to be executed immediately to start the recruitment of Ambassadors, event organization, BD efforts, and more.

We think this cut is necessary because of three reasons:

1.  A group of 21 Head Ambassadors is too big to bootstrap the program. Too many cooks in the kitchen significantly slow down the bootstrapping phase. So far, no real initiative has seen the light of the day.
2.  The primary responsibility of Head Ambassadors is to be leaders. Not everyone in the group has grown to the challenge. Some primarily focus on certain areas only, such as BD. This qualifies one as Senior Ambassador, but not Head Ambassador.
3.  The cost structure of the Ambassador program should be lean. Voters need to trust that the Ambassador program can achieve results at a cost-efficient rate. As long as the program is not fully operational, costs should be minimized.

## Removal of Head Ambassadors

We understand that it will not be easy for affected former Head Ambassadors to accept this change. We want to make it clear that we value what all of you bring to the table. Each of you has qualities that we want to see in the Ambassador program. We have agreed to fast-track applications for Senior Ambassadors for you to give the ones who want to stay in the program and contribute a chance.

Given those considerations, we propose to remove the following Head Ambassadors from the group and **accept some of them to Senior Ambassador roles later** (if they choose to apply).

-   EzioRed
-   Georgi
-   CrisNguyen
-   Mario Schraepen
-   Mexican Collective
-   Max\_HIC
-   Albert - I Love Cripto
-   Mario
-   Irina Karagyaur
-   William

This is not an easy step and we understand that it will create a lot of discussion. We see this change as necessary to get the program off the ground. We want to create a program that works effectively and it is just not possible with 21 Head Ambassadors. Working effectively and making quick decisions is necessary in this first phase. We see it as our responsibility to rise to this challenge and make the program a success.

## A 100-day plan to kickstart the program

We, the remaining Head Ambassadors (Lucy, Lorena Blockya, Alice und Bob, Dot Play Angie, DonDiegoSanchez, Abdulbee, zoemc, Leemo, Rish, six) have agreed on the following 100-day plan, which we will bring into execution immediately.

### **Overview**

During Q4 2024, we will have 3 HAs focused on developing the Ambassador program and 7 HAs working on the ground on community growth and business development-related activities.

By Q1 2025, the program will run at full speed and all 10 HAs will fully commit their time to community / BD activities.

We will set up five teams to organize the Polkadot Embassy:

**Internal Operations** (30% overall commitment)

-   Onboarding & Education (internal operations)

**External Operations** (70% overall commitment)

-   Community Growth
-   Business Development
-   Investor Relations
-   Customer Success / DevRel

Please note that we will submit a separate proposal for funding on Friday 7 October.

### **_Onboarding & Education_**

**Goals**

-   Create a process to onboard new Ambassadors
-   Supporting Ambassadors and the broader community in key areas

**Agenda Q4 2024**

Onboarding

-   Set up the application & selection process
-   Define criteria for rising the ranks
-   Run a recruitment campaign to drive applications
-   Select 10 Senior Ambassadors and 10 Ambassadors from the set of past Ambassadors in Q4
-   Q1 2025 onwards:
    -   Continuous onboarding of Ambassador Candidates
    -   10% of HA time committed to the program

Education

-   Events hosting
-   Representation (presentations, interviews)
-   Relationship management
-   BD / IR
-   Set up a learning portal that provides educational materials for the key areas
-   Q1 2025:
    -   Organize Ambassador meetups (as side events to conferences where lots of Polkadot folks are) to get them upskilled
    -   Work with the PBA, hackathon organizers, and Polkadot media to integrate educational activities

### **_Community Growth_**

**Goals**

-   Regional community building: hosting events, attending meetups
-   Engage the crypto world: representation at key conferences, engage with other ecosystems

**Agenda Q4**

-   Build a regional map of Polkadot Ambassadors
-   Develop an event hosting guide and work with the events bounty to set up a common agenda
-   Develop an [event calendar](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1rn74630iBI_UlqfUVVaBKd5hNzz7-8aB7FFw33b3m2E/edit?gid=0#gid=0) and make sure Ambassadors are sent to key events
-   Develop a prioritized list of crypto projects to engage with

### **_Business Development & Investor Relations_**

**Goal:** Bring new business to Polkadot

-   Attend Web2, Tech, and business conferences
-   engage with governments and regulators
-   Investor Relations

**Agenda Q4**

-   Develop materials for Ambassadors to get them briefed on products available in Polkadot
-   Pap out the BD space and prioritize projects
-   Find SAs that take responsibility for specific BD projects
-   By Q1 2025:
    -   Full global coverage of Ambassador representation, hosting events, and attending local meetups
    -   Representation at all major conferences
    -   Organizing/coordinating major events

### **_Customer Success / DevRel_**

**Goal:** Improve overall experiences of onboarding Polkadot.

-   Unify content and resources
-   Create a customer success desk
-   Create a DevRel desk

**Agenda Q4**

-   Improve the Wiki
-   Sync with the Parity Data team to create a feedback funnel
-   Sync with BizDev Team, and support onboarding

items.title: Fellowship: Retain bkchr at rank 6
items.content:
Hey, I'm Bastian Köcher (bkchr) a rank 6 Fellowship member. The Fellowship requires that members up to rank 6 apply for retention to stay at their rank. Otherwise they can get down ranked. Normally these referendums are done within the Fellowship itself. To retain rank X, members of rank X + 2 need to vote in favor of you. In my case, there doesn't exist any member of rank 8+ that could vote for me. So, I need to use the Fellowship track to get approval from all the token holders.

At rank 6 I need to request retention every 6 months. This retention is for the time frame from March 2024 until September 2024. 

My main contribution during this time was around the **Merkleized Metadata** feature, better known as "generic support for offline signers", as described in [RFC78](https://polkadot-fellows.github.io/RFCs/approved/0078-merkleized-metadata.html). I helped write the RFC, was responsible for its implementation in the Polkadot SDK, and also I contributed to rolling this essential feature out in the ecosystem. With this new feature, offline signers like Ledger are now able to support any FRAME-based parachain. 
Before this essential feature was implemented, the developers of the Ledger application had to hardcode the calls of each parachain/relay chain runtime; and each Ledger application update required a separate audit. This process was quite slow and didn't really fit in with the model of forkless runtime upgrade provided by Polkadot SDK.

The upgrade that enabled the generic offline signers support wasn't as smooth as I had wished. I knew beforehand that it would break the transaction format, requiring wallets and platform builders to be prepared for this breaking change. 
I helped to initiate a new process for ecosystem-wide notifications to get this critical information out and make sure that it reaches all ecosystem teams. But some builders still fell through the cracks and experienced difficulties with adapting to the new feature. 
To ensure that this never happens again, I proposed [RFC 99](https://polkadot-fellows.github.io/RFCs/approved/0099-transaction-extension-version.html) to introduce a new version in the transaction format. Thanks to this version, the runtime is now able to decode transactions made in the old format, and thus continue to support non-upgraded wallets.

My other important area of contribution was in supporting core developers, ecosystem builders, and blockchain engineers. 
For the launch of Coretime on Kusama, my work has mainly been about providing insights on the internals of Coretime to improve developers and users understanding, reviewing pull requests, and fixing small issues as they came up. The runtime upgrade on Kusama that should migrate the parachains from leases to Coretime did not work as expected. Some of the XCM messages for setting up the state on the Coretime chain failed. So, I debugged these XCM issues to ensure that ecosystem builders have a smooth transition to Coretime without any major issues.

I'm often involved in discussions with builders/users in various public channels like Element, [Polkadot Forum](https://forum.polkadot.network/u/bkchr/summary), or [Stackexchange](https://substrate.stackexchange.com/users/73/bkchr) to help solve their issues.

Besides the work highlighted above, I'm also very active in maintaining the [Fellowship runtimes repo](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/issues/created_by/bkchr) by providing reviews, helping with releases, and proposing changes of my own. 
I'm also very active when it comes to on-chain voting in the Fellowship, such as opening retention and promotion proposals for many members. I have taken part in an in-person interview to promote one
member to Architect (rank 4) and I have submitted Whitelisting referendums to fast track network upgrades and RFC related referendums. 
Since March, I have spent a lot of time reflecting on how to improve the Fellowship collective and coordination between members. I set up the [Fellowship Secretary](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/help-center/issues/8) as a new role to help with internal Fellowship processes and also to work as a bridge with ecosystem teams.

For the past 6 years, I have dedicated myself to Polkadot to help the network become successful from the technical side of things and grow even more. I hope that my work and contributions listed above will convince you to vote in favor of my retention as a Grand Architect of the Polkadot Technical Fellowship.

Thank you!

items.title: Remove myself from the Fellowship collective
items.content:
As explained in the [comment in #994](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/referenda/994#RZBo0wGy9sYccnh0kRq7), I would like to remove myself from the Fellowship collective.

Note that a referendum in Fellowship Admin track is necessary for this, as fellowship collective itself is [limited](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/blob/main/system-parachains/collectives/collectives-polkadot/src/fellowship/mod.rs#L128) in its power of demotion and removal.

I have explained my reasons a bit in the comments in #994. In short, I think this is the best option for me and for the community. For my Polkadot community engagement, I do value greatly on my freedom in choosing what I would prefer to work on and during which time. As someone who occasionally suffers from burn-outs, this is especially important for me in maintaining my productivity and creativity. The plain-old treasury proposal process will be a lot more suitable for me, as I can set my own timelines (rather than Fellowship fixed 6 months). I think this will also be better for the community, as you will have more direct chances to review and audit my work.

I therefore hope that the community can respect my request and vote Aye to remove myself from the Fellowship collective.

I'll of course continue to engage in the Polkadot community and I look forward to you, all community members, reviewing my treasury proposals in the future.

items.title: Polkadot Head Ambassador – Hope Clary for Product
items.content:
As a Head Ambassador (HA) for Polkadot, I will be 100% Dedicated to the Role. Knowing that I am no longer just representing myself. I am an extremely passionate representative of Polkadot and JAM who resides in North America, Miami metro area. After attending Decoded and meeting with a few Developers and seeing some of their current products and upcoming products, I would be focused on assisting the Polkadot Community to help Developers and/or the teams go to market on behalf of Polkadot. Additionally, it was suggested while at a WebZero meet-up that an additional way I can support onboarding to Polkadot would be to work and judge Hackathons by working with Developers prior, to better define their product, and after the Hackathon to help them further develop on Polkadot and become part of our eco. As a dedicated HA I would support all initiatives that strengthen the ECO from QA to go to Market. 

To me the Head Ambassadors are not just faces, but speakers, strategists, facilitators of sales initiatives, internal processes and servicing the community. We lead, support and bring forth positive changes based on the best interests of Polkadot, Jam and its community. 

•	Here is a bit of the contribution I have made to Polkadot thus far; https://forum.polkadot.network/t/decoded-2024-sponsorship-for-active-community-members/7654/30?u=hopeclary 
•	I understand I will be an ambassador to Polkadot’s best interests. I currently see this, but not limited to: Gaming, AI, Governess, CoreTime, Bridging Partnerships, facilitating trust within WEB3 and sharing benefits in normal relatable services of current WEB2 to facilitate transitions into WEB3.  
•	I am technical, experienced with legal negotiations & contracts in addition to translating to normie speak. Past work roles for a Network Switching Company: Corporate Technical Trainer, QA, Product Delivery, Product Manager, Product Strategy, Product Analyst. 
o	I will represent Polkadot HA on LinkedIn www.linkedin.com/in/hope-goodman-49217730 Having worked for a fortune 100 US company for over 20+ years. I was Product Delivery for Apple Pay in the US for this Network Switching Services company, they’re the WEB2 layer 0 equivalent of Polkadot for financial transactions. Meaning, we routed transactions from point-of-sale devices through Visa, MasterCard, American Express, Discover and banking network funnels for approval and denial of a consumers purchases. When meeting people, if asked what I do for a living, I would share my past job experience & lead into my current role as a Polkadot HA. I will be describing what Polkadot is to businesses and the functions we provide through WEB3…. Connecting Polkadot to real world adoption, awareness & usage.
o	I can do presentations, write/collaborate on working legal agreements, and go after leads that would benefit Polkadot. I am actively going for additional collaboration initiatives for Polkadot that would help put us in the spotlight.
•	I would like to mirror a BD team like Brazil in the US, or work with this high performing team on US initiatives, as they’re part of the America’s. I understand big deals are never done alone! In addition, it has been my experience that specific skills are needed for these teams to be successful. 
•	 My goal as HA, for our HA team is to facilitate & support these initiatives. When working with global companies having representatives in multiple areas of the globe 🌐 will be beneficial. 
o	Success for global adoption of CoreTime and other products on-chain, we can introduce to businesses big and small, create strategies to execute upon! Example: reach out to local municipalities to see how various charity DAO’s within Polkadot may be of service in local communities. 
o	Beyond just charities, I see ways as a HA Team we can work to get positive media attention and connect with specific groups in our areas to help drive Polkadot forward for a WEB3 revolution! 
•	I would represent Polkadot to my Politicians, locals & in Washington DC. Living in the Miami Florida Metro area. We’re Bitcoin adaptive here (Bitcoin Bull in Financial District), I will work to drive more Polkadot adoption. Very large enterprises are moving to this area including Asset Management companies and other Fortune 500 companies in addition to TV & Movie Studio’s. As a HA Team we would collaborate on appropriate BD initiatives. 
o	I would welcome working closely and collaborating with legal counsel to facilitate deals & lobbying where appropriate.
•	 At times I will connect proposals or ideas to products within the ecosystem. I will make product recommendations & work with other talented people to make them a reality. New Product Ideas, Testing, Feedback, making introductions & pitches. Whatever is in the best interest of Polkadot and Jam!
•	With access to footage, I would make appropriate presentations and commercials.
•	 Attending and creating events locally in addition to Crypto Conferences and Conferences of industries we’re looking to break into, or expand in. 
•	 Create In person and online engagements to connect with other Crypto communities to facilitate collaboration & trust.
•	 Continued Participation in video meetings for Polkadot and Jam initiatives, Polkadot Forum, Telegram & helping people navigate all things Polkadot and Jam.
•	 Continued work on Bounties or where needed for DAO funding support. 
•	 As HA I would always be open to connecting and creating collaborations with other Crypto Ecosystems, Participants and Products because Polkadot is the WEB3 Layer 0!

items.title: Head Ambassador Proposal: Dustin Lee
items.content: # Head Ambassador Proposal: Dustin Lee ## TLDR: I am Dustin Lee, and I am proposing for the Polkadot Head Ambassadors Program. Josiah and I initially applied under proposal [#1015](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/referenda/1015). However, with the community feedback, we decided I would pursue the Head Ambassador role while Josiah will independently apply for a Senior role later. With six years of experience with the Polkadot ecosystem with parachain projects such as Darwinia Network, who are early friends of Polkadot in the [Polkadot lightpaper](https://assets.polkadot.network/Polkadot-lightpaper.pdf), and 4yrs of that are complementary skills with Polkadot, 2yrs with Astar Network. I aim to enhance Polkadot's presence in the U.S. through a formally recognized position. My business development, public speaking, and social marketing skills have been honed throughout the years of advocacy as a previous Polkadot Ambassador. My proposal highlights my track record in building business relationships and public outreach. Planned activities include business development, marketing, event participation, outreach, and community support. With extensive experience in the Polkadot ecosystem, significant followings, and notable contributions to key projects, I aim to leverage my skills and networks to advance Polkadot's values and presence. Due to technical reasons outside my control, I couldn't set up my on-chain id. I included a screenshot below. ## *Full Proposal* # This application proposes Dustin Lee as a Head Ambassador position. This decision comes after much discussion about our company's internal workload, Metarock Ltd trading as DeStore. My profile demonstrates my long-standing advocacy for the Polkadot ecosystem on social media and at real-life events. Given my geographical location, this proposal seeks to cover the U.S. Below, I provide a breakdown of what I propose to bring as Head Ambassador, with my track records and vision to build Polkadot's future. I don't have a CV as I have been on Web3 for 7 years, but I have included my LinkedIn profile, which is up to date. ## Proposed Activities: - **Business Development:** Promote partnerships, provide technical assistance, and participate in sector events. - **Events and Initiatives:** Represent Polkadot at events, manage media relations, and create promotional content. - **Outreach:** Manage technical content on social media and organize AMAs. - **Community Support:** Generate content on various channels, organize meetups, and engage influencers. --- ## Dustin Lee: Head Ambassador Proposal **Socials:** - **X (formerly Twitter) 17k followers:** [@imcryptohustler](https://twitter.com/imcryptohustler) - **Odyssey 45k followers:** [CryptoHustler101](https://odysee.com/@CryptoHustler101) - **LinkedIn 2.2k followers:** [Dustin Lee](https://www.linkedin.com/in/dustinlee) - **Telegram:** [@cryptohustler101](https://t.me/cryptohustler101) - **Discord:** [cryptohustler101](https://discord.com/users/cryptohustler101) - **YouTube:** [CryptoHustler101](https://www.youtube.com/channel/CryptoHustler101) **Bio:** I am excited to present my candidacy for the position of Head Ambassador in the Polkadot Ambassadors Program. With this position, I am ready to leverage my skills to enhance and strengthen Polkadot's presence on the RWA front. **Journey in the Polkadot Ecosystem:** I began my tech journey early, building my first desktop at nine. My curiosity about technology led me to a 12-year career in the e-commerce industry, where I eventually discovered Bitcoin. As an entrepreneur in the blockchain space for the past seven years, I have gained valuable insights into market dynamics. My contributions to Polkadot projects include business development and marketing roles for Darwinia Network and Astar Network. As co-founder and chief marketing officer at DeStore Network, I focus on real-world assets and onboarding retail. My early adoption of the Polkadot ecosystem has established me as a reputable figure, adept at educating others and raising awareness within the broader web3 ecosystem on Polkadot's values. ## Supporting Articles and Videos: - [Bought the First Phygital NFT on TV with Kusama](https://youtu.be/-XnQLfa5FWw?si=knhjshsHbUBctOJd) - [Education about Polkadot and Parachains in 2020](https://odysee.com/@CryptoHustler101:8/Crypto-on-the-road:5) - [CryptoSlate mentions me in an article](https://cryptoslate.com/polkadot-parachains-encounters-temporary-block-production-halt-following-major-network-upgrade/) - [Spoke on Polkadot Defi Summit](https://youtu.be/aTaeWWWNCas?si=r_MRR5xKgTkO4wPL) - [Tutorial on how to make a Polkadot JS Wallet](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e_qSMWGLQzg) ## Notable Contributions: - [Announcement of Polkadot Going Live in 2020](https://odysee.com/@CryptoHustler101:8/Polka.-news-episode-1:1) - [Phala shares my Stake Drop Video Instructions](https://medium.com/phala-network/meet-the-first-of-its-kind-ksm-stakedrop-by-phala-10f0bc73432a) - [Highlighted Hackusama Winners: Unique Network](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a0a6siijul8) - [Ran a booth with Polkadot in EthDenver 24'](https://x.com/imcryptohustler/status/1769348117953142860) **Motivations & Vision:** Driven by my passion for Polkadot, I aim to channel my inspiration, connections, and social outreach to bolster its values. This role will allow us to plan and execute activities in a structured and organized manner. Best regards, Dustin Lee ---

items.title: Vote Nay for this Proposal
items.content: Please vote Nay for this proposal as it has moved to [Referenda #1017](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/referenda/1017) since we were advised by the community that the dual HA role was not acceptable.

history.content: # Dual Head Ambassador Proposal: Dustin Lee & Josiah Kotzur ## TLDR: Dustin Lee and Josiah Kotzur propose to be dual Head Ambassadors for the Polkadot Head Ambassadors Program. With four years of collaborative experience and complementary skills within the Polkadot ecosystem, we aim to enhance Polkadot's presence in our respective geographical areas through a formally recognized position. Our proven business development, public speaking, and social marketing skills have been honed through years of advocating for Polkadot. Our proposal highlights our track record in building business relationships and public outreach. Our planned activities include business development, event participation, outreach, and community support. With extensive experience in the Polkadot ecosystem, significant followings, and notable contributions to key projects, we aim to leverage our skills and networks to advance Polkadot's values and presence. ## *Full Proposal* # This application proposes Dustin Lee and Josiah Kotzur for a dual Head Ambassador position. This decision comes after much discussion about our company's internal workload, Metarock Ltd trading as DeStore. We work better as a team, working together for four years with complementary skill sets. Our profiles demonstrate our long-standing advocacy for the Polkadot ecosystem on social media and at real-life events. Given our geographical locations, this proposal seeks for us to cover the areas we live in. Below, we provide a breakdown of what we propose to bring as Head Ambassadors, who we are as individuals, our track records, and our vision to build the future of Polkadot. ## Proposed Activities: - **Business Development:** Promote partnerships, provide technical assistance, and participate in sector events. - **Events and Initiatives:** Represent Polkadot at events, manage media relations, and create promotional content. - **Outreach:** Manage technical content on social media and organize AMAs. - **Community Support:** Generate content on various channels, organize meetups, and engage influencers. --- ## Dustin Lee: Head Ambassador Proposal **Socials:** - **X (formerly Twitter) 17k followers:** [@imcryptohustler](https://twitter.com/imcryptohustler) - **Odyssey 45k followers:** [CryptoHustler101](https://odysee.com/@CryptoHustler101) - **LinkedIn 2.2k followers:** [Dustin Lee](https://www.linkedin.com/in/dustinlee) - **Telegram:** [@cryptohustler101](https://t.me/cryptohustler101) - **Discord:** [cryptohustler101](https://discord.com/users/cryptohustler101) - **YouTube:** [CryptoHustler101](https://www.youtube.com/channel/CryptoHustler101) **Bio:** Hello, I am Dustin Lee, and I am excited to present my candidacy for the position of Head Ambassador in the Polkadot Ambassadors Program. With Josiah Kotzur, my long-time ecosystem partner, fellow Ambassador, and Founder, we are ready to leverage our skills to enhance and strengthen Polkadot's presence on the RWA front. **Journey in the Polkadot Ecosystem:** I began my tech journey early, building my first desktop at nine. My curiosity about technology led me to a 12-year career in the e-commerce industry, where I eventually discovered Bitcoin. As an entrepreneur in the blockchain space for the past seven years, I have gained valuable insights into market dynamics. My contributions to Polkadot projects include business development and marketing roles for Darwinia Network and Astar Network. As co-founder and chief marketing officer at DeStore Network, I focus on real-world assets and onboarding retail. My early adoption of the Polkadot ecosystem has established me as a reputable figure, adept at educating others and raising awareness within the broader web3 ecosystem on Polkadot's values. ## Supporting Articles and Videos: - [Bought the First Phygital NFT on TV with Kusama](https://youtu.be/-XnQLfa5FWw?si=knhjshsHbUBctOJd) - [Education about Polkadot and Parachains in 2020](https://odysee.com/@CryptoHustler101:8/Crypto-on-the-road:5) - [CryptoSlate mentions me in an article](https://cryptoslate.com/polkadot-parachains-encounters-temporary-block-production-halt-following-major-network-upgrade/) - [Spoke on Polkadot Defi Summit](https://youtu.be/aTaeWWWNCas?si=r_MRR5xKgTkO4wPL) - [Tutorial on how to make a Polkadot JS Wallet](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e_qSMWGLQzg) ## Notable Contributions: - [Announcement of Polkadot Going Live in 2020](https://odysee.com/@CryptoHustler101:8/Polka.-news-episode-1:1) - [Phala shares my Stake Drop Video Instructions](https://medium.com/phala-network/meet-the-first-of-its-kind-ksm-stakedrop-by-phala-10f0bc73432a) - [Highlighted Hackusama Winners: Unique Network](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a0a6siijul8) - [Ran a booth with Polkadot in EthDenver 24'](https://x.com/imcryptohustler/status/1769348117953142860) **Motivations & Vision:** Driven by my passion for Polkadot, I aim to channel my inspiration, connections, and social outreach to bolster its values. This role will allow us to plan and execute activities in a structured and organized manner. Best regards, Dustin Lee --- ## Josiah Kotzur: Head Ambassador Proposal for Australasia **Socials:** - **X (formerly Twitter) 5.8k followers:** [@josiahkotzur1](https://twitter.com/josiahkotzur1) - **LinkedIn 700 Followers:** [Josiah Kotzur](https://au.linkedin.com/in/josiah-kotzur-a0506956) - **Telegram:** [@Doinglifewell](https://t.me/Doinglifewell) - **Facebook 2.1k+ Followers:** [@Digidiggers](https://www.facebook.com/theDigidiggers) - **Instagram 5K+ Followers:** [@Digidiggers](https://www.instagram.com/digi_diggers?igsh=d21ta2g3ZDlsbW92) - **YouTube:** [DeStoreNetwork](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCSl4sd09iXzaetxmMSKr6YA) **Bio:** My name is Josiah Kotzur, and I am the founder and CEO of DeStore. I’m applying for the HA, covering the region of Australasia. Australasia covers Australia, New Zealand, and neighboring island nations in the South Pacific Ocean. I co-organize Blockchain Byron monthly meetups with 400+ local and active members. I have strong relationships with Australia's most trusted exchange, Swyftx, Binance, Independent Reserve, and Animoca Brands. I supported the negotiations to get $ASTR listed in Australia on Swyftx. As a direct result, Australians can now buy $ASTR and be exposed to Astar Network educational courses. In 2024, I was a finalist for the Australia Blockies Awards for “Start-up Scale-up of the Year.” **Journey in the Polkadot Ecosystem:** I founded Metarock, the parent company of DeStore, with a vision to sell opals from my opal mine in the metaverse caught Discovery Channel's attention and was filmed in the series Outback Opal Hunters. DeStore beta was built on Kusama using a fork of RMRK 1.0 in 2022/23. In Q3 2023, DeStore was part of the Sony Astar incubator, which took my team and me to Japan, where we plan to connect brands that sell RWAs to Web 3.0, maintaining an active relationship with eLogIT, Japan's largest fulfillment company. ## Supporting Articles and Videos: - **[ABC Article](https://amp.abc.net.au/article/101428632)** - **[Discovery Channel Metaverse sale](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HufA9OM9HQw)** - **[Gavin Wood GBM auction Proof of Ownership](https://x.com/GBMauction/status/1790705967119859737)** - **[Darwinia Developer Grant](https://medium.com/darwinianetwork/grants-program-metarock-receives-darwinia-grant-bringing-nft-trading-and-minting-market-on-crab-eff08089c22a)** - **[Sony Incubator Demo Day](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AT27hlARc-Y)** - **[Polkadot Relayer Incubator Video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qqiEyuORLXI)** - **[Australia Blockies Award Finalist](https://x.com/DECAustralia/status/1713736518873878733)** **Motivations & Vision:** Driven by my passion for Polkadot, I aim to channel my inspiration, connections, and social outreach to promote its values of decentralization and self-sovereignty. This role will allow us to plan and execute activities in a structured and organized manner, leading to the expansion of Polkadot in Australasia. Best regards, Josiah Kotzur

My early adoption of the Polkadot ecosystem has established me as a reputable figure, adept at educating others and raising awareness within the broader web3 ecosystem on Polkadot's values. ## Supporting Articles and Videos: - [Bought the First Phygital NFT on TV with Kusama](https://youtu.be/-XnQLfa5FWw?si=knhjshsHbUBctOJd) - [Education about Polkadot and Parachains in 2020](https://odysee.com/@CryptoHustler101:8/Crypto-on-the-road:5) - [CryptoSlate mentions me in an article](https://cryptoslate.com/polkadot-parachains-encounters-temporary-block-production-halt-following-major-network-upgrade/) - [Spoke on Polkadot Defi Summit](https://youtu.be/aTaeWWWNCas?si=r_MRR5xKgTkO4wPL) - [Tutorial on how to make a Polkadot JS Wallet](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e_qSMWGLQzg) ## Notable Contributions: - [Announcement of Polkadot Going Live in 2020](https://odysee.com/@CryptoHustler101:8/Polka.-news-episode-1:1) - [Phala shares my Stake Drop Video Instructions](https://medium.com/phala-network/meet-the-first-of-its-kind-ksm-stakedrop-by-phala-10f0bc73432a) - [Highlighted Hackusama Winners: Unique Network](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a0a6siijul8) - [Ran a booth with Polkadot in EthDenver 24'](https://x.com/imcryptohustler/status/1769348117953142860) **Motivations & Vision:** Driven by my passion for Polkadot, I aim to channel my inspiration, connections, and social outreach to bolster its values. This role will allow us to plan and execute activities in a structured and organized manner. Best regards, Dustin Lee --- ## Josiah Kotzur: Head Ambassador Proposal for Australasia **Socials:** - **X (formerly Twitter) 5.8k followers:** [@josiahkotzur1](https://twitter.com/josiahkotzur1) - **LinkedIn 700 Followers:** [Josiah Kotzur](https://au.linkedin.com/in/josiah-kotzur-a0506956) - **Telegram:** [@Doinglifewell](https://t.me/Doinglifewell) - **Facebook 2.1k+ Followers:** [@Digidiggers](https://www.facebook.com/theDigidiggers) - **Instagram 5K+ Followers:** [@Digidiggers](https://www.instagram.com/digi_diggers?igsh=d21ta2g3ZDlsbW92) - **YouTube:** [DeStoreNetwork](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCSl4sd09iXzaetxmMSKr6YA) **Bio:** My name is Josiah Kotzur, and I am the founder and CEO of DeStore. I’m applying for the HA, covering the region of Australasia. Australasia covers Australia, New Zealand, and neighboring island nations in the South Pacific Ocean. I co-organize Blockchain Byron monthly meetups with 400+ local and active members. I have strong relationships with Australia's most trusted exchange, Swyftx, Binance, Independent Reserve, and Animoca Brands. I supported the negotiations to get $ASTR listed in Australia on Swyftx. As a direct result, Australians can now buy $ASTR and be exposed to Astar Network educational courses. In 2024, I was a finalist for the Australia Blockies Awards for “Start-up Scale-up of the Year.” **Journey in the Polkadot Ecosystem:** I founded Metarock, the parent company of DeStore, with a vision to sell opals from my opal mine in the metaverse caught Discovery Channel's attention and was filmed in the series Outback Opal Hunters. DeStore beta was built on Kusama using a fork of RMRK 1.0 in 2022/23. In Q3 2023, DeStore was part of the Sony Astar incubator, which took my team and me to Japan, where we plan to connect brands that sell RWAs to Web 3.0, maintaining an active relationship with eLogIT, Japan's largest fulfillment company. ## Supporting Articles and Videos: - **[ABC Article](https://amp.abc.net.au/article/101428632)** - **[Discovery Channel Metaverse sale](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HufA9OM9HQw)** - **[Gavin Wood GBM auction Proof of Ownership](https://x.com/GBMauction/status/1790705967119859737)** - **[Darwinia Developer Grant](https://medium.com/darwinianetwork/grants-program-metarock-receives-darwinia-grant-bringing-nft-trading-and-minting-market-on-crab-eff08089c22a)** - **[Sony Incubator Demo Day](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AT27hlARc-Y)** - **[Polkadot Relayer Incubator Video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qqiEyuORLXI)** - **[Australia Blockies Award Finalist](https://x.com/DECAustralia/status/1713736518873878733)** **Motivations & Vision:** Driven by my passion for Polkadot, I aim to channel my inspiration, connections, and social outreach to promote its values of decentralization and self-sovereignty. This role will allow us to plan and execute activities in a structured and organized manner, leading to the expansion of Polkadot in Australasia. Best regards, Josiah Kotzur
history.title: Dual Head Ambassador Proposal: Dustin Lee & Josiah Kotzur

history.content: # Dual Head Ambassador Proposal: Dustin Lee & Josiah Kotzur ## TLDR: Dustin Lee and Josiah Kotzur propose to be dual Head Ambassadors for the Polkadot Head Ambassadors Program. With four years of collaborative experience and complementary skills within the Polkadot ecosystem, we aim to enhance Polkadot's presence in our respective geographical areas through a formally recognized position. Our proven business development, public speaking, and social marketing skills have been honed through years of advocating for Polkadot. Our proposal highlights our track record in building business relationships and public outreach. Our planned activities include business development, event participation, outreach, and community support. With extensive experience in the Polkadot ecosystem, significant followings, and notable contributions to key projects, we aim to leverage our skills and networks to advance Polkadot's values and presence. # Full Proposal # This application proposes Dustin Lee and Josiah Kotzur for a dual Head Ambassador position. This decision comes after much discussion about our company's internal workload, Metarock Ltd trading as DeStore. We work better as a team, working together for four years with complementary skill sets. Our profiles demonstrate our long-standing advocacy for the Polkadot ecosystem on social media and at real-life events. Given our geographical locations, this proposal seeks for us to cover the areas we live in. Below, we provide a breakdown of what we propose to bring as Head Ambassadors, who we are as individuals, our track records, and our vision to build the future of Polkadot. ## Proposed Activities: - **Business Development:** Promote partnerships, provide technical assistance, and participate in sector events. - **Events and Initiatives:** Represent Polkadot at events, manage media relations, and create promotional content. - **Outreach:** Manage technical content on social media and organize AMAs. - **Community Support:** Generate content on various channels, organize meetups, and engage influencers. --- ## Dustin Lee: Head Ambassador Proposal **Socials:** - **X (formerly Twitter) 17k followers:** [@imcryptohustler](https://twitter.com/imcryptohustler) - **Odyssey 45k followers:** [CryptoHustler101](https://odysee.com/@CryptoHustler101) - **LinkedIn 2.2k followers:** [Dustin Lee](https://www.linkedin.com/in/dustinlee) - **Telegram:** [@cryptohustler101](https://t.me/cryptohustler101) - **Discord:** [cryptohustler101](https://discord.com/users/cryptohustler101) - **YouTube:** [CryptoHustler101](https://www.youtube.com/channel/CryptoHustler101) **Bio:** Hello, I am Dustin Lee, and I am excited to present my candidacy for the position of Head Ambassador in the Polkadot Ambassadors Program. With Josiah Kotzur, my long-time ecosystem partner, fellow Ambassador, and Founder, we are ready to leverage our skills to enhance and strengthen Polkadot's presence on the RWA front. **Journey in the Polkadot Ecosystem:** I began my tech journey early, building my first desktop at nine. My curiosity about technology led me to a 12-year career in the e-commerce industry, where I eventually discovered Bitcoin. As an entrepreneur in the blockchain space for the past seven years, I have gained valuable insights into market dynamics. My contributions to Polkadot projects include business development and marketing roles for Darwinia Network and Astar Network. As co-founder and chief marketing officer at DeStore Network, I focus on real-world assets and onboarding retail. My early adoption of the Polkadot ecosystem has established me as a reputable figure, adept at educating others and raising awareness within the broader web3 ecosystem on Polkadot's values. ## Supporting Articles and Videos: - [Bought the First Phygital NFT on TV with Kusama](https://youtu.be/-XnQLfa5FWw?si=knhjshsHbUBctOJd) - [Education about Polkadot and Parachains in 2020](https://odysee.com/@CryptoHustler101:8/Crypto-on-the-road:5) - [CryptoSlate mentions me in an article](https://cryptoslate.com/polkadot-parachains-encounters-temporary-block-production-halt-following-major-network-upgrade/) - [Spoke on Polkadot Defi Summit](https://youtu.be/aTaeWWWNCas?si=r_MRR5xKgTkO4wPL) - [Tutorial on how to make a Polkadot JS Wallet](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e_qSMWGLQzg) ## Notable Contributions: - [Announcement of Polkadot Going Live in 2020](https://odysee.com/@CryptoHustler101:8/Polka.-news-episode-1:1) - [Phala shares my Stake Drop Video Instructions](https://medium.com/phala-network/meet-the-first-of-its-kind-ksm-stakedrop-by-phala-10f0bc73432a) - [Highlighted Hackusama Winners: Unique Network](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a0a6siijul8) - [Ran a booth with Polkadot in EthDenver 24'](https://x.com/imcryptohustler/status/1769348117953142860) **Motivations & Vision:** Driven by my passion for Polkadot, I aim to channel my inspiration, connections, and social outreach to bolster its values. This role will allow us to plan and execute activities in a structured and organized manner. Best regards, Dustin Lee --- ## Josiah Kotzur: Head Ambassador Proposal for Australasia **Socials:** - **X (formerly Twitter) 5.8k followers:** [@josiahkotzur1](https://twitter.com/josiahkotzur1) - **LinkedIn 700 Followers:** [Josiah Kotzur](https://au.linkedin.com/in/josiah-kotzur-a0506956) - **Telegram:** [@Doinglifewell](https://t.me/Doinglifewell) - **Facebook 2.1k+ Followers:** [@Digidiggers](https://www.facebook.com/theDigidiggers) - **Instagram 5K+ Followers:** [@Digidiggers](https://www.instagram.com/digi_diggers?igsh=d21ta2g3ZDlsbW92) - **YouTube:** [DeStoreNetwork](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCSl4sd09iXzaetxmMSKr6YA) **Bio:** My name is Josiah Kotzur, and I am the founder and CEO of DeStore. I’m applying for the HA, covering the region of Australasia. Australasia covers Australia, New Zealand, and neighboring island nations in the South Pacific Ocean. I co-organize Blockchain Byron monthly meetups with 400+ local and active members. I have strong relationships with Australia's most trusted exchange, Swyftx, Binance, Independent Reserve, and Animoca Brands. I supported the negotiations to get $ASTR listed in Australia on Swyftx. As a direct result, Australians can now buy $ASTR and be exposed to Astar Network educational courses. In 2024, I was a finalist for the Australia Blockies Awards for “Start-up Scale-up of the Year.” **Journey in the Polkadot Ecosystem:** I founded Metarock, the parent company of DeStore, with a vision to sell opals from my opal mine in the metaverse caught Discovery Channel's attention and was filmed in the series Outback Opal Hunters. DeStore beta was built on Kusama using a fork of RMRK 1.0 in 2022/23. In Q3 2023, DeStore was part of the Sony Astar incubator, which took my team and me to Japan, where we plan to connect brands that sell RWAs to Web 3.0, maintaining an active relationship with eLogIT, Japan's largest fulfillment company. ## Supporting Articles and Videos: - **[ABC Article](https://amp.abc.net.au/article/101428632)** - **[Discovery Channel Metaverse sale](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HufA9OM9HQw)** - **[Gavin Wood GBM auction Proof of Ownership](https://x.com/GBMauction/status/1790705967119859737)** - **[Darwinia Developer Grant](https://medium.com/darwinianetwork/grants-program-metarock-receives-darwinia-grant-bringing-nft-trading-and-minting-market-on-crab-eff08089c22a)** - **[Sony Incubator Demo Day](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AT27hlARc-Y)** - **[Polkadot Relayer Incubator Video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qqiEyuORLXI)** - **[Australia Blockies Award Finalist](https://x.com/DECAustralia/status/1713736518873878733)** **Motivations & Vision:** Driven by my passion for Polkadot, I aim to channel my inspiration, connections, and social outreach to promote its values of decentralization and self-sovereignty. This role will allow us to plan and execute activities in a structured and organized manner, leading to the expansion of Polkadot in Australasia. Best regards, Josiah Kotzur
