items.title: Fellowship: Retain Wei at Rank III
items.content:
This is a proposal to retain Wei at fellowship rank III. The retention period happens every 6 months.

* For the past few months, I've been working on `tinyjam`, a secondary and independent implementation of JAM 2.0 with the goal of streamlining testing.
* The codebase isn't public yet, but I will have something to show before the next retention period (in the next 6 months).
* I have to admit, that the past 6 months was a little bumpy for me, due to personal factors.
* I have not claimed any "salary" in fellowship in the past, and don't plan to do so at least until the next retention period.

history.content: This is a referendumV2 whose proposer address (14ShUZUYUR35RBZW6uVVt1zXDxmSQddkeDdXf1JkMA6P721N) is shown in on-chain info below. Only this user can edit this description and the title. If you own this account, login and tell us more about your proposal.
history.title: Fellowship: Retain Wei at Rank III

items.title: Polkadot Head Ambassador Application: Luca Poggi
items.content:
Head Ambassador Candidate: Luca Poggi  
Twitter: https://x.com/LucaPoggi7  
Telegram: https://t.me/LucaPoggi  
Discord: lucapoggi

![image](https://i.ibb.co/Qmrq5Fc/12522-Iceberg-Nodes-1721053430476.jpg)

Dear Polkadot community,

My name is Luca Poggi and I am excited to present my candidacy for the role of Head Ambassador in the Polkadot Ambassadors Program.

HA role demands dedication and a passion for promoting Polkadot, and together with my team, we are feeling ready to leverage our skills to enhance and strengthen Polkadot's presence in the blockchain world.

The team I have selected is composed of individuals who share my principles. They will be actively supporting and executing a range of activities (see list below). As Head Ambassador, my role will not only be active in performing proposed activities, but also in representing and managing the activities, as well as being responsible for the entire group’s performance.

## Proposed Activities

### Business Development:

- Promoting partnerships with companies (B2B), universities, institutions and governative entities (B2G) to incorporate Polkadot into their activities, expanding use cases, showcase the ability to implement essential services in a sustainable and secure way, while increasing the adoption of Polkadot and its entire ecosystem.
- Providing technical assistance and advice to subjects interested in adopting Polkadot technology and/or deploying their project in the ecosystem.
- Participation in sector events and trade fairs to stay up to date with market needs and be able to offer a product that best suits demand, as well as getting to know new companies, subjects and possible users.
- Provide feedback on the services and products provided by Polkadot, based on the experience of use by companies and users, directly to the technical fellowship and to the entire community of Polkadot developers.

### Events and Initiatives

- Participate as official representatives of Polkadot in blockchain-related events on Italian territory.
- Planning and organizing hackathons and workshops throughout Italy to promote Polkadot to the community developers and supporting the creation and management of study groups and hands-on workshops for advanced technical training.
- Managing media relations to ensure positive and consistent coverage of Polkadot.
- Creating promotional and informational content for various communication channels.

### Education and Evangelism:

- Creating and managing technical content (posts, threads and tutorials) on social media (Twitter, Telegram and Medium) in order to explain complex concepts in a simple and accessible way.
- Organize periodic live video calls and AMAs to discuss and keep the Polkadot community updated on the latest news.
- Carry out classroom lessons at universities, schools and company courses about Polkadot technology.

### Community Building:

- Management of the Polkadot Italian community on Telegram, creating a welcoming and informative environment for members.
- Managing dedicated social channels (on X and YouTube) to facilitate discussion and exchange of ideas.
- Organizing local and national meetups to promote networking among Polkadot enthusiasts.
- Engaging influencers and key figures in the blockchain world to amplify Polkadot's visibility.

…and obviously…

### Ambassador typical activities:

- Participate in Polkadot events around the world
- Attend HA meetings and participate in discussions in public groups
- Provide help and collaborate in shaping the new ambassadors program
- Collaborate with other HAs on projects where cooperation can lead to a more effective, competitive, and streamlined process

## Compensation Breakdown

The HA, together with the team members, ensures a minimum monthly engagement in the proposed activities equivalent to full-time capacity, in accordance with [referenda 487](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/referenda/487). This is the minimum guaranteed condition, to be considered as the sum of the hours of activities carried out during the month by the team members. In reality, I expect that the hours dedicated to such activities, by proposing ourselves as a team, will generally exceed the minimum threshold by a consistent amount.

The monthly amount received by the HA:

- A small part (if needed), about 0-20%, will be allocated to an internal treasury, managed by the HA, which will cover possible reimbursements for HA travel expenses, costs related to work tools, and other minor expenses;
- 80-100% will be allocated to pay for the hours worked on the proposed activities, by HA and team members.

For any other expenses not falling into the categories mentioned above, a reimbursement request will be made to the ambassadors program treasury or specific on-chain bounties. In both cases, no administration or own fees will ever be counted; the expenses we will allocate in requests to the ambassador's treasury or bounties will only be out-of-pocket expenses such as the cost of sponsorship at an event.

A non-profit association will be established to manage all expenses in compliance with Italian regulations.

## Activities Track Records

In accordance with the motto “Don’t trust, verify” widely used in the Web3 world, we will provide a tool, in particular a public page of our internal Notion database (unfortunately, we do not have an equally practical Web3 tool), where all activities carried out will be detailed along with the hours dedicated to each of them. This page will be periodically updated and can be publicly viewed by anyone. This will also simplify the reporting process as a requirement of the ambassador's program.

## My background in the Polkadot ecosystem

Some of you may already know me, while for others this might be the first time. In other cases, the reputation of Iceberg Nodes probably precedes me. Here is my story.

I've been in the crypto space since summer 2014 and active in the Polkadot and Kusama ecosystem since 2019. I’m an early investor in DOT, and this gave me the opportunity to focus my energies and dedicate a lot of time in studying the technology, understanding the principles and seeing all the improvements since before the launch of Kusama (yeah there were already some Substrate projects around), until nowadays. Starting from mid 2022, I left my previous job in the welding manufacturing and certification field (I hold a bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering, a master’s degree in mechatronics engineering and a post master’s degree as International Welding Engineer), to become a full time crypto boy.

I’m the founder of Iceberg Nodes which provides secure non-custodial staking services in a total of more than 40 different networks, 95% of them as validators on relaychains, validators on standalone Substrate based chains and collators on parachains (also in 5 system parachains), so highly focused in the Polkadot ecosystem. My involvement in the ecosystem has also increased in having “skin in the game” as seed and private investor in some of the new Polkadot ecosystem projects, having invested in such sales almost $1.5M during the last one year period.

## …but wait…let me explain about my Polkadot Vision!

But before continuing with the story of my journey within Polkadot, I would like to take a moment to share my thoughts on Polkadot. I believe that, for a Head Ambassador, it is crucial to fully understand the true technology of Polkadot, its role, and, most importantly, to be able to effectively communicate this to the audience.

What do I think about Polkadot? I am a strong supporter of modular scalability, and consequently, scalability based on sharding. I firmly believe that the scalability offered by Polkadot is the only one capable of achieving true scalability in the blockchain world.

To fully understand Polkadot, one must first understand what a parachain (or if you want “appchain”) is at the end. A parachain is a chain with specific functionalities, specialized in a particular use case. This is where the magic of Polkadot lies. Developing on Polkadot means inheriting the main network's security and accessing an entire ecosystem, including liquidity and functionalities provided by other parachains via pallets or smart contracts. When developing a product on Polkadot, whether a dApp or an entire parachain, it is crucial to form partnerships and collaborations with other parachains to leverage their functionalities for a complete final product. Within the Polkadot ecosystem, there must be a balance between cooperation and competition among parachains. Cooperation enhances Polkadot's overall product value through the use of XCM and the composability of different parachains. Healthy competition among similar projects stimulates continuous improvement and attracts new teams to the ecosystem, fostering innovation.

To elevate the product offered by Polkadot, it is necessary to educate developers not only from a technical standpoint (Rust & Polkadot SDK) but also culturally, conveying the vision and the way of developing on Polkadot, highlighting the advantages and challenges of this method. Often, I notice that developers, probably because they are used to Ethereum, design dApps with a too narrow mindset, as if they only had the possibility to create dApps based on smart contracts operating on layer 2 that rarely communicate with each other (during execution). On Polkadot, however, the product being developed has the ability to interface with other products within the ecosystem, opening the door to a new (and certainly more complex) way of developing a Web3 product. I believe that on Polkadot we should focus on developing products that cannot be developed in other ecosystems, thus strongly based on the unique functionalities that Polkadot offers. In my opinion, those who develop on Polkadot with a focus on these concepts, as well as managing to create an abstraction that allows various users to interact with the project itself without necessarily knowing the technical details, or even knowing which network they are interacting with or what operations are being performed "under the hood," will be projects that, in my view, have excellent chances of success.

In addition to what has been mentioned, I am a supporter of fee-less chains and account abstraction, which I believe are crucial for the future adoption of blockchain technology. It is important to note that "fee-less" does not mean the chain is easily susceptible to spam; rather, it means the feeless system is managed in a specific way, based on the product offered and certain conditions.

In addition, I believe it is necessary to avoid creating new tokens unless they are strictly necessary for the project. Currently, there are too many tokens in circulation; a quick look at CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko reveals this. In most cases, tokens are created merely to finance projects or, worse, for fraudulent purposes. Aside from PoW systems, the primary role of a token in PoS systems is to secure the network. Polkadot’s shared security technology makes it unnecessary to have a separate token for securing its parachains (aka staking). If a native token is necessary, the DOT token could serve this purpose, providing additional benefits to DOT holders. For instance, the selection of collators could be managed through other methods, such as the PoL (Proof of Liquidity) model, which I find particularly interesting. Moreover, with a well-funded treasury willing to support valid projects, development can proceed without issuing new tokens. The team’s profits should come from the volume and revenue generated by the product itself rather than from token sales. This economic model, based on revenue proportional to the product’s success, is most suitable for treasury funding. The project team's profits would align with achieving specific usage volumes, matching the interests of the Polkadot community and treasury in supporting such products. Private investors can still play a role by providing liquidity or other services, being rewarded based on the project's success. It is also worth mentioning a new funding mechanism soon to be available on Polkadot, devised by [lolmcshizz](https://x.com/lolmcshizz/status/1808832287758237861), called "Optimistic Project Funding". This mechanism allows users to nominate whitelisted projects with their DOT. It will be funded with a constant stream of DOT taken directly from inflation and distributed to projects based on the proportion of DOT that has nominated them.

Obviously, these guidelines should not be seen as mandatory for all projects developing on Polkadot but rather as a guide for those projects that choose to fund most of their development through the treasury. Of course, there will always be the option to issue own token by accessing private funding methods, as has been the case in 99% of instances to date.

I am collaborating with a group of developers to create a project based on these principles using Polkadot SDK. Although I cannot provide specific details, I can say that it involves an existing Web2 application where blockchain can significantly enhance and improve an already widely-used type of products. This is a crucial point: many projects approach blockchain because it attracts attention, money, and investors, but often blockchain becomes an obstacle during product development, especially if the same product can function effectively without blockchain (even without compromises), or if adopted without considering the necessary requirements for it to function appropriately (decentralization, security, etc.).

I firmly believe in the principles outlined above, and I bring them with me when speaking at conferences, both on stage and at booths, with developers interested in creating their projects on Polkadot.

## My contributions in the Polkadot ecosystem

That said, let's return to my biography, specifically my involvement in the Polkadot community. Currently, I serve as a curator in three bounties: Marketing Bounty (technical curator), BD Bounty (technical curator), and Meetups Bounty. In the past, with Iceberg Nodes, I was a member (now former member) of the Dot Validator Alliance and Polkadot.Pro. Currently, I am a member of United Block (an alliance of validators and collators in the Polkadot ecosystem providing RPC services to various projects) and a member of Polkadot's 1KV program. Additionally, I am a friend of ChaosDAO members, participate in their public conversations, and Iceberg Nodes is on their trusted validators list.

My commitment to the Italian Polkadot community began in 2019 when the need arose to establish the Italian Polkadot group. Since then, I have been a co-founder of Polkadot Italia, which now has around 2000 members. I have also founded or become an admin in other Italian groups specific to various parachains. Below, you can find a list (some are very active, others less so, but overall they serve as a point of reference for the Italian community on Telegram regarding Polkadot):

- [Polkadot Network Italia](https://t.me/polkadotnetworkitalia) (now with topics activated)
- [Kusama Italia](https://t.me/kusama_italia) (read only as archive now —> added to Polkadot Italia group as topic)
- [Astar Network Italia 🇮🇹](https://t.me/AstarNetwork_IT)
- [Moonbeam in Italian](https://t.me/moonbeam_it)
- [BIFROST ITALIA](https://t.me/bifrostitalia)
- [Acurast Italia](https://t.me/acurast_italia) (NEW)
- [Manta & Calamari Network Italia](https://t.me/MantaCalamariNetworkItalia)
- [Substrate’s NFT & RMRK Italia](https://t.me/KANARIAsingularRMRKItalia)
- [ChainX & SherpaX Italia](https://t.me/Chainx_Italia)
- [Acala & Karura Italia](https://t.me/acalaitalia)
- [Polimec 🇮🇹 Italia (Unofficial)](https://t.me/PolimecItalia)
- [MNET Italia | NUUM & NEER (Previously Bit.Country Italia)](https://t.me/BitCountryItalianCommunity)
- [KILT Protocol Italia (Unofficial)](https://t.me/KILTProtocolItalia)
- [Zeitgeist PM Italia](https://t.me/ZeitgeistPMItalia)
- [Totem.Live Italy 🇮🇹](https://t.me/TotemLiveItalia)
- [OAK Network in Italiano](https://t.me/OAKitaliano)
- [Aventus Italia](https://t.me/AventusItalia)
- [Pendulum & Amplitude Italia](https://t.me/PendulumAmplitudeItalia)
- [Composable Finance & Picasso Italia](https://t.me/ComposableItalia)
- [Interlay | Kintsugi IT](https://t.me/Interlay_IT_Community)

In these groups, it is common to come across my voice messages, which can last several minutes, covering various topics related to the Polkadot world. These include comments on individual referendums, viewpoints on various articles, updates on new announcements made at Polkadot events, and more. I also regularly organize live sessions for in-depth discussions or updates on specific Polkadot-related topics.

![image](https://i.ibb.co/J77r20R/12522-Iceberg-Nodes-1721054345286.jpg)
> Probably, my voice messages about Polkadot even reached the ears of my girlfriend, who gifted me an handmade hoodie with the Polkadot logo.

Being not a developer, my “operative” contributions have been very limited, specifically:

- For the Polkadot.pro community: I developed a Telegram bot, which can be considered a precursor to the current [DozeNodes tool](https://www.dozenodes.com/polkadot). This bot showed the list of validator elections for Polkadot and Kusama, based on Phragmén's method.
- For the Kanaria (RMRK) community, a very pioneering NFT project based on the on-chain “graffiti” tech, which is very original though somewhat limited. I created a bot that allowed users to trade emoticons on their eggs without knowing each other, interacting asynchronously through a Telegram bot. This bot is no longer active, as it was specific to a certain phase of the project (the "emote" phase of the eggs), but it is still accessible and will respond with a greeting message: https://t.me/KanariaEmoteSwapsBot

![image](https://i.ibb.co/xXjsTVp/12522-Iceberg-Nodes-1721058286311.jpg)

Because I have held this role as a point of reference for the Italian Polkadot community over the years, and because I often manage various groups related to Polkadot and its parachains, I have been invited several times by Italian YouTubers (or so-called KOLs) to talk about Polkadot during their live sessions or recordings. Below, you can find a list of these interventions:

- [POLKADOT E KUSAMA: TUTTO quello che DEVI SAPERE ed è IN ARRIVO NEL 2023](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QdfOpi47iWw)
- [🔥 POLKADOT LIVE: QUALE FUTURO CI ATTENDE? 🔥 DOMANDE E RISPOSTE con LUCA POGGI - Polkadot Italia](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eWA8zxpb_JQ)
- [Il Salottino Crypto - I SEGRETI di POLKADOT - con Luca Poggi [S02E10]](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xA4db_beEfc)
- [POLKADOT RESUSCITA ? VIA A POLKADOT 2.0](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pvYStfehwXQ)
- [Polkadot a 360° | Aste :parachain | Podcast #1](https://youtu.be/D4oqvu2ZFiw?si=8lCk-vXGDLhIAB1l)
- [Polkadot...Futuro ed opportunità](https://open.spotify.com/episode/34BSZ0SWUPozHJmP8zQNLE)
- [Polkadot 2.0](https://open.spotify.com/episode/09SkIZEgzFaUYefav2Lc1I)
- [Crypto Royal Rumble (representing Polkadot)](https://open.spotify.com/episode/0iPsd5tkMKwggMhJvDiWQW)

![image](https://i.ibb.co/cyK66hf/12522-Iceberg-Nodes-1721058317968.jpg)

I have also participated as a guest at live events within the Polkadot ecosystem: Decoded 2023, Decoded 2024, Decentralize Lugano 2.0 edition 2023, Decentralized Lugano 3.0 edition 2024 by Scytale Digital. If my candidacy is successful, I will further commit to attending more Polkadot events worldwide.

In Italy, together with the team I am running with, we have organized several events where I have represented Polkadot both on stage and by answering questions from investors, developers, and users at our stand. So far, we have successfully participated as official Polkadot representatives (with an official stand and sponsorship) at three events: Blockchain Week Rome 2023 (BWR23), Crypto Expo Milan 2023 (CEM23), and the latest edition of Blockchain Week Rome 2024 (BWR24). We have two more events planned for this year, with possibly more if the candidacy is successful. These events featured Polkadot as an official sponsor with dedicated stands, stage speeches, and educational materials. You can find more information about these events in the links below:

- Blockchain Week Rome (BWR24): [video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TntU9D95iBI), [proposal](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1mfOTYrHMtwhfIQYJqqD6qLX7EoNFsgxGc1UCOOCvYM8/edit#heading=h.60kpsojh6qq)
- Crypto Expo Milan 2023 (CEM23): [report](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Rf1AggcQZzlQtSAQR3902Nrpux0-hTkvmuXkrp3XiIo/edit#heading=h.hl7w2z4ruzdk)
- Blockchain Week Rome 2023 (BWR23): [report](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1d1_G2ZSPoH2r3HHNc8VpFdza1ziNJlu-r512xgJyVq4/edit?usp=sharing)
- [Material for the events](https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1N-9WC8bEAFd9jcMhIR6LQIosyYFGFn58?usp=sharing)

![image](https://i.ibb.co/WxMDMn4/12522-Iceberg-Nodes-1721058433600.jpg)

## Additional Proof of Contribution as a Team

- https://x.com/PolkadotArena
- https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCgitG3HLQqjaNty_ab0opJw (recently opened)
- https://www.polkadotarena.blog/
- https://grillapp.net/@polkadotarena

## Motivations behind my candidacy as Head Ambassador

Since these activities are already underway, although not yet fully operational, my candidacy as a Polkadot Ambassador, supported by a team, aims to obtain an official title. This title will have significant value when interacting with companies, universities, government entities, and public administrations, giving us a different level of authority compared to presenting ourselves as simple community members. Additionally, the funds allocated for the HA salary will be used to support these activities, covering the necessary work hours by team members. This will allow us to plan and carry out activities in a structured and organized manner.

I am pleased to have submitted this candidacy, regardless of the outcome, because behind me there is a team of people who, like me, strongly believe in Polkadot's success. My candidacy also represents a way to recognize their contributions within the Polkadot ecosystem.

I apologize if I have taken the time to describe my vision and way of thinking within this candidacy text, but I believe it is an important element in evaluating a candidacy for the role of HA.

Regardless of the on-chain outcome of the proposal, I am pleased to have had the opportunity to share our reality. If you appreciate what you have read and believe that my candidacy has merit, I invite you to vote in favor. Conversely, feel free to vote against if you do not agree.

If you have any questions or comments, please do not hesitate to post them. I will make it a priority to respond as soon as possible. You can also contact me via DM if you prefer.

Enjoy your time within the Polkadot ecosystem.

Thank you all for taking the time to read this proposal!

NOTE: 13VMfHtAP8LgsK6CHSP6b6f31zuK837CBrFFdDa582HWXESJ ([@LucaPoggi](/user/LucaPoggi)) is the address object of the call of this referenda, as soon as the identities migration from Polkadot Relaychain to Polkadot People Sys Parachain is finished, sub-identity as "Luca Poggi" under super-identity "Iceberg Nodes" (14icei1ZMoG9QtKBFDk4y1eMR756q2TREuRAi2BanJ9MJVPL) will be set.

Head Ambassador Candidate: Luca Poggi  
Twitter: https://x.com/LucaPoggi7  
Telegram: https://t.me/LucaPoggi  
Discord: lucapoggi

![image](https://i.ibb.co/Qmrq5Fc/12522-Iceberg-Nodes-1721053430476.jpg)

Dear Polkadot community,

My name is Luca Poggi and I am excited to present my candidacy for the role of Head Ambassador in the Polkadot Ambassadors Program.

HA role demands dedication and a passion for promoting Polkadot, and together with my team, we are feeling ready to leverage our skills to enhance and strengthen Polkadot's presence in the blockchain world.

The team I have selected is composed of individuals who share my principles. They will be actively supporting and executing a range of activities (see list below). As Head Ambassador, my role will not only be active in performing proposed activities, but also in representing and managing the activities, as well as being responsible for the entire group’s performance.

## Proposed Activities

### Business Development:

- Promoting partnerships with companies (B2B), universities, institutions and governative entities (B2G) to incorporate Polkadot into their activities, expanding use cases, showcase the ability to implement essential services in a sustainable and secure way, while increasing the adoption of Polkadot and its entire ecosystem.
- Providing technical assistance and advice to subjects interested in adopting Polkadot technology and/or deploying their project in the ecosystem.
- Participation in sector events and trade fairs to stay up to date with market needs and be able to offer a product that best suits demand, as well as getting to know new companies, subjects and possible users.
- Provide feedback on the services and products provided by Polkadot, based on the experience of use by companies and users, directly to the technical fellowship and to the entire community of Polkadot developers.

### Events and Initiatives

- Participate as official representatives of Polkadot in blockchain-related events on Italian territory.
- Planning and organizing hackathons and workshops throughout Italy to promote Polkadot to the community developers and supporting the creation and management of study groups and hands-on workshops for advanced technical training.
- Managing media relations to ensure positive and consistent coverage of Polkadot.
- Creating promotional and informational content for various communication channels.

### Education and Evangelism:

- Creating and managing technical content (posts, threads and tutorials) on social media (Twitter, Telegram and Medium) in order to explain complex concepts in a simple and accessible way.
- Organize periodic live video calls and AMAs to discuss and keep the Polkadot community updated on the latest news.
- Carry out classroom lessons at universities, schools and company courses about Polkadot technology.

### Community Building:

- Management of the Polkadot Italian community on Telegram, creating a welcoming and informative environment for members.
- Managing dedicated social channels (on X and YouTube) to facilitate discussion and exchange of ideas.
- Organizing local and national meetups to promote networking among Polkadot enthusiasts.
- Engaging influencers and key figures in the blockchain world to amplify Polkadot's visibility.

…and obviously…

### Ambassador typical activities:

- Participate in Polkadot events around the world
- Attend HA meetings and participate in discussions in public groups
- Provide help and collaborate in shaping the new ambassadors program
- Collaborate with other HAs on projects where cooperation can lead to a more effective, competitive, and streamlined process

## Compensation Breakdown

The HA, together with the team members, ensures a minimum monthly engagement in the proposed activities equivalent to full-time capacity, in accordance with [referenda 487](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/referenda/487). This is the minimum guaranteed condition, to be considered as the sum of the hours of activities carried out during the month by the team members. In reality, I expect that the hours dedicated to such activities, by proposing ourselves as a team, will generally exceed the minimum threshold by a consistent amount.

The monthly amount received by the HA:

- A small part (if needed), about 0-20%, will be allocated to an internal treasury, managed by the HA, which will cover possible reimbursements for HA travel expenses, costs related to work tools, and other minor expenses;
- 80-100% will be allocated to pay for the hours worked on the proposed activities, by HA and team members.

For any other expenses not falling into the categories mentioned above, a reimbursement request will be made to the ambassadors program treasury or specific on-chain bounties. In both cases, no administration or own fees will ever be counted; the expenses we will allocate in requests to the ambassador's treasury or bounties will only be out-of-pocket expenses such as the cost of sponsorship at an event.

A non-profit association will be established to manage all expenses in compliance with Italian regulations.

## Activities Track Records

In accordance with the motto “Don’t trust, verify” widely used in the Web3 world, we will provide a tool, in particular a public page of our internal Notion database (unfortunately, we do not have an equally practical Web3 tool), where all activities carried out will be detailed along with the hours dedicated to each of them. This page will be periodically updated and can be publicly viewed by anyone. This will also simplify the reporting process as a requirement of the ambassador's program.

## My background in the Polkadot ecosystem

Some of you may already know me, while for others this might be the first time. In other cases, the reputation of Iceberg Nodes probably precedes me. Here is my story.

I've been in the crypto space since summer 2014 and active in the Polkadot and Kusama ecosystem since 2019. I’m an early investor in DOT, and this gave me the opportunity to focus my energies and dedicate a lot of time in studying the technology, understanding the principles and seeing all the improvements since before the launch of Kusama (yeah there were already some Substrate projects around), until nowadays. Starting from mid 2022, I left my previous job in the welding manufacturing and certification field (I hold a bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering, a master’s degree in mechatronics engineering and a post master’s degree as International Welding Engineer), to become a full time crypto boy.

I’m the founder of Iceberg Nodes which provides secure non-custodial staking services in a total of more than 40 different networks, 95% of them as validators on relaychains, validators on standalone Substrate based chains and collators on parachains (also in 5 system parachains), so highly focused in the Polkadot ecosystem. My involvement in the ecosystem has also increased in having “skin in the game” as seed and private investor in some of the new Polkadot ecosystem projects, having invested in such sales almost $1.5M during the last one year period.

## …but wait…let me explain about my Polkadot Vision!

But before continuing with the story of my journey within Polkadot, I would like to take a moment to share my thoughts on Polkadot. I believe that, for a Head Ambassador, it is crucial to fully understand the true technology of Polkadot, its role, and, most importantly, to be able to effectively communicate this to the audience.

What do I think about Polkadot? I am a strong supporter of modular scalability, and consequently, scalability based on sharding. I firmly believe that the scalability offered by Polkadot is the only one capable of achieving true scalability in the blockchain world.

- [Polkadot Network Italia](https://t.me/polkadotnetworkitalia) (now with topics activated)

- [Pendulum & Amplitude Italia](https://t.me/PendulumAmplitudeItalia)
- [Composable Finance & Picasso Italia](https://t.me/ComposableItalia)
- [Interlay | Kintsugi IT](https://t.me/Interlay_IT_Community)

In these groups, it is common to come across my voice messages, which can last several minutes, covering various topics related to the Polkadot world. These include comments on individual referendums, viewpoints on various articles, updates on new announcements made at Polkadot events, and more. I also regularly organize live sessions for in-depth discussions or updates on specific Polkadot-related topics.

![image](https://i.ibb.co/J77r20R/12522-Iceberg-Nodes-1721054345286.jpg)
> Probably, my voice messages about Polkadot even reached the ears of my girlfriend, who gifted me an handmade hoodie with the Polkadot logo.

Being not a developer, my “operative” contributions have been very limited, specifically:

- For the Polkadot.pro community: I developed a Telegram bot, which can be considered a precursor to the current [DozeNodes tool](https://www.dozenodes.com/polkadot). This bot showed the list of validator elections for Polkadot and Kusama, based on Phragmén's method.
- For the Kanaria (RMRK) community, a very pioneering NFT project based on the on-chain “graffiti” tech, which is very original though somewhat limited. I created a bot that allowed users to trade emoticons on their eggs without knowing each other, interacting asynchronously through a Telegram bot. This bot is no longer active, as it was specific to a certain phase of the project (the "emote" phase of the eggs), but it is still accessible and will respond with a greeting message: https://t.me/KanariaEmoteSwapsBot

![image](https://i.ibb.co/xXjsTVp/12522-Iceberg-Nodes-1721058286311.jpg)

Because I have held this role as a point of reference for the Italian Polkadot community over the years, and because I often manage various groups related to Polkadot and its parachains, I have been invited several times by Italian YouTubers (or so-called KOLs) to talk about Polkadot during their live sessions or recordings. Below, you can find a list of these interventions:

- [POLKADOT E KUSAMA: TUTTO quello che DEVI SAPERE ed è IN ARRIVO NEL 2023](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QdfOpi47iWw)
- [🔥 POLKADOT LIVE: QUALE FUTURO CI ATTENDE? 🔥 DOMANDE E RISPOSTE con LUCA POGGI - Polkadot Italia](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eWA8zxpb_JQ)
- [Il Salottino Crypto - I SEGRETI di POLKADOT - con Luca Poggi [S02E10]](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xA4db_beEfc)
- [POLKADOT RESUSCITA ? VIA A POLKADOT 2.0](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pvYStfehwXQ)
- [Polkadot a 360° | Aste :parachain | Podcast #1](https://youtu.be/D4oqvu2ZFiw?si=8lCk-vXGDLhIAB1l)
- [Polkadot...Futuro ed opportunità](https://open.spotify.com/episode/34BSZ0SWUPozHJmP8zQNLE)
- [Polkadot 2.0](https://open.spotify.com/episode/09SkIZEgzFaUYefav2Lc1I)
- [Crypto Royal Rumble (representing Polkadot)](https://open.spotify.com/episode/0iPsd5tkMKwggMhJvDiWQW)

![image](https://i.ibb.co/cyK66hf/12522-Iceberg-Nodes-1721058317968.jpg)

I have also participated as a guest at live events within the Polkadot ecosystem: Decoded 2023, Decoded 2024, Decentralize Lugano 2.0 edition 2023, Decentralized Lugano 3.0 edition 2024 by Scytale Digital. If my candidacy is successful, I will further commit to attending more Polkadot events worldwide.

In Italy, together with the team I am running with, we have organized several events where I have represented Polkadot both on stage and by answering questions from investors, developers, and users at our stand. So far, we have successfully participated as official Polkadot representatives (with an official stand and sponsorship) at three events: Blockchain Week Rome 2023 (BWR23), Crypto Expo Milan 2023 (CEM23), and the latest edition of Blockchain Week Rome 2024 (BWR24). We have two more events planned for this year, with possibly more if the candidacy is successful. These events featured Polkadot as an official sponsor with dedicated stands, stage speeches, and educational materials. You can find more information about these events in the links below:

- Blockchain Week Rome (BWR24): [video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TntU9D95iBI), [proposal](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1mfOTYrHMtwhfIQYJqqD6qLX7EoNFsgxGc1UCOOCvYM8/edit#heading=h.60kpsojh6qq)
- Crypto Expo Milan 2023 (CEM23): [report](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Rf1AggcQZzlQtSAQR3902Nrpux0-hTkvmuXkrp3XiIo/edit#heading=h.hl7w2z4ruzdk)
- Blockchain Week Rome 2023 (BWR23): [report](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1d1_G2ZSPoH2r3HHNc8VpFdza1ziNJlu-r512xgJyVq4/edit?usp=sharing)
- [Material for the events](https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1N-9WC8bEAFd9jcMhIR6LQIosyYFGFn58?usp=sharing)

![image](https://i.ibb.co/WxMDMn4/12522-Iceberg-Nodes-1721058433600.jpg)

## Additional Proof of Contribution as a Team

- https://x.com/PolkadotArena
- https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCgitG3HLQqjaNty_ab0opJw (recently opened)
- https://www.polkadotarena.blog/
- https://grillapp.net/@polkadotarena

## Motivations behind my candidacy as Head Ambassador

Since these activities are already underway, although not yet fully operational, my candidacy as a Polkadot Ambassador, supported by a team, aims to obtain an official title. This title will have significant value when interacting with companies, universities, government entities, and public administrations, giving us a different level of authority compared to presenting ourselves as simple community members. Additionally, the funds allocated for the HA salary will be used to support these activities, covering the necessary work hours by team members. This will allow us to plan and carry out activities in a structured and organized manner.

I am pleased to have submitted this candidacy, regardless of the outcome, because behind me there is a team of people who, like me, strongly believe in Polkadot's success. My candidacy also represents a way to recognize their contributions within the Polkadot ecosystem.

I apologize if I have taken the time to describe my vision and way of thinking within this candidacy text, but I believe it is an important element in evaluating a candidacy for the role of HA.

Regardless of the on-chain outcome of the proposal, I am pleased to have had the opportunity to share our reality. If you appreciate what you have read and believe that my candidacy has merit, I invite you to vote in favor. Conversely, feel free to vote against if you do not agree.

If you have any questions or comments, please do not hesitate to post them. I will make it a priority to respond as soon as possible. You can also contact me via DM if you prefer.

Enjoy your time within the Polkadot ecosystem.

Thank you all for taking the time to read this proposal!
history.title: Polkadot Head Ambassador Application: Luca Poggi

history.content:
Head Ambassador Candidate: Luca Poggi  
Twitter: https://x.com/LucaPoggi7  
Telegram: https://t.me/LucaPoggi  
Discord: lucapoggi

![image](https://i.ibb.co/Qmrq5Fc/12522-Iceberg-Nodes-1721053430476.jpg)

Dear Polkadot community,

My name is Luca Poggi and I am excited to present my candidacy for the role of Head Ambassador in the Polkadot Ambassadors Program.

HA role demands dedication and a passion for promoting Polkadot, and together with my team, we are feeling ready to leverage our skills to enhance and strengthen Polkadot's presence in the blockchain world.

The team I have selected is composed of individuals who share my principles. They will be actively supporting and executing a range of activities (see list below). As Head Ambassador, my role will not only be active in performing proposed activities, but also in representing and managing the activities, as well as being responsible for the entire group’s performance.

## Proposed Activities

### Business Development:

- Promoting partnerships with companies (B2B), universities, institutions and governative entities (B2G) to incorporate Polkadot into their activities, expanding use cases, showcase the ability to implement essential services in a sustainable and secure way, while increasing the adoption of Polkadot and its entire ecosystem.

- Providing technical assistance and advice to subjects interested in adopting Polkadot technology and/or deploying their project in the ecosystem.

- Participation in sector events and trade fairs to stay up to date with market needs and be able to offer a product that best suits demand, as well as getting to know new companies, subjects and possible users.

- Provide feedback on the services and products provided by Polkadot, based on the experience of use by companies and users, directly to the technical fellowship and to the entire community of Polkadot developers.

### Events and Initiatives

- Participate as official representatives of Polkadot in blockchain-related events on Italian territory.

- Planning and organizing hackathons and workshops throughout Italy to promote Polkadot to the community developers and supporting the creation and management of study groups and hands-on workshops for advanced technical training.

- Managing media relations to ensure positive and consistent coverage of Polkadot.

- Creating promotional and informational content for various communication channels.

### Education and Evangelism:

- Creating and managing technical content (posts, threads and tutorials) on social media (Twitter, Telegram and Medium) in order to explain complex concepts in a simple and accessible way.

- Organize periodic live video calls and AMAs to discuss and keep the Polkadot community updated on the latest news.

- Carry out classroom lessons at universities, schools and company courses about Polkadot technology.

### Community Building:

- Management of the Polkadot Italian community on Telegram, creating a welcoming and informative environment for members.

- Managing dedicated social channels (on X and YouTube) to facilitate discussion and exchange of ideas.

- Organizing local and national meetups to promote networking among Polkadot enthusiasts.

- Engaging influencers and key figures in the blockchain world to amplify Polkadot's visibility.

…and obviously…

### Ambassador typical activities:

- Participate in Polkadot events around the world

- Attend HA meetings and participate in discussions in public groups

- Provide help and collaborate in shaping the new ambassadors program

- Collaborate with other HAs on projects where cooperation can lead to a more effective, competitive, and streamlined process

## Compensation Breakdown

The HA, together with the team members, ensures a minimum monthly engagement in the proposed activities equivalent to full-time capacity, in accordance with [referenda 487](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/referenda/487). This is the minimum guaranteed condition, to be considered as the sum of the hours of activities carried out during the month by the team members. In reality, I expect that the hours dedicated to such activities, by proposing ourselves as a team, will generally exceed the minimum threshold by a consistent amount.

The monthly amount received by the HA:

- A small part (if needed), about 0-20%, will be allocated to an internal treasury, managed by the HA, which will cover possible reimbursements for HA travel expenses, costs related to work tools, and other minor expenses;

- 80-100% will be allocated to pay for the hours worked on the proposed activities, by HA and team members.

For any other expenses not falling into the categories mentioned above, a reimbursement request will be made to the ambassadors program treasury or specific on-chain bounties. In both cases, no administration or own fees will ever be counted; the expenses we will allocate in requests to the ambassador's treasury or bounties will only be out-of-pocket expenses such as the cost of sponsorship at an event.

A non-profit association will be established to manage all expenses in compliance with Italian regulations.

## Activities Track Records

In accordance with the motto “Don’t trust, verify” widely used in the Web3 world, we will provide a tool, in particular a public page of our internal Notion database (unfortunately, we do not have an equally practical Web3 tool), where all activities carried out will be detailed along with the hours dedicated to each of them. This page will be periodically updated and can be publicly viewed by anyone. This will also simplify the reporting process as a requirement of the ambassador's program.

## My background in the Polkadot ecosystem

Some of you may already know me, while for others this might be the first time. In other cases, the reputation of Iceberg Nodes probably precedes me. Here is my story.

I've been in the crypto space since summer 2014 and active in the Polkadot and Kusama ecosystem since 2019. I’m an early investor in DOT, and this gave me the opportunity to focus my energies and dedicate a lot of time in studying the technology, understanding the principles and seeing all the improvements since before the launch of Kusama (yeah there were already some Substrate projects around), until nowadays. Starting from mid 2022, I left my previous job in the welding manufacturing and certification field (I hold a bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering, a master’s degree in mechatronics engineering and a post master’s degree as International Welding Engineer), to become a full time crypto boy.

I’m the founder of Iceberg Nodes which provides secure non-custodial staking services in a total of more than 40 different networks, 95% of them as validators on relaychains, validators on standalone Substrate based chains and collators on parachains (also in 5 system parachains), so highly focused in the Polkadot ecosystem. My involvement in the ecosystem has also increased in having “skin in the game” as seed and private investor in some of the new Polkadot ecosystem projects, having invested in such sales almost $1.5M during the last one year period.

## …but wait…let me explain about my Polkadot Vision!

But before continuing with the story of my journey within Polkadot, I would like to take a moment to share my thoughts on Polkadot. I believe that, for a Head Ambassador, it is crucial to fully understand the true technology of Polkadot, its role, and, most importantly, to be able to effectively communicate this to the audience.

What do I think about Polkadot? I am a strong supporter of modular scalability, and consequently, scalability based on sharding. I firmly believe that the scalability offered by Polkadot is the only one capable of achieving true scalability in the blockchain world.

To fully understand Polkadot, one must first understand what a parachain (or if you want “appchain”) is at the end. A parachain is a chain with specific functionalities, specialized in a particular use case. This is where the magic of Polkadot lies. Developing on Polkadot means inheriting the main network's security and accessing an entire ecosystem, including liquidity and functionalities provided by other parachains via pallets or smart contracts. When developing a product on Polkadot, whether a dApp or an entire parachain, it is crucial to form partnerships and collaborations with other parachains to leverage their functionalities for a complete final product. Within the Polkadot ecosystem, there must be a balance between cooperation and competition among parachains. Cooperation enhances Polkadot's overall product value through the use of XCM and the composability of different parachains. Healthy competition among similar projects stimulates continuous improvement and attracts new teams to the ecosystem, fostering innovation.

To elevate the product offered by Polkadot, it is necessary to educate developers not only from a technical standpoint (Rust & Polkadot SDK) but also culturally, conveying the vision and the way of developing on Polkadot, highlighting the advantages and challenges of this method. Often, I notice that developers, probably because they are used to Ethereum, design dApps with a too narrow mindset, as if they only had the possibility to create dApps based on smart contracts operating on layer 2 that rarely communicate with each other (during execution). On Polkadot, however, the product being developed has the ability to interface with other products within the ecosystem, opening the door to a new (and certainly more complex) way of developing a Web3 product. I believe that on Polkadot we should focus on developing products that cannot be developed in other ecosystems, thus strongly based on the unique functionalities that Polkadot offers. In my opinion, those who develop on Polkadot with a focus on these concepts, as well as managing to create an abstraction that allows various users to interact with the project itself without necessarily knowing the technical details, or even knowing which network they are interacting with or what operations are being performed "under the hood," will be projects that, in my view, have excellent chances of success.

In addition to what has been mentioned, I am a supporter of fee-less chains and account abstraction, which I believe are crucial for the future adoption of blockchain technology. It is important to note that "fee-less" does not mean the chain is easily susceptible to spam; rather, it means the feeless system is managed in a specific way, based on the product offered and certain conditions.

In addition, I believe it is necessary to avoid creating new tokens unless they are strictly necessary for the project. Currently, there are too many tokens in circulation; a quick look at CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko reveals this. In most cases, tokens are created merely to finance projects or, worse, for fraudulent purposes. Aside from PoW systems, the primary role of a token in PoS systems is to secure the network. Polkadot’s shared security technology makes it unnecessary to have a separate token for securing its parachains (aka staking). If a native token is necessary, the DOT token could serve this purpose, providing additional benefits to DOT holders. For instance, the selection of collators could be managed through other methods, such as the PoL (Proof of Liquidity) model, which I find particularly interesting. Moreover, with a well-funded treasury willing to support valid projects, development can proceed without issuing new tokens. The team’s profits should come from the volume and revenue generated by the product itself rather than from token sales. This economic model, based on revenue proportional to the product’s success, is most suitable for treasury funding. The project team's profits would align with achieving specific usage volumes, matching the interests of the Polkadot community and treasury in supporting such products. Private investors can still play a role by providing liquidity or other services, being rewarded based on the project's success. It is also worth mentioning a new funding mechanism soon to be available on Polkadot, devised by [lolmcshizz](https://x.com/lolmcshizz/status/1808832287758237861), called "Optimistic Project Funding". This mechanism allows users to nominate whitelisted projects with their DOT. It will be funded with a constant stream of DOT taken directly from inflation and distributed to projects based on the proportion of DOT that has nominated them.

Obviously, these guidelines should not be seen as mandatory for all projects developing on Polkadot but rather as a guide for those projects that choose to fund most of their development through the treasury. Of course, there will always be the option to issue own token by accessing private funding methods, as has been the case in 99% of instances to date.

I am collaborating with a group of developers to create a project based on these principles using Polkadot SDK. Although I cannot provide specific details, I can say that it involves an existing Web2 application where blockchain can significantly enhance and improve an already widely-used type of products. This is a crucial point: many projects approach blockchain because it attracts attention, money, and investors, but often blockchain becomes an obstacle during product development, especially if the same product can function effectively without blockchain (even without compromises), or if adopted without considering the necessary requirements for it to function appropriately (decentralization, security, etc.).

I firmly believe in the principles outlined above, and I bring them with me when speaking at conferences, both on stage and at booths, with developers interested in creating their projects on Polkadot.

## My contributions in the Polkadot ecosystem

That said, let's return to my biography, specifically my involvement in the Polkadot community. Currently, I serve as a curator in three bounties: Marketing Bounty (technical curator), BD Bounty (technical curator), and Meetups Bounty. In the past, with Iceberg Nodes, I was a member (now former member) of the Dot Validator Alliance and Polkadot.Pro. Currently, I am a member of United Block (an alliance of validators and collators in the Polkadot ecosystem providing RPC services to various projects) and a member of Polkadot's 1KV program. Additionally, I am a friend of ChaosDAO members, participate in their public conversations, and Iceberg Nodes is on their trusted validators list.

My commitment to the Italian Polkadot community began in 2019 when the need arose to establish the Italian Polkadot group. Since then, I have been a co-founder of Polkadot Italia, which now has around 2000 members. I have also founded or become an admin in other Italian groups specific to various parachains. Below, you can find a list (some are very active, others less so, but overall they serve as a point of reference for the Italian community on Telegram regarding Polkadot):

- [Polkadot Network Italia](https://t.me/polkadotnetworkitalia) (now with topics activated)
- [Kusama Italia](https://t.me/kusama_italia) (read only as archive now —> added to Polkadot Italia group as topic)
- [Astar Network Italia 🇮🇹](https://t.me/AstarNetwork_IT)
- [Moonbeam in Italian](https://t.me/moonbeam_it)
- [BIFROST ITALIA](https://t.me/bifrostitalia)

items.title: Polkadot Head Ambassador - Alice und Bob
items.content:
(resubmission because the first preimage was bad)

**Good Morning!**

I am **Tommi Enenkel**, also known as **Alice und Bob** ([Twitter](https://twitter.com/alice_und_bob), [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC0alQ35JKnMo_ctzYITthbw), [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/tommi-enenkel/)). This is my application as Polkadot Head Ambassador.

## Background

In Polkadot, I co-founded [ChaosDAO](https://twitter.com/ChaosDAO) and [OpenGov.Watch](http://OpenGov.Watch). I am a Web3 strategist specializing in ecosystem development, governance, analytics, and crypto-economics. I previously held CIO and CMO roles and have a systems architecture and political communications background. I hold an MSc in Knowledge Management and IT Security. My master’s thesis explored agile software development and governance practices in open-source communities.

## My previous work for Polkadot

**Some highlights:**

- Curating a decentralized [Polkadot 2.0 Strategy](https://www.notion.so/Polkadot-2-0-Strategy-264b338f38184248acbf630879f8386f?pvs=21) to ensure that all essential functions for growing the ecosystem are covered and we develop a shared direction
- Representation at conferences/events such as Polkadot Decoded, Sub0, Parachain Summit, DOTBrno, DOTPrague, and local meetups
- Lecturing at the Polkadot Blockchain Academy on the topics of OpenGov and Tokenomics
- Moderating the monthly Technical Fellowship OpenDev call
- Co-Founded ChaosDAO

I am curating a dedicated page with more info about my portfolio. Check it out here:

[Portfolio Tommi](https://www.notion.so/Portfolio-Tommi-822c27eb404941a3a7959a35b805d81d?pvs=21) 

## How I see the Head Ambassador Role

Things I expect from Head Ambassadors:

- Role model: Authentically represent the values and virtues of Polkadot and Web3
- Evangelist: Be in the field (online and offline) and campaign for Polkadot
- Mentor: Personally help ambassadors and community members better understand Polkadot and empower them to represent it to others.
- Magician: Understand that your actions are the cause for new things to happen. A single conversation can spark a new project create a lead for a new deal or inspire someone to achieve great things. Actively use your powers to make good things happen.

As such, these are also the things I strive to do.

## My Offer as Head Ambassador

- **Shape the Ambassador program:** Old and new ambassadors are coming together to create something great. I want to help shape the program and set it up to become a successful organization. Head Ambassadors have to work as a team, so we need to establish the proper culture from the start. Different Head Ambassadors have different strengths, so I will offer mine and look for the strengths of others.
- **Teach Web3 values:** I am a fundamentals guy. The tech is changing the world, no matter how much degens cry about prices and the latest hot shit, etc... I educate about why we build Web3 and connect the dots to the bigger themes. This is not only important for newbies, but especially for everyone deciding to “grow up” and take Web3 seriously. Mentoring people on this journey takes time and we need to commit to giving ambassadors the time and attention they deserve on their path.
- **Ambass:** At the moment, I represent Polkadot mostly via Social Media (Twitter, a bit of LinkedIn) and through irregular video production.
    - **Video Production:** If elected Head Ambassador, my main focus for evangelization would be through content production. I would ramp up my video production again to regularly produce videos on fundamental questions and educational topics in the Polkadot space. The themes would be the current big discussions of Polkadot since I believe that agenda-setting and influencing the narrative is a core responsibility for ambassadors.
    - **Conferences/Events:** I also represent Polkadot on stage at conferences as opportunities open up. My main topics are introductions to Polkadot, Polkadot Strategy, and OpenGov.
    - **Business Development:** I have 2 years of Web3 BD experience, but wouldn’t make it an emphasis of my term. I believe quite a few other HA candidates are better able to serve the time required to do proper BD. My focus here would be to capture leads when they present themselves and then relay them to the relevant parties. One way I proactively approach in small but hopefully effective ways is that I throw out ideas that I think OpenGov would fund if someone bites help them move along (for example here baiting with a [Cardano-Polkadot](https://x.com/alice_und_bob/status/1786145294536643038) bridge and then supporting the project once it starts [here](https://forum.polkadot.network/t/cardano-polkadot-bridge/8543))

## Modalities

### Compensation

At the moment, I have a contract with the Web3 Foundation as part of Decentralized Futures and I do not require additional pay. Under the current situation, I would not use the compensation as salary. I would only use it to pay for operational costs like content production & traveling to events where I represent Polkadot. The primary focus would be to hire a video producer to ramp up production.

### Available Time

I work exclusively for Polkadot. I consider my main line of work at the moment as ecosystem development, which consists of solving problems, analyzing things, and sharing knowledge.

I spend significant time preparing and presenting presentations for conferences as well as agenda-setting and narrative development on Twitter, so imo there is a strong synergy to the role. I believe that the Ambassador program is very important for the community development of Polkadot and will provide the time that the role requires to help it come to fruition.

If it turns out that my other responsibilities are not compatible time-wise or a larger part of the community is not happy with my performance, I will offer the place to someone else.

I am in the process of proposing a new Ecosystem Development Collective which I hope to co-lead. Should that situation become a reality and be incompatible with the HA role, I will also give the HA spot to the next candidate.

items.title: Polkadot Head Ambassador Application with focus on China Market - Siyu Liu
items.content:
Dear Polkadot community,
 
I am Siyu Liu, and this is my application for the position of Polkadot Head Ambassador.
 
![](https://i.ibb.co/9TzvxMs/Wechat-IMG48.jpg)
 
I hold a master degree of finance from Peking University and I’m also a graduate of Polkadot Blockchain Academy in Hong Kong. I entered the web3 industry in 2017 and have been engaged in investment and incubation in the web3 industry. I founded an incubator called Web3Link, which is committed to helping blockchain projects in providing one-stop solutions such as fund-raising, marketing, community-operating, and listing.
 
Our recent incubated projects include:
 
Nebula Revelation (web3 space-themed open world game, X:@NBLGAME, www.nebularevelation.com),
 
VoiceStreet (music-based gamefi metaverse game, X:@VS_ArkOfPanda, www.arkofpanda.vsnft.org),
 
Trendx (web3 investment information platform, X:Trendx_offical, www.app.trendx.tech), etc.
 
Every year, more than 100 projects apply to join the web3link incubator, which has become the vantage for my applying for Polkadot Head Ambassador -- bringing more projects to the Polkadot ecosystem.
 
 
**Why choose me?**
 
**1**. Chinese people have always been important participants in the Polkadot ecosystem. In Polkadot ecosystem, there have been a large number of Chinese founders and developers, as well as many believers and holders from China. However, the market popularity of Polkadot in China has declined since the Polkadot Parachain Auction.
 
As an early holder of dot, I have never sold my dot and have actively participated in staking on Acala, Bifrost and Parallel (12uMmwxjpbntEkvfHDgb9Kdpeo98LNsj7KRLKMMqq4BdG5Qz). As most dot holders, I believe that Polkadot will definitely gain higher market popularity and project participation than before the Parachain Auction.
 
Such expectancy is closely related to the prosperity of the Chinese market. I have the ability to assist Polkadot to business-develop more Chinese founders through incubators and recruit them into the Polkadot ecosystem.
 
**2**. Web3link and I have established an investment alliance consisting of dozens of investment institutions including Binance Labs, OKX Ventures, Hashkey Capital, etc., which will provide financing docking for the projects in Polkadot ecosystem and the projects that are about to enter the ecosystem. Obtaining funds is extremely important for every project founder, but it is our advantage. We can effectively help project founders obtain funds quickly.

![](https://i.ibb.co/mzW4R3h/Wechat-IMG55.jpg)
 
**3**. We can provide a series of technical courses for the founders selected for the incubator, can invite founders from Polkadot ecosystem and Oneblock+ developer community members to give lectures, to explain Polkadot's technical route, and to guide them to use Polkadot SDK for their projects. We can also provide these project founders with courses in financing, marketing and legal compliance, to make Web3link a Chinese version of Polkadot Blockchain Academy.
 
**4**. I have established a community containing hundreds of Chinese KOLs, and [here is a list of KOLs](https://docs.google.com/document/d/10ajjLsfTk8k_d1FT4yhNGVdWtimvWPzcz5A-zJ90y24/edit). This community can effectively help Polkadot increase exposure and publicity.
 
**5**.I am also an entrepreneur in the field of Fintech. In 2017, I was selected into the Forbes 30 Under 30 China List. I founded the Angelstreet in 2014, which was one of the earliest equity crowdfunding platforms in China. It helped more than 50 projects to obtain equity crowdfunding financing.
 
![](https://i.ibb.co/tYVCF00/Wechat-IMG53.jpg)
 
In 2015, I founded Credit Wallet, which was based on Finance + AI. It used tens of thousands of risk factors and risk control models to quickly evaluate users' credit, helping most Chinese people without credit records to obtain financial services. It helped more than 5 million users. The entrepreneurial experience in the field of Fintech has made me better understand how to help a project from 0 to 1. I also hope to bring my successful experience in web2 to web3 to achieve mass adoption of the Polkadot.
 
**In addition**, I also want to deploy a project I founded, "Postman Protocol", in the Polkadot ecosystem. Postman Protocol is a new email service protocol that combines blockchain technology and traditional SMTP protocol, aiming to improve the security, privacy protection and user experience of email transmission. Through innovations such as decentralized account management, peer-to-peer encryption and blockchain stamps, the protocol solves the challenge of security vulnerabilities and efficiency issues in current email services, and promotes the development of the ecosystem through token incentives. [Here is the white paper of "Postman Protocol"](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-fVlpemb4wkmfMrnLGjbJZQZUs8tfp-xOf_ArD1Mluw/edit), and I hope to get your suggestions.
 
**Work Agenda Summary**
 
• Represent Polkadot to participate in activities in China and ASEAN.
 
• Hold Polkadot technology meetings every month to guide more developers and entrepreneurs to join the Polkadot ecosystem.
 
• Establish Polkadot China Incubator to provide systematic blockchain courses for project founders who join the incubator, and help them raise funds, build teams, and enter the secondary market.
 
• Business-develop more mature blockchain projects into the Polkadot ecosystem.
 
• Business-develop more Chinese KOLs to participate in discussions on the Polkadot ecosystem, to bring more media and community exposure, and to develop more Dot holders from China.
 
• Connect Polkadot with the Hong Kong government.
 
**Conclusion**
 
My purpose of becoming the Polkadot Head Ambassador is very clear, which is to develop the chinese market for Polkadot. I will not only help One Block+ attract more developers, but also help them use Polkadot SDK to start projects, build teams, obtain financing, and enter the secondary market. Meanwhile, I will also hold Polkadot technical meetings in China every month to increase the exposure of Polkadot in China and to create a more prosperous Polkadot supporter community.
 
I am a dot holder, and now I need the support of holders. I can be contacted at any time on Tg: @yuge18 or X: @yuge188.
 
Warm regards, Siyu Liu

items.title: Proposal to the Polkadot Community - Dustin Plantholt for Head Ambassador
items.content:
Hi - My name is Dustin Plantholt, an accomplished media professional, and blockchain advocate. From my early years in foster care to becoming an internationally recognized leader, I have developed strengths in media and posses a unique ability to make complex concepts understandable. It is with heartfelt enthusiasm that I submit my proposal to be considered for the position of Head Ambassador for the Polkadot community.

About me

• Host of ‘Free Your Voice’ TV show airing on five stations across the US, reaching over 3,000,000 households weekly. This platform offers extensive visibility for Polkadot.

• Knight of the Order of Prince Danilo I of Montenegro and Knight Commander of the Order of Merit of the Portuguese Royal House,  and a 32nd Degree Scottish Rite Freemason reflecting my dedication to impactful initiatives. 

• Interviewed over 400 extraordinary individuals, including celebrities and CEOs such as Justin Sun, Tim Draper, Roger Ver, Jed McCaleb, the late John McAfee, Lou Ferrigno “The Incredible Hulk,” Daymond John, and many more.

• Successfully exited three startups, including two in the insurance industry and the media platform LifesTough.com.

• Published a Crypto Comic Book, hosted Forbes Monaco TV, and served as an Executive Producer for Amazon Prime Documentaries and the film “Cryptonaires.”

• Forbes Live Events Moderator: Official moderator for Forbes live events, engaging with top-tier business and technology leaders.

• Registered Lobbyist: US House and Senate, advocating for technological and blockchain advancements.

• Senior Editor: CoinTelegraph MENA and Robb Report Monaco, driving blockchain and luxury brand narratives.

• Metaverse Advisor of the Year by Entrepreneur.com MENA.

• Forbes Monaco’s 40 under 40 and “The Count of Monte Crypto” for significant contributions to cryptocurrency.

• Associate Professor: Teaching Cryptocurrency Finance, fostering the next generation of blockchain experts.
