history.content:
**Polkadot Head Ambassador of East Asia: Team SubStake (Rhee & Raf)**

Greetings Polkadot!

**- Who is Rhee? -**
My name is "Rhee" (ex-Parity EcoDev), also an old-time Polkadot Head Ambassador of East Asia. And here I am re-applying for the Head Ambassador representing East Asia, AGAIN, as I’ve always been.

![image.png](https://subsquare.infura-ipfs.io/ipfs/QmYjmeTRcPFAeiEq9Y3H2FZjfFKaqnuZT1uxxzEMWXR7D5)

I joined the Polkadot ecosystem in 2019 as an Ambassador Candidate, climbed the ladder to become a Head Ambassador East Asia from 2021 until now, and I'd like to keep contributing through this role, since at least everyone is still recognizing me as the Head Ambassador from different local enterprises and ecosystem players around APAC region.

![Screenshot 2024-06-22 at 12.16.29 AM.png](https://subsquare.infura-ipfs.io/ipfs/QmecQ1QadJcrTWE1KnaN9QqBBzzTLbjkumqN4FkHFJfNWk)

I have been building both Polkadot & Parachain Community ecosystem globally for 4+ years, and serving the ecosystem as the Head Ambassador of East Asia for 3 years. I worked for Parity for 1 year as Ecosystem Community Builder at EcoDev department, focusing on supporting parachain teams and helping them to collaborate with each other (for instance, via the Polkadot Forum as a Forum Admin). I am based in South Korea (which is one of the [biggest crypto-market with global reach & notably high trading volumes](https://reports.tiger-research.com/p/korean-crypto-market-eng)), and supported Astar Network as the Head of EcoDev & Korea Growth Lead, focused on developing and onboarding projects from the ecosystem-wise and from the Korean market at the same time. I have always been representing Polkadot and Astar and given keynote speeches at various conferences and meetups with Gavin Wood, also hosted the [first-ever hackathon in Korea](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KT2EaGNAhdKvD1dv7AtlYFkN3wcvN7oSsshPROptvf8/edit) through ex-Event Bounty along with Raf. 

**- Then who is Raf? -**
Raf is a Polkadot Ambassador since 2022 based in South Korea, works as a Substrate engineer at Blockchain Labs, an entity that has been actively using Substrate as the main tech-stack to build cool products. Raf is also the 2nd PBA alumni from Polkadot Blockchain Academy Buenos Aires Edition to learn blockchain and Substrate and contribute to Polkadot ecosystem. Raf, as a DevRel (under my guidance), coordinated and executed all the developer side of the Polkadot promotional program(a hackathon, called HackaDOT2023, [proofs](https://photos.app.goo.gl/xL5utar9gdAGSStA6)) before [Buidl Asia](https://www.buidl.asia/) week of 2023 as an essential part of the Substrate promotion and adoption initiatives in Korea, Japan and other countries from Asia(including SEA), to promote Substrate as an open-source framework for local developers and convert the Rust learners among local dev-community to Substrate builders and to promote Polkadot Blockchain Academy. 

![telegram-cloud-photo-size-4-5833291081414980261-x.jpg](https://subsquare.infura-ipfs.io/ipfs/QmYFW6vnNwfnAYGr8Uj6ZKDwpJiw1HJC3Vd58C3m4mud3S)

SubStake Team we both have broad connections with key players in the East Asia market, considering my EcoDev position at both Parity and Astar, we had to work closely with numerous stakeholders across Web2 to Web3 space.

**- Current activity -**
Recently supported [Gavin's JAM Tour at Seoul National University](https://lu.ma/1x6q3bo5) with a first-ever [Interview Article of Gav from South Korea](https://biz.chosun.com/stock/finance/2024/06/17/URTGGLVLF5APZKV7RPPXMEBPXI/). I am working on onboarding large entities to the Polkadot ecosystem such as traditional media press, validator groups and enterprise companies, and once onboarded as HA will focus on Developer Community as well with Raf as a DevRel. We are not only actively participating in Polkadot BD meetings/events, but also been actively hosting those Polkadot-centric events so that we can deliver actual value/message to those who want to enter the ecosystem.

![KakaoTalk_Photo_2024-06-22-00-26-02-min.png](https://subsquare.infura-ipfs.io/ipfs/QmYSTRTrhGnxudr8Y4HjKjbTbMS8HV76nb5gt7Fo1UfVSM)

You will be finding us speaking at upcoming events such as Decoded satellite event, HackaDOT, KBW2024, HackSeoul, WebX and others.

We are taking responsibility of those we brought to the ecosystem, including Senior Ambassadors, Ambassadors and others being part of Eastern Asia region and Polkadot Korea, collaborating with SubWallet, OpenGuild, Polkadot HK, ex-Parity APAC members, W3F core-members.

We would like to engage more actively back into participating on OpenGov and Polkadot Forum as a Head Ambassador of East Asia, we are usually contributing to the ecosystem through various event-basis. (We normally act/execute more than we speak/write.)

**- Why vote Aye for Team SubStake!? -**
As of 2022, South Korea and Japan had a huge crypto market with around 14 million crypto users, equivalent to approximately 22% of the population of South Korea and Japan. Additionally, these markets are significant players in the global cryptocurrency industry, with high levels of crypto adoption in Korea and a growing interest in Japan. East Asia, specifically Korea and Japan, has a total of 1.3 million developers with 81,000 newly graduated developers annually, and over 800 blockchain companies established as of 2021. 

![Screenshot 2024-06-22 at 12.30.04 AM.png](https://subsquare.infura-ipfs.io/ipfs/QmdGC4nBUmHFVeA3HDqq7R2GKtoXPHw7Rr8VUH151vAeNQ)

Despite its rapid growth and huge expansion potential, the Polkadot ecosystem's presence in East Asia STILL remains limited in comparison to other blockchains such as Ethereum and its L2 chains (Optimism, zkSync, zkEVM), with Polkadot struggling to attract both end-users and builders.

There is therefore an urgent need for marketing and DevRel campaigns around Polkadot, as well as growth and BD efforts in East Asia. Hence, here we come - Team SubStake. 

For more achievements as before and if you need Kimchi-power at Polkadot, vote - "Aye!".
history.title: Polkadot Head Ambassador Application: Rhee and Raf (Team SubStake)

items.title: Polkadot Head Ambassador Application: Mexican Collective
items.content:
![image.png](https://subsquare.infura-ipfs.io/ipfs/QmbbrvmPtSTjzDXPgonXEW8fJdRGgGAfNTp5snirgB7Lts)

**Proposal: Mexican Collective Head Ambassador**

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/PolkadotMexico_) / [Telegram](https://t.me/PolkadotMexico) / [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/polkadotmexico_) 

**Introduction**

The Mexican Collective is an initiative of 7 ambassadors who have consistently contributed to creating the Polkadot community in Mexico, the members of the collective have been representing Polkadot in several events in Mexico, United States and Europe.

**Mexican Collective Background**

The members of the Mexican Collective are involved on Polkadot and in several DAOs within the ecosystem: Kusama, Kilt, Polimec, Astar, Moonbeam, Gear Foundation, Centrifuge. 

We have been spreading the word about Polkadot, growing the community, holding events, onboarding devs and users to Polkadot across Mexico.

**Mexican Collective DV Delegate**

The Mexican Collective was selected as [DV delegate](https://forum.polkadot.network/t/decentralized-voices-cohort-2-the-mexican-collective/7857) on Polkadot and we have begun our participation on OpenGov taking an important step bringing Polkadot closer to the vision of a decentralized future, giving a strong voice to the community.

**Why should you vote for the Mexican Collective?**

We believe that to be successful, Polkadot needs Head Ambassador in the biggest economies around the world, Mexico is a developing country and one of the largest economies on the American continent, Mexico has a solid economy with great expectations for the future. Image below shows how Mexico and Brazil have been the countries with the greatest [economy growth in America](https://www.proyectosmexico.gob.mx/en/why_mexican_infrastructure/solid-and-open-economy/economic-growth/).

![image.png](https://subsquare.infura-ipfs.io/ipfs/QmPS77Bhvi681NbHU7qjes3Vj89W6GbQMduHQKrMqe9s2J)

Being a Head Ambassador will allow to the Mexican Collective to lead the adoption of Polkadot across the country and mainly to have the authority to represent Polkadot and in a near future present a Business Development proposal tailored to Mexico needs, thus, we will be able to onboard devs and users and at the same time incorporate companies to Polkadot.

To accomplish the above we are open to collaborate with other collectives such as the Brazilian team, thereby we can take advantage of different strengths and expertise, giving Polkadot a greater chance to succeed on its mission.

**Work agenda summary**

- Represent Polkadot at events throughout Mexico.
- Link Polkadot to the Mexican government.
- Onboard new users and devs to Polkadot.
- Establish links between Polkadot and the business sector within Mexico.
- Present a business development bounty proposal tailored to Mexico needs.
- Collaborate with other teams within Polkadot to share business development skills and expertise to drive Polkadot forward.

**Compensation**

The salary will be used as compensation for the time and effort contributed by the 7 members of the collective and to pay for operational costs like traveling to events to represent Polkadot.

**Collective members background:**

●	Armando, I hold a law degree. I've been part of the Polkadot ecosystem since 2020, and I was thrilled when I participated in the parachains on both Kusama and Polkadot. In 2022, I applied to become a Polkadot ambassador, and since then, I haven’t stopped participating with the Polkadot Mexico community in organizing events, workshops, presentations, and conferences, all with the goal of continuing to educate the Mexican community. At the moment, I am the Head Ambassador at Polimec and the Community Manager of Tododecripto, the number one community in Mexico for education in Web3, memes, etc. I’m eagerly awaiting the release of Polkadot 2.0 and everything it will bring us in the future with the new implementations.
[Contributions made for the ecosystem](https://docs.google.com/document/d/18G7b24QMkFaBE1hir5BQTsLRGfAekAygSLxCnfwyvwI/edit?usp=sharing)

●	Cesar holds a bachelor’s degree in administration with specialization in finance, he has been in the crypto ecosystem since the beginning of 2020 and that same year he got to know the Polkadot ecosystem, but it wasn’t until 2021 that he began contributing as an ambassador for some other projects in the ecosystem (Moonbeam and SubQuery). As he became more active in the ecosystem, he started to become more interested in the workings of Polkadot itself. That is why, in 2022, he and a group of friends who are also Polkadot ambassadors officially created the Polkadot community in Mexico, organizing events for the Polkadot community in Mexico. He has had the opportunity to attend other Polkadot events in the United States and Europe, where he collaborated with KodaDot and Unique Network for the Ethereum Denver and side events. That is why he has had the opportunity to meet many members of the community. He has a channel on YouTube and TikTok where he creates content related to Polkadot, and on his Twitter account, he creates threads about the ecosystem.
[Contributions made for the ecosystem](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Xj8-C0TtTWI7qj9wGhnylku7RZCzDDpBUt49IBeIdOI/edit?usp=sharing)

●	Javier Eli: Javier holds a law degree from the UNIVERSIDAD AUTONOMA DE BAJA CALIFORNIA he has been enthusiastic about web3 since 2020, starting in Polkadot in 2020 to learn about the ecosystem and technology that Polkadot provides. In 2022, he applied to be an ambassador for Mexico, therefore being one of the first ambassadors for Mexico to create and grow the Polkadot Mexico community and organize events within the country. He also creates content in Spanish on Youtube and Twitter. He has been present at all Polkadot events in Mexico, promoting the community and ecosystem. Javier is Talent Growth Latam at Gear Foundation where he is in charge of attracting talents and achieving approaches with universities creating alliances with IT careers, He was a Judge in several hackathons in the Polkadot ecosystem with specialization in business models, UX/UI and Dapp Design. He is also the Senior Ambassador of Polimec Protocol and Vara Network. Javier Eli has had a great journey within the ecosystem and is willing to continue building and growing the community in Mexico.

●	Erick holds a bachelor’s degree in public accounting, he has been enthusiastic about web3 since 2020, starting in Polkadot in 2020 to learn about the ecosystem and technology that Polkadot provides. In 2022, he applied to be an ambassador for Mexico, therefore being one of the first ambassadors for Mexico to create and grow the Polkadot Mexico community and organize events within the country. He also creates content in Spanish on Youtube and Twitter. He has been present at all Polkadot events in Mexico, promoting the community and ecosystem. Erick is enthusiastic about the KILT Protocol and the official team recognizes the work he has done in Mexico. He is also the Head Ambassador of Polimec Protocol, a member of Kappa Sigma Mu (KSM), and a member of Youdledao in Astar Network. Erick has had a great journey within the ecosystem and is willing to continue building and growing the community in Mexico. [Contributions made from the ecosystem](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1lzYT6IhDxRtIvFf1XzVzOX9-U9KHYbUH1DEbveHgYnk/edit?usp=sharing) 


●	Amaury, he holds a degree in biotechnology, he worked on the development of events in México, serving as an assistant during Polkadot Doxxed México CDMX 2022, Hackathon UNAM 2023, Meetup Bitcoin Embassy Bar 2023, Guadalajara Polkadot Side Event Talent Land 2023, Polkadot Decoded View Party 2023, Polkadot Hub Ibero CDMX 2023, Polkadot Satellite Event CDMX 2023, Cripto México Hackathon Tijuana 2023, Polkadot Side Event Talent Land 2024 among many others crypto events.
[Contributions made for the ecosystem](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1tvkAjfOJPdmnzPl_WAGHjX1txn0O5fhzOPagcFCX8-g/edit?usp=sharing)

●	Luis holds a B.S. Computer Systems, he has a master's degree in telecommunications, he has participated in the Polkadot ecosystem since 2022, spreading the word and attending events such as Polkadot Decoded 2023 in Denmark. Luis is a small and medium business entrepreneur in the traditional sector, he has collaborated with companies such as Heineken, in addition to working in the Government sector in Mexico. He currently has a small business focused on real estate and he also is an Active Contributor on Polkadot and Centrifuge DAO. 
[Contributions made for the ecosystem](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1GUupTE4PWIGUOLsThiw3FfZ93BFsqCi6/view?usp=sharing)

●	Rodrigo, Hold a Master's in Blockchain and its Business Applications. 
I’ve been in the Polkadot ecosystem since mid-2020. Its token split movement caught my attention, and I wanted to get more involved. Not knowing many people in Mexico, I decided to seek community, and that’s when I found some very pleasant individuals who had formed the Polkadot Mexico group. I was invited to join the Polkadot Ambassador program and the Polkadot Mexico group. Since then, I’ve been involved with my colleagues in various meetups to raise awareness about the ecosystem and its various parachains and updates. We’ve always been attentive to people who have doubts about Polkadot technology. Additionally, the Polkadot Mexico YouTube channel was created to upload videos on various topics about Polkadot and practical cases so that people could understand actions to be taken more clearly. It’s been an incredible process, and we’re aiming for the Mexican community to be a reference both within and outside the country for teaching about the Polkadot ecosystem.
[Contributions Made for the Ecosystem](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1tuW1VMXECt6V4STn2RbK5fl4ME1WC6KqNYnKjw7NaUM/edit)

Thank you very much for your support!

![image.png](https://subsquare.infura-ipfs.io/ipfs/QmYu8ZcYh5vxJycHihNUDGY79K325fbA989LGPA3ss8H6E)

items.title: Head Ambassador Proposal for Polkadot - Georgi #900
items.content:
## Head Ambassador Proposal - Georgi

  

**Introduction:**

My name is Georgi. I have been actively involved in the Polkadot ecosystem since early 2021. Initially, my contributions focused on community building, organizing events and workshops for developers. Since late 2023, I have been contributing to multiple business development initiatives. My candidacy as Head Ambassador will focus on strengthening and expanding the Polkadot developer community in Eastern Europe, starting with Bulgaria, while maintaining my BD activities.

**Proposed Approach:**

**Focus on Eastern Europe, starting with Bulgaria:**

1.  Eastern European countries, such as Bulgaria, Romania, and Poland among others, are considered some of the best countries for IT specialists for several reasons, including a strong education system, low cost of living, a growing IT sector, government support, access to experts, multilingual population, and a strong work ethic with a "can-do" attitude.
2.  Establishing a solid developer community in Bulgaria can serve as a model for other Eastern European countries.
3.  Bulgaria has a strong base of tech professionals and renowned universities, providing fertile ground for the growth of a Substrate developer community.
4.  Collaborate with companies like Limechain for technical support, and others like Droxic and Dev.bg.
5.  Provide developers with access to a support network and resources, facilitating their integration and success in the ecosystem.

**Continue with Business Development:**

1.  While focusing on community building in Eastern Europe, continue contributing to business development without geographical restrictions.

**Mission:**

1.  **Attraction of New Developers:** Attract and nurture new developers for the ecosystem.
2.  **Institutional Adoption:** Drive the institutional adoption of Polkadot technology.

**Strategic Plan for the First Three Months as Head Ambassador:**

1.    **Integration with Educational Institutions:**

Establish agreements to integrate Substrate as a subject in the major universities and academies in Bulgaria.

Collaborate with educational technicians in the ecosystem to develop a robust and attractive curriculum.

2.    **Hackathon Initiatives:**

Promote the creation of hackathons to foster innovation and engagement within universities and academies.

Offer prizes and recognitions to motivate participation and highlight local talent.

3.**Creation of High-Quality Content:**

Develop and distribute high-quality educational content about Polkadot and its ecosystem.

Produce tutorials, guides, and use cases that demonstrate the potential of Polkadot.

4.**Organization and Representation at Events:**

Organize events and represent Polkadot at Web3, Web2, technology, and startup conferences and events.

5.    **Preparation of Use Cases:**

Prepare use cases for projects on Polkadot and establish contacts with potential clients.

Collaborate with local companies to <u>identify</u> opportunities for implementing Polkadot.

**Support:**

I have full support from Limechain in Bulgaria, as well as other important members within my circle in Bulgaria.

I would like to collaborate with other Head Ambassadors to maximize our impact and share best practices.

**Remuneration:**

A minimum of 60% of the post-tax remuneration will be shared with the partners supporting me, as well as external companies responsible for content creation and marketing.

items.title: Polkadot Head Ambassador Application: Angelina
items.content:
![FINAL.png](https://subsquare.infura-ipfs.io/ipfs/QmVA9M4gFmFzKF4xpFipHLUzeVPbPSuofiEs6khg9n9VQA)


**Greetings Polkadot!**

My name is Angelina, I’m based in Dubai, UAE where I’ve had the great opportunity to represent Polkadot & Kusama within the Crypto community. I joined the Polkadot ecosystem in 2022 and since then, I've dedicated myself to driving growth and engagement within Dubai’s vibrant crypto community. My contributions have focused on event management, community building, and representing Polkadot at various high-profile crypto events in Dubai.

**Background and Expertise**

As the regional Ambassador for Polkadot in the Middle East, I leveraged my experience in growth marketing, project management, and social media to grow the community and increase awareness in the Middle East. By connecting with other Web3 communities, fostering educational initiatives, and hosting events including mini-hackathons, I’ve been an enthusiastic ambassador sharing my passion for Web3 innovations. 

**Current Activity**

Currently, I’ve been focused on expanding Polkadot's presence in the UAE and the broader MENA region. Here are some of my key activities:

- **Event Management**: I have successfully organised and hosted numerous Polkadot events in Dubai, starting with the [first event in 2022](https://www.meetup.com/en-AU/polkadot-and-kusama-dubai/events/289622171/). These events have ranged from ‘Polkadot - Dubai Ecosystem Meetup’ to ‘Dubai Polkadot Fireside Chat - Working in Web3’ on X spaces (link [here](https://x.com/PolkadotDubai/status/1631506102339739648)) and [a Mini-hackathon](https://www.meetup.com/en-AU/polkadot-and-kusama-dubai/events/296926925/) to name a few.
- **Community Building**: I’ve supported ambassadors from other regions in planning events, and set the agenda that is tailored to the audience in Dubai. With 328 members signing up to our meetup page attendance for real life (IRL) has grown significantly over the past few years. I’ve created and designed marketing materials myself and posted these on our Dubai Telegram group. Telegram has been a great channel for the community to stay up to date on future events. As the admin & moderator of this group, I’ve been continuously updating and communicating with the community.
- **Representation at Crypto Events**: I have represented Polkadot at various high-profile crypto events in Dubai, including Dubai Blockchain Week, World Blockchain Summit, and Future Blockchain Summit. I’ve attended Women in Crypto events sponsored by Binance event where I spoke to leading women about the Polkadot & Kusama ecosystem. See [link](https://x.com/binance/status/1618187247328673792) to that specific event.
- **Involvement in Other Ecosystems**: I've helped grow the Polimec community as a regional ambassador for Dubai, UAE. As an attendee, I have met with other leading chains with a huge presence in Dubai (e.g. Cosmos/ATOM Dubai and Solana etc). These social events have allowed me to increase my network of venues and seek more growth opportunities (e.g. co-hosting and future collaboration).

**Future Plans and Vision**

As the Head Ambassador, I would like to:

- **Increase Community Engagement**: Organize more frequent events with financial support, ensuring consistent engagement and growth of the Polkadot community. These events will include workshops, hackathons, and collaborative sessions designed to educate and inspire community members. I’d also be keen to present Polkadot at major conferences in Dubai.
- **Strengthen Partnerships**: Build stronger relationships with local and international blockchain organizations, and enterprises to boost awareness and engagement with the Polkadot ecosystem. More specifically:
- **Governments**: We’ve already signed an MOU with the [Dubai Blockchain Association](https://blockchaincenter.ae/event/polkadot-dubai-hackathon-event/) - this was a great milestone, but the partnership has been put on hold due to financial commitment from Polkadot. Future events will be advertised on a larger scale, so catering to these people needs to be well-planned and executed. This requires time and resources. Additionally, we have ambassador candidates across the Middle East and in the capital city Abu Dhabi. Dubai government hosts events about the future of technology e.g. Dubai AI & [Web3 Festival.](https://dubaiaiweb3festival.com/), where given the opportunity I'd present about Polkadot as interoperability and the decentralised web is a big topic on the agenda. 
- **Other Ecosystems**: Enabling cross-chain collaboration and mutual growth, promoting interoperability and shared learning is a priority. (e.g., Cosmoverse, Superteam UAE, ETHDubai, etc.)
- **Software Engineering Groups**: As part of my network, I’ve spoken to local engineering communities who have not explored Web3 or attended the mini-hackathon we ran due to the timing. I’d like to increase awareness and access to a local talent pool by hosting engaging events and workshops in collaboration with engineering groups ([Dubai Software Engineering Managers](https://www.meetup.com/en-AU/dubai-software-engineering-management-group/)).
- **Educational and Advocacy Initiatives**: I will launch comprehensive educational programs and resources to empower our community, advocate for decentralization at major crypto events, and leverage my Web3 gaming experience to create innovative opportunities within the Polkadot ecosystem. My efforts will ensure that Polkadot remains at the forefront of blockchain technology and community growth.

**Why vote Aye!?**

By voting "Aye," you're supporting a leader who has significantly boosted the Polkadot community's growth across the UAE, represented the network at numerous high-profile events, and is committed to expanding our reach even further. Based full-time in Dubai, I will also support other local ambassadors who have helped run events, co-hosting with the Budapest, India, and Arts DAO communities to continue the great foundations we’ve achieved.

Other reasons to vote AYE:

- Grew the Polkadot community by +50% across the UAE.
- Represented Polkadot at over 25 key events in the UAE and the Middle East.
- Organized and hosted 10+ successful Polkadot meetups and hackathons.
- Formed strategic partnerships with major blockchain organizations.
- Managed community social channels (i.e., Telegram, Twitter - [PolkadotDubai](https://x.com/PolkadotDubai), and Discord [Middle East](https://discord.com/channels/722223075629727774/759078683012628512)).

"Together we can achieve more."

Thank you for your support!

items.title: Resubmission of Promotion to "VII Dan: Free Master" for Gavin Wood - Evidence below
items.content:
Due to Gavin not being inducted on Fellowship as an active member (something all Fellowship members need to execute) [referendum 814](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/referenda/814) did not execute successfully. Therefore, I am resubmitting the proposal (same track, same preimage):

## Member Details

- Member e-mail: gavin@parity.io
- Polkadot address: 16SDAKg9N6kKAbhgDyxBXdHEwpwHUHs2CNEiLNGeZV55qHna
- Current rank: "VI Dan: Grand Architect" (to be promoted to "VII Dan:  Free Master", as per the [Fellowship manifesto](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/manifesto/blob/main/manifesto.pdf): requirements and obligations in the document) 
- Date of initial induction: November 2022
- Area(s) of Expertise/Interest: Technical design, Protocol evolution, Socio-political direction

Almost seven years after writing [the Polkadot Whitepaper](https://polkadot.network/whitepaper/) (well above the strict minimum of 6 years required for VII Dan), please find some of the most prominent contributions from Gavin to the ecosystem:

## Reporting period
Start date: 2023/05/16
End date: 2024/05/28

## Areas of contribution

**Polkadot SDK:**

- Specification & implementation of Agile Coretime (brokerage system).
Specification of Agile Coretime (interface). [RFC 1](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/RFCs/blob/main/text/0001-agile-coretime.md) & [PR 14568](https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/14568), [RFC 5](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/RFCs/blob/main/text/0005-coretime-interface.md).

**Improvements to XCM:** 

- Tools for uniquely referencing messages, [PR 7234](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot/pull/7234)
- Bound number of assets which can be withdrawn to pay for execution, [PR 7641](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot/pull/7641).

**Improvements to FRAME:**

- FRAME: Revamp Preimage pallet to use Consideration, [PR 1363](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot-sdk/pull/1363)
- FRAME: Create `TransactionExtension` as a replacement for `SignedExtension`,  [PR 2280](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot-sdk/pull/2280).

**Roadmap/Vision:** 

- Deviser of the Open Governance Model on Kusama and Polkadot Networks: [https://medium.com/polkadot-network/gov2-polkadots-next-generation-of-decentralised-governance-4d9ef657d11b](https://medium.com/polkadot-network/gov2-polkadots-next-generation-of-decentralised-governance-4d9ef657d11b)
- Founder and ideator of the [Polkadot Technical Fellowship](https://wiki.polkadot.network/docs/learn-polkadot-technical-fellowship) and author of the [Fellowship Manifesto](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/manifesto/blob/main/manifesto.pdf).
- Specification for JAM Protocol, [Graypaper](https://graypaper.com/) and [ongoing refinements](https://github.com/gavofyork/graypaper).

**In-depth conversations on the philosophy behind Polkadot:** 

- Within the ecosystem: Polkadot Decoded 2023, sub0 Asia 2024 ([Keynote: Gavin Wood sees Polkadot as a global Supercomputer](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GIB1WeVuJD0), [Keynote: JAM A-Z](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tdvqkKdFTlw)). 2) with the general public: Space Monkeys, [Gavin Wood - Is Polkadot OpenGov’s Democratic? Games & Consensus](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RvbsSq1a_8g), [Behind the Code: The Graypaper interview](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O3kRAVBTkfs). 

**Presentations on the Polkadot network and protocol:** 

- With peers from other ecosystems and/or industries: [Decentralized Lugano](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Yw3mQNJ5UJQ),[ sub0 Asia 2024](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_gpFm0IZ34M), [Token2049 Dubai 2024](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xTMiE0UcZUo).
- With the wider academic community and/or industry: [Protocol Berg](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j7b8Upipmeg), [The Journey Man](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9SAxnF2sys8). 

**Comment(s):**

- Gav was originally meant to be seeded into the Fellowship at Rank 7. However, this could not happen as the manifesto specifies that induction at Rank 7 can only be done via the community vote: more specifically on Fellowship Admin track. For any members to be promoted to rank VII a vote from the community needs to happen. 
- Gav's contributions to the ecosystem are invaluable and his work has shown a clear vision with regards to where Polkadot should be in the future, what the challenges and the opportunities are in the industry and how a truly unstoppable, scalable and interoperable network should look like.


Make sure to review the above and cast your vote!

## Member Details

- Polkadot address: 16SDAKg9N6kKAbhgDyxBXdHEwpwHUHs2CNEiLNGeZV55qHna
- Current rank: "VI Dan: Grand Architect" (to be promoted to "VII Dan:  Free Master", as per the [Fellowship manifesto](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/manifesto/blob/main/manifesto.pdf): requirements and obligations in the document) 
- Date of initial induction: November 2022
- Area(s) of Expertise/Interest: Technical design, Protocol evolution, Socio-political direction

Almost seven years after writing [the Polkadot Whitepaper](https://polkadot.network/whitepaper/) (well above the strict minimum of 6 years required for VII Dan), please find some of the most prominent contributions from Gavin to the ecosystem:

## Reporting period
Start date: 2023/05/16
End date: 2024/05/28

## Areas of contribution

**Polkadot SDK:**

- Specification & implementation of Agile Coretime (brokerage system).
Specification of Agile Coretime (interface). [RFC 1](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/RFCs/blob/main/text/0001-agile-coretime.md) & [PR 14568](https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/14568), [RFC 5](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/RFCs/blob/main/text/0005-coretime-interface.md).

**Improvements to XCM:** 

- Tools for uniquely referencing messages, [PR 7234](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot/pull/7234)
- Bound number of assets which can be withdrawn to pay for execution, [PR 7641](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot/pull/7641).

**Improvements to FRAME:**

- FRAME: Revamp Preimage pallet to use Consideration, [PR 1363](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot-sdk/pull/1363)
- FRAME: Create `TransactionExtension` as a replacement for `SignedExtension`,  [PR 2280](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot-sdk/pull/2280).

**Roadmap/Vision:** 

- Deviser of the Open Governance Model on Kusama and Polkadot Network: [https://medium.com/polkadot-network/gov2-polkadots-next-generation-of-decentralised-governance-4d9ef657d11b](https://medium.com/polkadot-network/gov2-polkadots-next-generation-of-decentralised-governance-4d9ef657d11b)
- Specification for JAM Protocol, [Graypaper](https://graypaper.com/) and [ongoing refinements](https://github.com/gavofyork/graypaper).

**In-depth conversations on the philosophy behind Polkadot:** 

- Within the ecosystem: Polkadot Decoded 2023, sub0 Asia 2024 ([Keynote: Gavin Wood sees Polkadot as a global Supercomputer](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GIB1WeVuJD0), [Keynote: JAM A-Z](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tdvqkKdFTlw)). 2) with the general public: Space Monkeys, [Gavin Wood - Is Polkadot OpenGov’s Democratic? Games & Consensus](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RvbsSq1a_8g), [Behind the Code: The Graypaper interview](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O3kRAVBTkfs). 

**Presentations on the Polkadot network and protocol:** 

- With peers from other ecosystems and/or industries: [Decentralized Lugano](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Yw3mQNJ5UJQ),[ sub0 Asia 2024](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_gpFm0IZ34M), [Token2049 Dubai 2024](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xTMiE0UcZUo).
- With the wider academic community and/or industry: [Protocol Berg](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j7b8Upipmeg), [The Journey Man](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9SAxnF2sys8). 

**Comment(s):**

- Gav was originally meant to be seeded into the Fellowship at Rank 7. However, this could not happen as the manifesto specifies that induction at Rank 7 can only be done via the community vote: more specifically on Fellowship Admin track. For any members to be promoted to rank VII a vote from the community needs to happen. 
- Gav's contributions to the ecosystem are invaluable and his work has shown a clear vision with regards to where Polkadot should be in the future, what the challenges and the opportunities are in the industry and how a truly unstoppable, scalable and interoperable network should look like.


Make sure to review the above and cast your vote!

items.title: Polkadot Head Ambassador Application: Patrizia De Bella
items.content:
Dear Polkadot Community,

I'm Patrizia De Bella, a proud member of the Polkadot ecosystem since 2018. I’m submitting my application as HA because I believe that a position like Operation Executive is vital for any organization aiming to achieve high efficiency, strategic alignment, and sustained growth.

As an Operations Executive, my expertise in managing operations can enhance the HA's performance and contribute significantly to the long-term success of the organization. My role would help simplify the HA's main goals and ensure the smooth running of day-to-day operations.

You can find the complete details of my proposal at the following link: [Full proposal](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Nl4dYdHf79ZA-nXWFfI3g8PUsRAGLZVZO16eVc5a99E/edit?usp=sharing)

I look forward to the opportunity to discuss my qualifications and vision for the role further. Thank you for your consideration.

Sincerely, Patrizia De Bella

items.title: Polkadot Head Ambassador Application: Mario Altenburger
items.content:
Dear Polkadot community,

My name is Mario Altenburger and I am applying to represent Polkadot as a Head Ambassador, primarily as a **business development accelerator** and **fundraiser** for the ecosystem.

Having worked in the Polkadot ecosystem for nearly 3 years now, I have had the opportunity to meet many of you in person and I have to say the professionalism and commitment of the teams building on and/or for Polkadot is far beyond what I have seen in any other ecosystem. 

Polkadot is the reason why I decided to move from traditional finance into crypto. While the technology and builders are far ahead of others, I believe we still lack widespread adoption. 

It will take joint efforts from various angles to help convince projects to build on Polkadot and importantly also to migrate to our ecosystem. Below I will share more on my background and how I plan to drive to push for adoption. 

In addition, I would represent Polkadot at traditional investment conferences to help raise new funds for the ecosystem, by finding direct investments for projects, large new DOT buyers as well as investors into fund dedicated to deploy in the Polkadot ecosystem.


**Background**

Born and raised in Austria, I worked most of my career in the finance sector in Hong Kong. After completing a MA in Economics in Innsbruck and a MA in Mathematics of Finance at Columbia University, I spent 14 years at Bank of China International in Hong Kong.

As Head of EMEA Origination and Debt Syndicate, I focused on **fundraising** for Chinese and international corporates, raising a total of USD500 billion of debt, equity-linked and structured financings in over 1,000 transactions. I spearheaded the bank's **international expansion** leading landmark transactions such as the first German Renminbi bond from Volkswagen, the first high yield bond from Korea by Korean Air, the first Chinese Euro bond by CNOOC, the first global sukuk offering from Saudi Aramco and the largest convertible bond from Hong Kong by Cathay Pacific.
 
I worked with hundreds of **major multinational corporations** (MNCs, mostly Fortune 500), **governments** as well as **institutional investors** and **family offices**, and have developed a **close working relationship at senior level**.


**Harbour Industrial Capital**

In 2021, Max Rebol and I co-founded Harbour Industrial Capital (HIC). We are registered in the Cayman Islands and headquartered in HK. As of Q1 2024 our fund has an AUM of over US$10 million. We have raised this capital from private investors such as Family Offices, and subsequently invested it in over 20 Polkadot-based projects. The primary method of deploying capital were parachain auctions, as part of which we locked up DOT in exchange for a fixed amount of parachain tokens. More recently we have also made direct investment in Polkadot-based projects. Fund 1 held its final closing on 31 December 2023, and we are planning to raise a second fund later this year.

I was speaker at various conferences, instructor of a course on Parachain Auction at the Polkadot Blockchain Academy, Panel Moderator at Polkadot Day in HK; Judge of the HK Web3Hack; Winner of the TADS Award for Ecosystem Excellence in DeFi.

Overall, in the past 3 years, we have been constantly on the road educating folks about Polkadot and convincing that Polkadot is the preferred destination for their capital, applications or projects.


**Connecting the DOTs for Polkadot**

My plan is to fully leverage on my **network** built throughout my career to (continue to) approach these MNCs and governments to convince them to utilize Polkadot technology for both existing processes and to upgrade their systems to the latest cutting-edge technology.

Imagine a major car manufacturer moving the supply and production lines onto Polkadot or one of its parachains. Airline ticketing, fuel consumption tracking and carbon credits offsetting all done in the same application.

We have been working actively already on **bringing major projects to Polkadot** and we may have some good news for the community in the coming weeks. These are projects with the potential to migrate millions of wallets and transactions to Polkadot.

In addition, Max and I are preparing our second fund, a **Polkadot Ecosystem fund**. We will be at numerous **traditional investment conferences** and **family office summits** promoting Polkadot. We plan to **invite project teams** to join us for conferences and/or the side events and investor dinners that we will organize.

To highlight again here also that for any treasury proposals that we submit to fund sponsorship for Polkadot at conferences we would NOT include any salary for ourselves.

As a Head Ambassador of Polkadot, it would certainly make my efforts easier with an official endorsement from the community.

I would look forward to working closely with the 20 other Head Ambassadors, many of whom I have worked with already. It is important to have a diverse set of Head Ambassadors covering various angles of the community, both inwards and outwards.

More importantly I am very much excited to engage even closer with the overall community, builders and projects so that we can together unleash Polkadot’s full potential. Thanks for your time and support!

For reference:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x8ATl5WWcPs
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9xN-HeJoGI4

Dear Polkadot Community,

I am delighted to submit my official application for the Head Ambassador (HA) role within our new Ambassador on-chain Collective.

items.title: #876 Polkadot Head Ambassador Application: Lorena (Blockya)
items.content:
Hello Polkadot Community!

I'm Lorena, many of you know me as blockya, and this candidacy for Head Ambassador can be summarized as follows:

Establishment of a team led by me as Head Ambassador, collaborating with esteemed members of the Polkadot community, to build a comprehensive framework encompassing development verticals. This initiative aims to enhance technical and non technical education and integration of new projects into the ecosystem. Additionally, it serves as a bridge to the decentralized resources available within the ecosystem.

**Context**

The Polkadot Ambassador Program was an initiative of Web3 Foundation that concluded in January 2024. Now the program was restructured and approved through an on-chain community vote. 

The Polkadot community has decided to maintain the ambassador program, with global representatives responsible for advancing the development, promotion, education, and communication of the ecosystem. This transition underscores the community's recognition of the vital role these ambassadors and teams play in the ecosystem's growth and evolution.
It is now the responsibility of the Head Ambassadors to assemble a team with different profiles that work together and collaborate with the global community to implement a strategic plan that further advances the Polkadot ecosystem and its technology.

**Problem and challenges to be addressed**

**Network changes:** Polkadot is undergoing a profound transformation, highlighting the crucial need for comprehensive technical and non-technical communication, education and training to foster the expansion of the ecosystem.
**Brand Recognition Deficit**: The Polkadot brand currently suffers from a notable lack of visibility, hindering its ability to attract attention and maintain the network effect within the industry.
**Integration Complexities**: The process for projects to join the Polkadot ecosystem is marred by complexities, several projects face challenges in effectively joining the Polkadot ecosystem, resulting in missed opportunities for ecosystem integration and growth. 

**Plan and value proposition**

In order to address the problem, we propose to work on verticals with development objectives defined below: 

**2 Verticals**

**Ecosystem Integration and Business Development
Education**

Quotes from Gavin Wood at ETH Prague:

"The relevance of this technology comes from resilience. In the developing world, systems such as the social structure are not resilient, they are corrupt. That's where Polkadot's technology becomes relevant."

“This is a technical and financial product that is trying to be marketed to people who have neither the need nor the necessary background”.

The industry should continue to enhance tech, reduce user barriers, and find more long-tail use cases.
Implementation

The team will implement these verticals through a quarterly plan, collaborating with selected community members. Tasks will be assigned based on expertise and networks, ensuring efficient execution.
Funding will be requested through on-chain referenda to ensure community approval and access treasury funds.
A detailed agenda outlining the four-month plan for each defined vertical will be presented to the community.

**Team**

Lorena, also known as blockya. Polkadot Head Ambassador since 2021 for Latin America. Speaker. Polkadot Hub Co-founder. Polkadot hackathon in Latin America in 2022. Spanish Bounty Curator. DV Cohort 2 for Kusama.
 
Ernih. Polkadot Senior Ambassador since 2021. Speaker. Polkadot Hub Co-Founder. Polkadot hackathon in Latin America in 2022. Spanish Bounty Curator. 

Lengo, developer. Spanish Bounty Curator. Polkadot Ambassador. Web3 Builder Founder. Polkadot Hub member. 

Nachito, Dotcast Co-Founder. Spanish Bounty Curator. Polkadot Ambassador - Ecosystem Agent. 

Roco, Dotcast Co-Founder, Polkadot Ambassador - Polimec Ambassador - Ecosystem Agent. 
—-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

I will post the full proposal: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Z0qC8Ers76AzWXf88jTO7kPG1LcU9ZfP5V0swv_gQhk/edit?usp=sharing

items.title: Polkadot Head Ambassador Application: Abdulbee
items.content:
## Dear Polkadot Community.

My name is Abdulbasit Sadiq (**Abdulbee**). I am submitting this referendum to apply for the position of Polkadot Head Ambassador.

## About My Journey in the Polkadot Ecosystem

I joined the Polkadot Ecosystem in 2021 at which time I was initially focused on Polkadot content creation and helping communities understand more about the ecosystem. Since then, I’ve taken up multiple roles in the ecosystem including curatorial, auditorial, educational, and leadership roles. You can find details of my involvement in these roles in the section below.


## Vision as Head Ambassador

I could write a 20-page paper on my vision as Head Ambassador, but I acknowledge the fact that this is an all-new and major revamp of the old program, and it’s not possible to truly lay down everything (or in how many ways) the expertise of Head Ambassadors could be helpful in the program. 

However, I’d like to lay down specific areas that I’m particularly interested in while keeping in mind the fact that this isn’t written in stone, and other areas may come up in which I may like to contribute, as long as it is in the best interest of the network, fits the Tenets of Head Ambassadorship set by the token-holder community, and is an area of which I have expertise in (or working knowledge of).



### Education/Support
This is something I’m particularly interested in, and one of the areas I’ve contributed the most to. I believe my knowledge of Polkadot Puts me in a position where I can confidently Write, chat, or speak (at gatherings, conferences, etc) about Polkadot (Mostly the application side, and to some extent, the dev side)

- Education and support can be in the form of
- Speaking at conferences.
- Representing Polkadot at events where it’s under-represented
- Content on blogs and media aimed to add distilling topics on Polkadot like XCM, OpenGov, JAM, etc
- Practical guides on how to use the various applications on Polkadot and its para-ecosystems.
- Helping solve the issues of users in chats
- Etc


### Organization
As with all new programs, there are going to be setbacks and a lot of trial and error when the new program kicks off. I would love to make my contributions (In collaboration with other Head Ambassadors) toward ensuring that the program gets off to a good start, maintains a healthy momentum, and is set up for success. 


### Ambassadorial support
Polkadot can seem complicated at first, which makes it very easy for ambassadors to give up after some time of trying out the ecosystem. One of my visions as head Ambassador is to take ambassadors by hand, educate them, support them, and nurture them into becoming ecosystem stars who can confidently represent the network. New ambassadors are bound to have a lot of questions regarding the ecosystem, and Head Ambassadors need to be available to provide the necessary guidance needed for them to grow and become proficient in the ecosystem.


### Contributing to improving the OpenSource culture regarding Polkadot KnowledgeBase
Another area I’ll be interested in is leading initiatives aimed at encouraging more community members to take on roles in creating, reviewing, and maintaining Open Source Polkadot KnowledgeBases like the Polkadot Wiki
Polkadot is a very dynamic ecosystem, and I believe the rate of creation and maintenance of content in KnowledgeBases can be increased multiple folds by motivating community members to adopt the Open-source culture.


Amidst these, I’ll be maintaining what I already do (and love doing) for the ecosystem: Helping Manage/Moderate communities and working with the Polkadot Anti-scam Team to fight Scam


## Selected Previous Ecosystem Contributions

**Content**
- Founder/writer for [subdaily](https://subdaily.io)
- Technical writer for [Substrate-In-Bits](https://github.com/Chondria/SiB)
- Polkadot Head ambassador for content

**Governance**
- 2+ years of experience curating bounties on Polkadot and Kusama (Moderation team bounty and Anti-scam bounty)
- Active OpenGov Participant
- Previously [Audited](https://github.com/CoinStudioDOT/OpenGov) Governance proposals
- Currently writing [OpenGov distilled series](https://subdaily.io/category/series/opengov-distilled/) on Subdaily.

**Community**
- Ex-Community Manager of RMRK
- Community Moderator of official Polkadot servers/channels for the last 2 years
- Also, help answer questions once in a while on [Polkadot Stackexchange](https://substrate.stackexchange.com/users/575/abdulbee)

**Security**
- Ex-Captain of Polkadot Anti-scam team
- Currently an Executive member of the Polkadot Anti-scam team.


Thank you for reading this far. Please vote, and may the new program be a huge success, regardless of the outcome of this application 🥂


Warm regards,

Abdulbasit Sadiq (Abdulbee)

---------------

## Contacts
Discord: Abdulbee

Twitter: https://x.com/DocAmoka

items.title: Polkadot Head Ambassador Application: William
items.content:
**Introduction**

Hello! My name is William, and I’m applying to be a Head Ambassador (HA) for Polkadot. I would like to serve the ecosystem and work to drive forward a vibrant, effective and inclusive ambassador program. 

**TLDR**

- Six, one of the newly elected HAs has endorsed my candidacy: “I find him a good candidate for his extremly good communication skills and understanding of the technology. He can be trusted with tasks to deliver. I hope the current voting turns: Good luck!”
- Saxemberg has endorsed my candidacy, based on the plan presented and the BD/regional needs it fulfills
- Max and Mario of the HIC Polkadot investment fund have endorsed my candidacy - “He is one of few people who has both deep technical knowledge, as well as great communications and presentation skills, as illustrated by him winning the HK PBA startup pitch competition... I think of the ambassadorship primarily as a representative role vis-a-vie third parties, or as being the "face of Polkadot". I can think of few people who are better suited for this than William.”

Why choose me?

- Polkadot is a very technical subject, and this makes it very hard to stay up to date with the latest changes as well as communicate them to outsiders. I have both a computer science degree and an MBA from leading institutions, and this gives me the ability to talk to people from both worlds.
- I can bridge many worlds in Polkadot: a) West to East, as I’m from North America but have been living in APAC/Taiwan for 7 years and interested to build up OpenGov participation in this region, b) today vs the future, BD needs help as much help as possible selling Polkadot as is today while we also need to push forward the plaza and JAM fronts, and c) Tech and business, to distill Polkadot into something that can be communicated outwards successfully to both developers and users.
- I have been on the front lines of Polkadot usage while at Talisman over the past two years, both the, retail and enterprise users. Polkadot is very complicated to explain and understand, and we need to empathize with the challenges users face to tackle this.
- I have been to the PBA, an intense education into Polkadot. I believe this compresses a lot of Polkadot knowledge into a short time, with instructors from W3F, Parity and ecosystem teams, and has given me a lot of connections across the ecosystem.
- I have plenty of experience with OpenGov, including being a DV and evaluating hundreds of proposals, but also authoring >$1.7M worth of granted proposals as part of my previous role. OpenGov (and the treasury) is a great differentiator and asset to our ecosystem that can support new entrants that will accrue a lot of value to DOT.

The ambassador program: what is it and what will I focus on?

- It’s the front lines of bringing Polkadot out into the world. It should be about putting our best foot forward and inviting people in, as well as ensuring they find what they need, onboard smoothly and get to the “magic moment” of why Polkadot is different. This requires communication and understanding of how to have a different message for each of the following groups: retail adopters, enterprise adopters and tech visionary adopters.
- I will onboard enterprise adopters and establish partnerships by creating ROI-based storytelling based on the successes Polkadot has already achieved. I will work to unify efforts and messaging between BD and ambassadors, and train up an organization of ambassadors to do the same.
- I will build up the Polkadot presence in APAC/East Asia, and help teams understand the treasury and OpenGov so they can get up and running more easily. This region has a lot to contribute and is left out of the conversation too often.

**Context**

I’d like to start by describing how I view the larger context from which we operate. I believe we are at the crossroads of a few transitions for Polkadot:

- the transition from 1.0 to the future, 
- the decentralization and its aftereffects, 
- and the first chapter of how we want to govern Polkadot as a DAO

We need to navigate all of these successfully for the network to flourish, but should acknowledge they inject uncertainty for participants, contributors, builders and end users. I believe the role of ambassadors is to communicate bi-directionally for the organization while bringing forth a strong case to choose Polkadot, and the role of Head Ambassadors is to lead by example and create a resilient and effective organization for ambassadors.

The foundation we establish now, not just on technical matters, but on the organizational, outreach and cultural aspects of Polkadot will lay the groundwork for network success over the next decade. While I have not been a Polkadot ambassador before, I believe that I can offer an outside perspective, seek out and listen to stakeholders, and be committed to building up the ambassador collective as a key part of the next evolution of Polkadot.

**Polkadot Experience**

I bring into this role the culmination of a number of different experiences in Polkadot. I started as a member of Talisman from May 2022 to May 2024, which gave me the perspective of being an ecosystem team dealing directly with end users and enterprises trying to use Polkadot. I was able to become familiar with working with many of the funding opportunities available in Polkadot, including the Polkadot treasury, the W3F grants program and the DF program, as well as the stress for teams  inherent in the application process.

However, I feel my proper introduction to the ecosystem happened at the Polkadot Blockchain Academy HK 2024, where I got to know over 100 builders as well as instructors from W3F, Parity, the Fellowship and the ecosystem. I was able to learn about the design and operation of Polkadot on a deeper level, and this inspired me to volunteer my candidacy to be a Decentralized Voice for the first cohort, to help steward governance. I believe that I served with integrity and care in the position. Following is a summary of my recent experience:

- Selected as [Decentralized Voices Cohort 1](https://medium.com/web3foundation/decentralized-voices-round-1-candidates-announced-23d9a800b260), and via that monitored and evaluated hundreds of proposals. (See my [original application](https://forum.polkadot.network/t/decentralized-voices-program-william/6099))
- Attended Polkadot Blockchain Academy (PBA) HK 2024 and graduated with distinction, winning the pitch competition
- Authored, applied for and awarded (as part of a company) a [DF Grant](https://medium.com/@web3/decentralized-futures-introducing-polkadot-multisig-powered-by-signet-2b7cbcbf1cec) for Signet
- Authored, applied for and awarded (as part of a company) a [W3F Grant](https://grants.web3.foundation/applications/signet) for Signet and “Sign-in With Substrate” (SIWS)
- Authored, submitted and was granted (as part of a company) 5 Polkadot Treasury Proposals totaling $1.7M ([1](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/treasury/148), [2](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/motion/342), [3](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/motion/388), [4](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/treasury/547), [5](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/treasury/714))
- Set up and managed on-chain multisig and proxy/AA structures for organizations in both Polkadot and Ethereum.
- Interviewed by Irina for the “Business Case for Polkadot” [podcast](https://x.com/DOT4Business/status/1783473679311208814)
- Gave insights on the decentralization initiative in the [Forbes article](https://www.forbes.com/sites/digital-assets/2024/02/05/polkadots-path-to-decentralization-latest-insights/)
- Have attended numerous Polkadot events: Token 2049 SG (Polkadot Booth; 2023), PBA Hong Kong (Jan 2024), Sub0 Bangkok (March 2024), TeamZ Tokyo (Polkadot Booth; March 2024), EthTaipei (Polkadot Booth; March 2024), JAM Lecture SG/PBA Ceremony (planned; June 2024), Decoded Brussels (planned; July 2024).
- Multisig signer to steward various OpenGov spends for the community: Mythical x DOT, InterMiami

I am currently in the planning phase of an initiative in Polkadot to create a web portal that uses ROI-based storytelling to engage and convert enterprise adopters for Polkadot. I hope this will be funded by the ecosystem, as I believe we have so far to go in terms of promoting the awareness and value proposition of Polkadot to enterprise adopters in a way that resonates with them. I believe this ties in well to the role of Head Ambassador, and will describe it more in the next section.

**Role**

I will approach the role of the Head Ambassador with three areas of focus: 1- Bridging Polkadot to the outside world, 2- Bringing the voices of internal stakeholders to the surface, and 3- Creating a robust organization to set up the collective for success.

1- Bridging Polkadot to the outside world: 

I believe the primary role of ambassadors is to shine a light on the ecosystem’s successes and build bridges to partners and potential adopters to enhance the ecosystem. I believe the noise and attention we generate today is too much within our own echo chamber as well as too hidden behind the Polkadot learning curve, and I believe that if we focus on ROI-based storytelling we can make Polkadot’s platform resonate much better with enterprise adopters.

I recently did a survey of all the enterprise success stories I could find, and surprisingly there were a lot! As you can see in the image below, Polkadot ALREADY has a lot of enterprise success stories and I will work to collect, create and disseminate these stories so they spread both within and outside of the ecosystem, working hand in hand with both BD teams and ambassador teams. 

 ![Enterprise successes.png](https://subsquare.infura-ipfs.io/ipfs/QmPFsg8MCB1rkUJEMeGXEdHDWeTeTsfEwCQhGAidzGoJAp)

Beyond these successes, it’s important to communicate all of the resources and support that Polkadot provides for onboarding, and funnel external parties to ecosystem support services, including but not limited to the Technical Support bounty, the BD teams around the ecosystem, the deployment infra like Tanssi/Magnet/Pop and the system integrators like BlockDeep and R0gue. And of course there are the different bounties and treasury that can help to fund integrations. These are incredible benefits that enable adoption of Polkadot, but it’s not clear enough to outsiders that they are available. I will work towards spreading the message about the support Polkadot can provide to adopters.

Given the decentralized nature of our global organization, BD teams are naturally siloed, and we can improve the “glue” that connects representative groups together. I will endeavor to help to align efforts among the different groups so that we can more easily bring wins from one group or geographic area to others.

As an HA, I will also offer 1:1 support and onboarding help for interested enterprises, to understand their needs at a first pass and connect them to the right ecosystem resources to advance to the next stage in their Polkadot journey, as well as enable other ambassadors on the team to do the same. I believe customer relationship management is very important in the pre-sales process for onboarding larger enterprises. As someone who is very familiar with the ecosystem funding opportunities (e.g. DF, W3F, Treasury, bounties/prizes) as well as the BD teams, I believe I can help newcomers in choosing the best path to enter the ecosystem. Furthermore, I will work on building and enabling champions within enterprises to spread Polkadot.

2- Bringing the voice of internal stakeholders to the surface:

One key realization that hit me when I first started my DV role was how many constituencies within the ecosystem did not want to make their voices heard in governance. This happened for various reasons, including not wanting to oppose a powerful force that may retaliate, being restricted based on where they work, not having time to understand proposals in detail, not wanting to vote against friends/allies in a non-anonymized way, cultural or language barriers, personality, or not wanting to get into the politics of the situation. One aspect of what I took on in my role of DV was to seek out these voices, hear their perspective, and represent the unspoken so that their views and concerns could be heard. I believe this is still very important to enable a healthy ecosystem, and I will continue this as HA.

Another internal aspect that I feel is very important after my DV experience is bridging East and West, especially the Chinese community. Polkadot, by heritage, is largely European/Western, but Polkadot as a blockchain ecosystem is global, and should inspire and support builders from all over the world. Frequently it comes down to language/cultural barriers which just require patience and understanding to surmount. As my background is from the US and I now live in East Asia, I believe I can help to promote this region, bring new leaders in the fold and encourage voices that have not spoken as loudly yet are just as motivated to contribute. 

3- Creating a robust organization to set up the collective for success:

Finally, I believe the role of HA is not just about public relations, BD or communication, but it requires standing up the organization of ambassadors and ensuring it can support what they need to be successful. This involves mentorship, leadership and organizational skills. I am fully committed to work with the other Head Ambassadors and rise to the challenge of setting up an efficient and effective organization. 

I will proactively seek out feedback from existing and past ambassadors, the community, token holders and other stakeholders in order to bring the organization forward. This will necessarily be a team effort that involves multiple stakeholders, and I see the Head Ambassadors as the responsible party for actioning the education, training, planning, satisfaction and effectiveness of the collective.

**Compensation**

I believe the HA funding should go towards Head Ambassador duties, which include representing Polkadot, engaging external parties such as potential adopters or investors, familiarizing oneself with the ecosystem and ecosystem participants, education and building up the collective from an operational point of view. If I receive funding from Polkadot to bring forth any initiatives I am working on, it will be segmented from HA duties.

**Personal Background**

I have a strong technical foundation, with a Computer Science degree from a leading institution, and I started my career as an engineer and then product manager. I later moved into the business side, e.g. sales and operations, and earned an MBA, which I feel provided a great foundation in the non-technical areas of management, communications and organizational design. I believe I can effectively bridge the worlds of tech and business and this is important both within the ecosystem and externally with potential partners and enterprise adopters.

Beyond just qualifications, I think success in this role really comes down to being able to focus on and care about the people in and around Polkadot, including the builders creating the ecosystem, the teams coming in to adopt, the potential investors, the token holders, the ambassadors and the myriad other stakeholders who make up the ecosystem. I hope to have your support in this endeavor, and please reach out with any questions.

William
[@replghost](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/user/replghost) on TG
