- Selected as [Decentralized Voices Cohort 1](https://medium.com/web3foundation/decentralized-voices-round-1-candidates-announced-23d9a800b260), and via that monitored and evaluated hundreds of proposals. (See my [original application](https://forum.polkadot.network/t/decentralized-voices-program-william/6099))
- Attended Polkadot Blockchain Academy (PBA) HK 2024 and graduated with distinction, winning the pitch competition
- Authored, applied for and awarded (as part of a company) a [DF Grant](https://medium.com/@web3/decentralized-futures-introducing-polkadot-multisig-powered-by-signet-2b7cbcbf1cec) for Signet
- Authored, applied for and awarded (as part of a company) a [W3F Grant](https://grants.web3.foundation/applications/signet) for Signet and “Sign-in With Substrate” (SIWS)
- Authored, submitted and was granted (as part of a company) 5 Polkadot Treasury Proposals totaling $1.7M ([1](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/treasury/148), [2](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/motion/342), [3](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/motion/388), [4](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/treasury/547), [5](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/treasury/714))
- Set up and managed on-chain multisig and proxy/AA structures for organizations in both Polkadot and Ethereum.
- Interviewed by Irina for the “Business Case for Polkadot” [podcast](https://x.com/DOT4Business/status/1783473679311208814)
- Gave insights on the decentralization initiative in the [Forbes article](https://www.forbes.com/sites/digital-assets/2024/02/05/polkadots-path-to-decentralization-latest-insights/)
- Have attended numerous Polkadot events: Token 2049 SG (Polkadot Booth; 2023), PBA Hong Kong (Jan 2024), Sub0 Bangkok (March 2024), TeamZ Tokyo (Polkadot Booth; March 2024), EthTaipei (Polkadot Booth; March 2024), JAM Lecture SG/PBA Ceremony (planned; June 2024), Decoded Brussels (planned; July 2024).
- Multisig signer to steward various OpenGov spends for the community: Mythical x DOT, InterMiami

I am currently in the planning phase of an initiative in Polkadot to create a web portal that uses ROI-based storytelling to engage and convert enterprise adopters for Polkadot. I hope this will be funded by the ecosystem, as I believe we have so far to go in terms of promoting the awareness and value proposition of Polkadot to enterprise adopters in a way that resonates with them. I believe this ties in well to the role of Head Ambassador, and will describe it more in the next section.

**Role**

I will approach the role of the Head Ambassador with three areas of focus: 1- Bridging Polkadot to the outside world, 2- Bringing the voices of internal stakeholders to the surface, and 3- Creating a robust organization to set up the collective for success.

1- Bridging Polkadot to the outside world: 

I believe the primary role of ambassadors is to shine a light on the ecosystem’s successes and build bridges to partners and potential adopters to enhance the ecosystem. I believe the noise and attention we generate today is too much within our own echo chamber as well as too hidden behind the Polkadot learning curve, and I believe that if we focus on ROI-based storytelling we can make Polkadot’s platform resonate much better with enterprise adopters.

I recently did a survey of all the enterprise success stories I could find, and surprisingly there were a lot! As you can see in the image below, Polkadot ALREADY has a lot of enterprise success stories and I will work to collect, create and disseminate these stories so they spread both within and outside of the ecosystem, working hand in hand with both BD teams and ambassador teams. 

 ![Enterprise successes.png](https://subsquare.infura-ipfs.io/ipfs/QmPFsg8MCB1rkUJEMeGXEdHDWeTeTsfEwCQhGAidzGoJAp)

Beyond these successes, it’s important to communicate all of the resources and support that Polkadot provides for onboarding, and funnel external parties to ecosystem support services, including but not limited to the Technical Support bounty, the BD teams around the ecosystem, the deployment infra like Tanssi/Magnet/Pop and the system integrators like BlockDeep and R0gue. And of course there are the different bounties and treasury that can help to fund integrations. These are incredible benefits that enable adoption of Polkadot, but it’s not clear enough to outsiders that they are available. I will work towards spreading the message about the support Polkadot can provide to adopters.

Given the decentralized nature of our global organization, BD teams are naturally siloed, and we can improve the “glue” that connects representative groups together. I will endeavor to help to align efforts among the different groups so that we can more easily bring wins from one group or geographic area to others.

As an HA, I will also offer 1:1 support and onboarding help for interested enterprises, to understand their needs at a first pass and connect them to the right ecosystem resources to advance to the next stage in their Polkadot journey, as well as enable other ambassadors on the team to do the same. I believe customer relationship management is very important in the pre-sales process for onboarding larger enterprises. As someone who is very familiar with the ecosystem funding opportunities (e.g. DF, W3F, Treasury, bounties/prizes) as well as the BD teams, I believe I can help newcomers in choosing the best path to enter the ecosystem. Furthermore, I will work on building and enabling champions within enterprises to spread Polkadot.

2- Bringing the voice of internal stakeholders to the surface:

One key realization that hit me when I first started my DV role was how many constituencies within the ecosystem did not want to make their voices heard in governance. This happened for various reasons, including not wanting to oppose a powerful force that may retaliate, being restricted based on where they work, not having time to understand proposals in detail, not wanting to vote against friends/allies in a non-anonymized way, cultural or language barriers, personality, or not wanting to get into the politics of the situation. One aspect of what I took on in my role of DV was to seek out these voices, hear their perspective, and represent the unspoken so that their views and concerns could be heard. I believe this is still very important to enable a healthy ecosystem, and I will continue this as HA.

Another internal aspect that I feel is very important after my DV experience is bridging East and West, especially the Chinese community. Polkadot, by heritage, is largely European/Western, but Polkadot as a blockchain ecosystem is global, and should inspire and support builders from all over the world. Frequently it comes down to language/cultural barriers which just require patience and understanding to surmount. As my background is from the US and I now live in East Asia, I believe I can help to promote this region, bring new leaders in the fold and encourage voices that have not spoken as loudly yet are just as motivated to contribute. 

3- Creating a robust organization to set up the collective for success:

Finally, I believe the role of HA is not just about public relations, BD or communication, but it requires standing up the organization of ambassadors and ensuring it can support what they need to be successful. This involves mentorship, leadership and organizational skills. I am fully committed to work with the other Head Ambassadors and rise to the challenge of setting up an efficient and effective organization. 

I will proactively seek out feedback from existing and past ambassadors, the community, token holders and other stakeholders in order to bring the organization forward. This will necessarily be a team effort that involves multiple stakeholders, and I see the Head Ambassadors as the responsible party for actioning the education, training, planning, satisfaction and effectiveness of the collective.

**Compensation**

I believe the HA funding should go towards Head Ambassador duties, which include representing Polkadot, engaging external parties such as potential adopters or investors, familiarizing oneself with the ecosystem and ecosystem participants, education and building up the collective from an operational point of view. If I receive funding from Polkadot to bring forth any initiatives I am working on, it will be segmented from HA duties.

**Personal Background**

I have a strong technical foundation, with a Computer Science degree from a leading institution, and I started my career as an engineer and then product manager. I later moved into the business side, e.g. sales and operations, and earned an MBA, which I feel provided a great foundation in the non-technical areas of management, communications and organizational design. I believe I can effectively bridge the worlds of tech and business and this is important both within the ecosystem and externally with potential partners and enterprise adopters.

Beyond just qualifications, I think success in this role really comes down to being able to focus on and care about the people in and around Polkadot, including the builders creating the ecosystem, the teams coming in to adopt, the potential investors, the token holders, the ambassadors and the myriad other stakeholders who make up the ecosystem. I hope to have your support in this endeavor, and please reach out with any questions.

William
[@replghost](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/user/replghost) on TG
history.title: Polkadot Head Ambassador Application: William

history.content:
**Introduction**

Hello! My name is William, and I’m applying to be a Head Ambassador (HA) for Polkadot. I would like to serve the ecosystem and work to drive forward a vibrant, effective and inclusive ambassador program. 

**TLDR**

- Six, one of the newly elected HAs has endorsed my candidacy: “I find him a good candidate for his extremly good communication skills and understanding of the technology. He can be trusted with tasks to deliver. I hope the current voting turns: Good luck!”
- Saxemberg has endorsed my candidacy, based on the plan presented and the BD/regional needs it fulfills
- Max and Mario of the HIC Polkadot investment fund have endorsed my candidacy - “He is one of few people who has both deep technical knowledge, as well as great communications and presentation skills, as illustrated by him winning the HK PBA startup pitch competition... I think of the ambassadorship primarily as a representative role vis-a-vie third parties, or as being the "face of Polkadot". I can think of few people who are better suited for this than William.”

Why choose me?

- Polkadot is a very technical subject, and this makes it very hard to stay up to date with the latest changes as well as communicate them to outsiders. I have both a computer science degree and an MBA from leading institutions, and this gives me the ability to talk to people from both worlds.
- I can bridge many worlds in Polkadot: a) West to East, as I’m from North America but have been living in APAC/Taiwan for 7 years and interested to build up OpenGov participation in this region, b) today vs the future, BD needs help as much help as possible selling Polkadot as is today while we also need to push forward the plaza and JAM fronts, and c) Tech and business, to distill Polkadot into something that can be communicated outwards successfully to both developers and users.
- I have been on the front lines of Polkadot usage while at Talisman over the past two years, both the, retail and enterprise users. Polkadot is very complicated to explain and understand, and we need to empathize with the challenges users face to tackle this.
- I have been to the PBA, an intense education into Polkadot. I believe this compresses a lot of Polkadot knowledge into a short time, with instructors from W3F, Parity and ecosystem teams, and has given me a lot of connections across the ecosystem.
- I have plenty of experience with OpenGov, including being a DV and evaluating hundreds of proposals, but also authoring >$1.7M worth of granted proposals as part of my previous role. OpenGov (and the treasury) is a great differentiator and asset to our ecosystem that can support new entrants that will accrue a lot of value to DOT.

The ambassador program: what is it and what will I focus on?

- It’s the front lines of bringing Polkadot out into the world. It should be about putting our best foot forward and inviting people in, as well as ensuring they find what they need, onboard smoothly and get to the “magic moment” of why Polkadot is different. This requires communication and understanding of how to have a different message for each of the following groups: retail adopters, enterprise adopters and tech visionary adopters.
- I will work to onboard enterprise adopters by creating ROI-based storytelling based on the successes Polkadot has already achieved. I will work to unify efforts and messaging between BD and ambassadors, and train up an organization of ambassadors to do the same.
- I will build up the Polkadot presence in APAC/East Asia, and help teams understand the treasury and OpenGov so they can get up and running more easily. This region has a lot to contribute and is left out of the conversation too often.

**Context**

I’d like to start by describing how I view the larger context from which we operate. I believe we are at the crossroads of a few transitions for Polkadot:

- the transition from 1.0 to the future, 
- the decentralization and its aftereffects, 
- and the first chapter of how we want to govern Polkadot as a DAO

We need to navigate all of these successfully for the network to flourish, but should acknowledge they inject uncertainty for participants, contributors, builders and end users. I believe the role of ambassadors is to communicate bi-directionally for the organization while bringing forth a strong case to choose Polkadot, and the role of Head Ambassadors is to lead by example and create a resilient and effective organization for ambassadors.

The foundation we establish now, not just on technical matters, but on the organizational, outreach and cultural aspects of Polkadot will lay the groundwork for network success over the next decade. While I have not been a Polkadot ambassador before, I believe that I can offer an outside perspective, seek out and listen to stakeholders, and be committed to building up the ambassador collective as a key part of the next evolution of Polkadot.

**Polkadot Experience**

I bring into this role the culmination of a number of different experiences in Polkadot. I started as a member of Talisman from May 2022 to May 2024, which gave me the perspective of being an ecosystem team dealing directly with end users and enterprises trying to use Polkadot. I was able to become familiar with working with many of the funding opportunities available in Polkadot, including the Polkadot treasury, the W3F grants program and the DF program, as well as the stress for teams  inherent in the application process.

However, I feel my proper introduction to the ecosystem happened at the Polkadot Blockchain Academy HK 2024, where I got to know over 100 builders as well as instructors from W3F, Parity, the Fellowship and the ecosystem. I was able to learn about the design and operation of Polkadot on a deeper level, and this inspired me to volunteer my candidacy to be a Decentralized Voice for the first cohort, to help steward governance. I believe that I served with integrity and care in the position. Following is a summary of my recent experience:

- Selected as [Decentralized Voices Cohort 1](https://medium.com/web3foundation/decentralized-voices-round-1-candidates-announced-23d9a800b260), and via that monitored and evaluated hundreds of proposals. (See my [original application](https://forum.polkadot.network/t/decentralized-voices-program-william/6099))
- Attended Polkadot Blockchain Academy (PBA) HK 2024 and graduated with distinction, winning the pitch competition
- Authored, applied for and awarded (as part of a company) a [DF Grant](https://medium.com/@web3/decentralized-futures-introducing-polkadot-multisig-powered-by-signet-2b7cbcbf1cec) for Signet
- Authored, applied for and awarded (as part of a company) a [W3F Grant](https://grants.web3.foundation/applications/signet) for Signet and “Sign-in With Substrate” (SIWS)
- Authored, submitted and was granted (as part of a company) 5 Polkadot Treasury Proposals totaling $1.7M ([1](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/treasury/148), [2](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/motion/342), [3](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/motion/388), [4](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/treasury/547), [5](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/treasury/714))
- Set up and managed on-chain multisig and proxy/AA structures for organizations in both Polkadot and Ethereum.
- Interviewed by Irina for the “Business Case for Polkadot” [podcast](https://x.com/DOT4Business/status/1783473679311208814)
- Gave insights on the decentralization initiative in the [Forbes article](https://www.forbes.com/sites/digital-assets/2024/02/05/polkadots-path-to-decentralization-latest-insights/)
- Have attended numerous Polkadot events: Token 2049 SG (Polkadot Booth; 2023), PBA Hong Kong (Jan 2024), Sub0 Bangkok (March 2024), TeamZ Tokyo (Polkadot Booth; March 2024), EthTaipei (Polkadot Booth; March 2024), JAM Lecture SG/PBA Ceremony (planned; June 2024), Decoded Brussels (planned; July 2024).

One key realization that hit me when I first started my DV role was how many constituencies within the ecosystem did not want to make their voices heard in governance. This happened for various reasons, including not wanting to oppose a powerful force that may retaliate, being restricted based on where they work, not having time to understand proposals in detail, not wanting to vote against friends/allies in a non-anonymized way, cultural or language barriers, personality, or not wanting to get into the politics of the situation. One aspect of what I took on in my role of DV was to seek out these voices, hear their perspective, and represent the unspoken so that their views and concerns could be heard. I believe this is still very important to enable a healthy ecosystem, and I will continue this as HA.

Another internal aspect that I feel is very important after my DV experience is bridging East and West, especially the Chinese community. Polkadot, by heritage, is largely European/Western, but Polkadot as a blockchain ecosystem is global, and should inspire and support builders from all over the world. Frequently it comes down to language/cultural barriers which just require patience and understanding to surmount. As my background is from the US and I now live in East Asia, I believe I can help to promote this region, bring new leaders in the fold and encourage voices that have not spoken as loudly yet are just as motivated to contribute. 

3- Creating a robust organization to set up the collective for success:

Finally, I believe the role of HA is not just about public relations, BD or communication, but it requires standing up the organization of ambassadors and ensuring it can support what they need to be successful. This involves mentorship, leadership and organizational skills. I am fully committed to work with the other Head Ambassadors and rise to the challenge of setting up an efficient and effective organization. 

I will proactively seek out feedback from existing and past ambassadors, the community, token holders and other stakeholders in order to bring the organization forward. This will necessarily be a team effort that involves multiple stakeholders, and I see the Head Ambassadors as the responsible party for actioning the education, training, planning, satisfaction and effectiveness of the collective.

**Compensation**

I believe the HA funding should go towards Head Ambassador duties, which include representing Polkadot, engaging external parties such as potential adopters or investors, familiarizing oneself with the ecosystem and ecosystem participants, education and building up the collective from an operational point of view. If I receive funding from Polkadot to bring forth any initiatives I am working on, it will be segmented from HA duties.

**Personal Background**

I have a strong technical foundation, with a Computer Science degree from a leading institution, and I started my career as an engineer and then product manager. I later moved into the business side, e.g. sales and operations, and earned an MBA, which I feel provided a great foundation in the non-technical areas of management, communications and organizational design. I believe I can effectively bridge the worlds of tech and business and this is important both within the ecosystem and externally with potential partners and enterprise adopters.

Beyond just qualifications, I think success in this role really comes down to being able to focus on and care about the people in and around Polkadot, including the builders creating the ecosystem, the teams coming in to adopt, the potential investors, the token holders, the ambassadors and the myriad other stakeholders who make up the ecosystem. I hope to have your support in this endeavor, and please reach out with any questions.

William
[@replghost](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/user/replghost) on TG
history.title: Polkadot Head Ambassador Application: William

history.content:
**Introduction**

Hello! My name is William, and I’m applying to be a Head Ambassador (HA) for Polkadot. I would like to serve the ecosystem and work to drive forward a vibrant, effective and inclusive ambassador program. 

I’d like to start by describing how I view the larger context from which we operate. I believe we are at the crossroads of a few transitions for Polkadot:

- the transition from 1.0 to the future, 
- the decentralization and its aftereffects, 
- and the first chapter of how we want to govern Polkadot as a DAO

We need to navigate all of these successfully for the network to flourish, but should acknowledge they inject uncertainty for participants, contributors, builders and end users. I believe the role of ambassadors is to communicate bi-directionally for the organization while bringing forth a strong case to choose Polkadot, and the role of Head Ambassadors is to lead by example and create a resilient and effective organization for ambassadors.

The foundation we establish now, not just on technical matters, but on the organizational, outreach and cultural aspects of Polkadot will lay the groundwork for network success over the next decade. While I have not been a Polkadot ambassador before, I believe that I can offer an outside perspective, seek out and listen to stakeholders, and be committed to building up the ambassador collective as a key part of the next evolution of Polkadot.

**Polkadot Experience**

I bring into this role the culmination of a number of different experiences in Polkadot. I started as a member of Talisman from May 2022 to May 2024, which gave me the perspective of being an ecosystem team dealing directly with end users and enterprises trying to use Polkadot. I was able to become familiar with working with many of the funding opportunities available in Polkadot, including the Polkadot treasury, the W3F grants program and the DF program, as well as the stress for teams  inherent in the application process.

However, I feel my proper introduction to the ecosystem happened at the Polkadot Blockchain Academy HK 2024, where I got to know over 100 builders as well as instructors from W3F, Parity, the Fellowship and the ecosystem. I was able to learn about the design and operation of Polkadot on a deeper level, and this inspired me to volunteer my candidacy to be a Decentralized Voice for the first cohort, to help steward governance. I believe that I served with integrity and care in the position. Following is a summary of my recent experience:

- Selected as Decentralized Voices Cohort 1, and via that monitored and evaluated hundreds of proposals. (See my original application)
- Attended Polkadot Blockchain Academy (PBA) HK 2024 and graduated with distinction, winning the pitch competition
- Authored, applied for and awarded (as part of a company) a DF Grant for Signet
- Authored, applied for and awarded (as part of a company) a W3F Grant for Signet and “Sign-in With Substrate” (SIWS)
- Authored, submitted and was granted (as part of a company) 5 Polkadot Treasury Proposals totaling $1.7M (1, 2, 3, 4, 5)
- Set up and managed on-chain multisig and proxy/AA structures for organizations in both Polkadot and Ethereum.
- Interviewed by Irina for the “Business Case for Polkadot” podcast
- Gave insights on the decentralization initiative in the Forbes article
- Have attended numerous Polkadot events: Token 2049 SG (Polkadot Booth; 2023), PBA Hong Kong (Jan 2024), Sub0 Bangkok (March 2024), TeamZ Tokyo (Polkadot Booth; March 2024), EthTaipei (Polkadot Booth; March 2024), JAM Lecture SG/PBA Ceremony (planned; June 2024), Decoded Brussels (planned; July 2024).
- Multisig signer to steward various OpenGov spends for the community: Mythical x DOT, InterMiami

I am currently in the planning phase of an initiative in Polkadot to create a web portal that uses ROI-based storytelling to engage and convert enterprise adopters for Polkadot. I hope this will be funded by the ecosystem, as I believe we have so far to go in terms of promoting the awareness and value proposition of Polkadot to enterprise adopters in a way that resonates with them. I believe this ties in well to the role of Head Ambassador, and will describe it more in the next section.

**Role**

I will approach the role of the Head Ambassador with three areas of focus: 1- Bridging Polkadot to the outside world, 2- Bringing the voices of internal stakeholders to the surface, and 3- Creating a robust organization to set up the collective for success.

1- Bridging Polkadot to the outside world: 

I believe the primary role of ambassadors is to shine a light on the ecosystem’s successes and build bridges to partners and potential adopters to enhance the ecosystem. I believe the noise and attention we generate today is too much within our own echo chamber as well as too hidden behind the Polkadot learning curve, and I believe that if we focus on ROI-based storytelling we can make Polkadot’s platform resonate much better with enterprise adopters.

I recently did a survey of all the enterprise success stories I could find, and surprisingly there were a lot! As you can see in the image below, Polkadot ALREADY has a lot of enterprise success stories and I will work to collect, create and disseminate these stories so they spread both within and outside of the ecosystem, working hand in hand with both BD teams and ambassador teams. 

 ![Enterprise successes.png](https://subsquare.infura-ipfs.io/ipfs/QmPFsg8MCB1rkUJEMeGXEdHDWeTeTsfEwCQhGAidzGoJAp)

Beyond these successes, it’s important to communicate all of the resources and support that Polkadot provides for onboarding, and funnel external parties to ecosystem support services, including but not limited to the Technical Support bounty, the BD teams around the ecosystem, the deployment infra like Tanssi/Magnet/Pop and the system integrators like BlockDeep and R0gue. And of course there are the different bounties and treasury that can help to fund integrations. These are incredible benefits that enable adoption of Polkadot, but it’s not clear enough to outsiders that they are available. I will work towards spreading the message about the support Polkadot can provide to adopters.

Given the decentralized nature of our global organization, BD teams are naturally siloed, and we can improve the “glue” that connects representative groups together. I will endeavor to help to align efforts among the different groups so that we can more easily bring wins from one group or geographic area to others.

As an HA, I will also offer 1:1 support and onboarding help for interested enterprises, to understand their needs at a first pass and connect them to the right ecosystem resources to advance to the next stage in their Polkadot journey, as well as enable other ambassadors on the team to do the same. I believe customer relationship management is very important in the pre-sales process for onboarding larger enterprises. As someone who is very familiar with the ecosystem funding opportunities (e.g. DF, W3F, Treasury, bounties/prizes) as well as the BD teams, I believe I can help newcomers in choosing the best path to enter the ecosystem. Furthermore, I will work on building and enabling champions within enterprises to spread Polkadot.

2- Bringing the voice of internal stakeholders to the surface:

One key realization that hit me when I first started my DV role was how many constituencies within the ecosystem did not want to make their voices heard in governance. This happened for various reasons, including not wanting to oppose a powerful force that may retaliate, being restricted based on where they work, not having time to understand proposals in detail, not wanting to vote against friends/allies in a non-anonymized way, cultural or language barriers, personality, or not wanting to get into the politics of the situation. One aspect of what I took on in my role of DV was to seek out these voices, hear their perspective, and represent the unspoken so that their views and concerns could be heard. I believe this is still very important to enable a healthy ecosystem, and I will continue this as HA.

Another internal aspect that I feel is very important after my DV experience is bridging East and West, especially the Chinese community. Polkadot, by heritage, is largely European/Western, but Polkadot as a blockchain ecosystem is global, and should inspire and support builders from all over the world. Frequently it comes down to language/cultural barriers which just require patience and understanding to surmount. As my background is from the US and I now live in East Asia, I believe I can help to promote this region, bring new leaders in the fold and encourage voices that have not spoken as loudly yet are just as motivated to contribute. 

3- Creating a robust organization to set up the collective for success:

Finally, I believe the role of HA is not just about public relations, BD or communication, but it requires standing up the organization of ambassadors and ensuring it can support what they need to be successful. This involves mentorship, leadership and organizational skills. I am fully committed to work with the other Head Ambassadors and rise to the challenge of setting up an efficient and effective organization. 

I will proactively seek out feedback from existing and past ambassadors, the community, token holders and other stakeholders in order to bring the organization forward. This will necessarily be a team effort that involves multiple stakeholders, and I see the Head Ambassadors as the responsible party for actioning the education, training, planning, satisfaction and effectiveness of the collective.

**Compensation**

I believe the HA funding should go towards Head Ambassador duties, which include representing Polkadot, engaging external parties such as potential adopters or investors, familiarizing oneself with the ecosystem and ecosystem participants, education and building up the collective from an operational point of view. If I receive funding from Polkadot to bring forth any initiatives I am working on, it will be segmented from HA duties.

**Personal Background**

I have a strong technical foundation, with a Computer Science degree from a leading institution, and I started my career as an engineer and then product manager. I later moved into the business side, e.g. sales and operations, and earned an MBA, which I feel provided a great foundation in the non-technical areas of management, communications and organizational design. I believe I can effectively bridge the worlds of tech and business and this is important both within the ecosystem and externally with potential partners and enterprise adopters.

Beyond just qualifications, I think success in this role really comes down to being able to focus on and care about the people in and around Polkadot, including the builders creating the ecosystem, the teams coming in to adopt, the potential investors, the token holders, the ambassadors and the myriad other stakeholders who make up the ecosystem. I hope to have your support in this endeavor, and please reach out with any questions.

William

items.title: Polkadot Head Ambassador Application: Michiko Watanabe
items.content:
Konichi-wa from Tokyo, Japan!

My name is Michiko Watanabe (渡辺 径子) and I would like to become a Head Ambassador for Polkadot in Japan. 

I learned the first time about Bitcoin from Mt. Gox incident in Tokyo, although I was not affected myself luckily. I later traded some ETH and learned about Polkadot in 2021, when Astar did para-chain. This made me very interested, and I listen to a lot of speeches from the creator of Astar, Mr. Sota Watanabe. (We share the same last name but are not a family 😂 Watanabe is a very common name in Japan) I also like Mr. Gavin who I often watch on Youtube to study, and also met in person during his trip to Japan. Polkadot is a third generation blockchain, and has many use cases in the enterprise adoption. 

My personal background is in enterprise software implementation for Salesforce in Japan. I worked at the company over 6 years for clients such as Toyota, SoftBank, Mizuho Securities and ANA Airlines. As a lead project manager I helped them implement new products that improve efficiency. However, after 6 years I became a little bit bored to work in traditional software, and would like to move full-time to Web3. 

Since Polkadot is my favorite blockchain technology, I have also organized many events in the past such as an Introduction to Polkadot at the Salesforce Office Tokyo during 2021 which was attended by 50 people. I am also an organizer of the Polkadot meetup in Shibuya. We have met many times last year and this year to chat about Polkadot and explain the technology to people new to Web3. I think this meetup is very helpful and many people from Japan corporates attend who want to learn to improve their technology (for example supply chain trading, commerce, transportation).

Astar has made a change to “zkEVM Polygon”, so we’re not sure if this is good idea. I personally believe Polkadot is better 🙂 In Japan there are many corporation that want to build interesting Web3 project, but they are not so familiar with Polkadot. So I think I will do more meetup in Tokyo. Also I have background in enterprise software, so as Ambassador I can help Japan companies adopt Polkadot technology easily. 

Thank you for consideration, 
Michiko

items.title: Polkadot Head Ambassador Application: Alice und Bob
items.content:
**Good Morning!**

I am **Tommi Enenkel**, also known as **Alice und Bob** ([Twitter](https://twitter.com/alice_und_bob), [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC0alQ35JKnMo_ctzYITthbw), [LinkedIn](http://linkedin/)). This is my application as Polkadot Head Ambassador.

## Background

In Polkadot, I co-founded [ChaosDAO](https://twitter.com/ChaosDAO) and [OpenGov.Watch](http://OpenGov.Watch). I am a Web3 strategist specializing in ecosystem development, governance, analytics, and crypto-economics. I previously held CIO and CMO roles and have a systems architecture and political communications background. I hold an MSc in Knowledge Management and IT Security. My master’s thesis explored agile software development and governance practices in open-source communities.

## My previous work for Polkadot

**Some highlights:**

- Curating a decentralized [Polkadot 2.0 Strategy](https://www.notion.so/Polkadot-2-0-Strategy-264b338f38184248acbf630879f8386f?pvs=21) to ensure that all essential functions for growing the ecosystem are covered and we develop a shared direction
- Representation at conferences/events such as Polkadot Decoded, Sub0, Parachain Summit, DOTBrno, DOTPrague, and local meetups
- Lecturing at the Polkadot Blockchain Academy on the topics of OpenGov and Tokenomics
- Moderating the monthly Technical Fellowship OpenDev call
- Co-Founded ChaosDAO

I am curating a dedicated page with more info about my portfolio. Check it out here:

[Portfolio Tommi](https://www.notion.so/Portfolio-Tommi-822c27eb404941a3a7959a35b805d81d?pvs=21) 

## How I see the Head Ambassador Role

Things I expect from Head Ambassadors:

- Role model: Authentically represent the values and virtues of Polkadot and Web3
- Evangelist: Be in the field (online and offline) and campaign for Polkadot
- Mentor: Personally help ambassadors and community members better understand Polkadot and empower them to represent it to others.
- Magician: Understand that your actions are the cause for new things to happen. A single conversation can spark a new project create a lead for a new deal or inspire someone to achieve great things. Actively use your powers to make good things happen.

As such, these are also the things I strive to do.

## My Offer as Head Ambassador

- **Shape the Ambassador program:** Old and new ambassadors are coming together to create something great. I want to help shape the program and set it up to become a successful organization. Head Ambassadors have to work as a team, so we need to establish the proper culture from the start. Different Head Ambassadors have different strengths, so I will offer mine and look for the strengths of others.
- **Teach Web3 values:** I am a fundamentals guy. The tech is changing the world, no matter how much degens cry about prices and the latest hot shit, etc... I educate about why we build Web3 and connect the dots to the bigger themes. This is not only important for newbies, but especially for everyone deciding to “grow up” and take Web3 seriously. Mentoring people on this journey takes time and we need to commit to giving ambassadors the time and attention they deserve on their path.
- **Ambass:** At the moment, I represent Polkadot mostly via Social Media (Twitter, a bit of LinkedIn) and through irregular video production.
    - **Video Production:** If elected Head Ambassador, my main focus for evangelization would be through content production. I would ramp up my video production again to regularly produce videos on fundamental questions and educational topics in the Polkadot space. The themes would be the current big discussions of Polkadot since I believe that agenda-setting and influencing the narrative is a core responsibility for ambassadors.
    - **Conferences/Events:** I also represent Polkadot on stage at conferences as opportunities open up. My main topics are introductions to Polkadot, Polkadot Strategy, and OpenGov.
    - **Business Development:** I have 2 years of Web3 BD experience, but wouldn’t make it an emphasis of my term. I believe quite a few other HA candidates are better able to serve the time required to do proper BD. My focus here would be to capture leads when they present themselves and then relay them to the relevant parties. One way I proactively approach in small but hopefully effective ways is that I throw out ideas that I think OpenGov would fund if someone bites help them move along (for example here baiting with a [Cardano-Polkadot](https://x.com/alice_und_bob/status/1786145294536643038) bridge and then supporting the project once it starts [here](https://forum.polkadot.network/t/cardano-polkadot-bridge/8543))

## Modalities

### Compensation

At the moment, I have a contract with the Web3 Foundation as part of Decentralized Futures and I do not require additional pay. Under the current situation, I would not use the compensation as salary. I would only use it to pay for operational costs like content production & traveling to events where I represent Polkadot. The primary focus would be to hire a video producer to ramp up production.

### Available Time

I work exclusively for Polkadot. I consider my main line of work at the moment as ecosystem development, which consists of solving problems, analyzing things, and sharing knowledge.

I spend significant time preparing and presenting presentations for conferences as well as agenda-setting and narrative development on Twitter, so imo there is a strong synergy to the role. I believe that the Ambassador program is very important for the community development of Polkadot and will provide the time that the role requires to help it come to fruition.

If it turns out that my other responsibilities are not compatible time-wise or a larger part of the community is not happy with my performance, I will offer the place to someone else.

I am in the process of proposing a new Ecosystem Development Collective which I hope to co-lead. Should that situation become a reality and be incompatible with the HA role, I will also give the HA spot to the next candidate.

items.title: Polkadot Head Ambassador Application: Irina Karagyaur
items.content:
![HA 2024.png](https://subsquare.infura-ipfs.io/ipfs/QmWsJat422JJ9YpzhGVGE455sejJSZKErzyThobfiPzSbG)

Greetings dear Polkadot community!

I’m [Irina Karagyaur](https://www.linkedin.com/in/irina-karagyaur/) ([X](https://x.com/IrinaKaragyaur)) and this is my application for the Polkadot Head Ambassador position.

I want to begin this application by sharing a little about my journey in this wonderful ecosystem. First, I was honored to join the Polkadot community back in August 2020 and began advocating for it in my local community in London UK where I was based at the time. Those days I held many activities during that summer, and as a result I was invited to my first interview about Polkadot on [Cryptonites TV](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=17_1yyqYkd8) in September 2020. 

Considering my background in management consulting and business development, my primary focus in the Polkadot ecosystem has always been on identifying the growth and development opportunities while consistently connecting active members of the Polkadot ecosystem with my business network. Thanks to that work, I was deeply humbled to be promoted to Polkadot Head Ambassador for Western Europe.

Since joining the program, I have provided systematic support to the Web3 Foundation Collaborations team and later to the Parity BD team, always looking forward to bringing new opportunities into the Polkadot ecosystem. This included:

- Onboarding new ambassadors for Western Europe, 
- Onboarding to a [Thousand Validators program](https://wiki.polkadot.network/docs/thousand-validators), 
- Introducing the Foundation for International Blockchain and Real Estate Expertise in my capacity as a Co-Chair for London to Polkadot (Organized and hosted the first [DeFi & Real Estate ](https://www.ucl.ac.uk/bartlett/real-estate/events/2021/mar/defi-real-estate-mechanics-decentralised-trust) academic event in partnership with [UCL](https://www.ucl.ac.uk/) & [FIBREE](https://fibree.org/)). 
- I have a proven track record of onboarding new parachain teams and DApps into the Polkadot ecosystem. 

Additionally I have contributed to Polkadot by:

- Facilitating the creation of the report [Polkadot & Cosmos for Enterprise](https://www.blockchainresearchinstitute.org/project/cosmos-and-polkadot-for-the-enterprise/)
- Moderation of  several events, for example [Polkadot Decoded Impact Stage](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DMqvJjrhISg), contributing to the event's success.
- Creator of [PolkaOscar ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x01EfSESigA)
- Representation of Polkadot at the International level in various events. First at the **United Nations COP26** (first in history NFT collection presented at the United Nations). Then later in the **United Nations COP27** where I included Polkadot as the main sponsor and program partner for the Digital Innovation Pavilion. In that location, I helped with a hybrid panel discussion about Polkadot technology and sustainability. Last year in **COP28** I co-hosted the **Digital Innovation Pavilion **and represented Polkadot in my capacity as Head Ambassador as well while I held a hybrid fireside with Polkadot Blockchain Academy. Apart from those activities, at the  **UNESCO HQ** in Paris with the invaluable help of Polkadot treasury (Gov1 model) I contributed to, organize and curate the first ever Web3 & NFT exhibition called “Reconciliation with the Living”, which is a milestone in the art world. Represented Polkadot as HA and introduced Web3 and Decentralization concept and narrative at the  ITU HQ in Geneva; represented Polkadot at [UN Geneva Forum 2022](https://www.osi-genevaforum.org/United-Nations-2022-December-13-Smart-Finance-Cryptocurrencies-for-Peace-and.html)

In the <ins>curation</ins> field I served as a Sub-Curator for events bounty and currently serve as a curator for BD Bounty and Games Bounty. Very recently, I was honored to be selected as a [W3F Decentralized Voices Cohort II delegate](https://medium.com/web3foundation/decentralized-voices-cohort-2-b10ddb7c71cc).

As a <ins>volunteer</ins> as an editor and expert contributor to International Telecommunications Union (ITU) Focus Group on Metaverse (FG-MV), and served as a mentor for the UN Women Mentorship Program, Member and Expert Contributor of the Culture and Creative Industries (CCI) Taskforce UN Climate Change Global Innovation Hub (UNFCCC), EU Climate Pact Ambassador for Spain at the European Commission.

Fortunately my work has been acknowledged with several awards and recognitions. I was named one of the [Top 100 Women of the Future](https://womenofthefuture.com/global-vol-1/).  Winner of the [2022 Rising Women in Crypto Power List by Wirex and The Cryptonomist](https://wirexapp.com/blog/post/winners-of-the-rising-women-in-crypto-power-list-2022-announced-0684). Distinguished in [Asia's 100 Women Power Leaders](https://www.whitepageinternational.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/CXO-Global-Book-2023.pdf) list. Winner of [Women of Web3 Changemakers 2023 by Near Foundation](https://www.cryptotimes.io/2023/06/30/near-foundation-celebrates-top-women-changemakers-in-web3/). Mentioned as one of the Top 20 Women Blockchain Leaders in 2023 by Whizlabs. [Featured activist at COP28](https://action.cop28.com/project/irina-karagyaur). LinkedIn Top Strategy & Metaverse Voice 2024. Mentioned as one of the Top 20 women in blockchain 2024 by Mural. Mentioned as one of the Top 20  Women Blockchain Leaders in 2024 by Whizlabs.

Since I consider communication and education a main priority:

- I Delivered a **TEDx talk** ["Knowledge Communities are Shaping the Metaverse"](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zR_rYCwcq-4) at TEDxMaviliSquare 2023.

- **Featured in** Entrepreneur India, Arab Finance ([Top 15 viral interviews of 2022](https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:7013780938497134592/)), CoinDesk, Cointelegraph, BeInCrypto, Financial Times, Harvard Business Review Turkey, [Missions Publiques](https://missionspubliques.org/we-can-mirror-our-society-in-the-virtual-world-and-tackle-real-problems-were-facing-in-the-physical-one/?lang=en), [Museum Week Magazine](https://museumweek2h1r4.substack.com/p/reinventing-loyalty-with-web30-tech), GeckoCon by CoinGecko, Benzinga, NFT NYC and more.

Made several **publications**: 
- [Building the Future of Real Estate with NFTs: It’s the Business Model, Stupid! ](https://fibree.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/FIBREE-Industry-Report-2022-EN.pdf)(2022); 
- [Collaboration For Transformative Digital Climate Innovations Stocktake Report and Next Strategy for the Climate Chain Coalition](https://climatechaincoalition.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/CCC-COP27-Stocktake-and-Next-Strategy-November-2022.pdf) (2022); 
- [A Wormhole Linking the Metaverse and Space Explorations: The Metaverse Multiplanetary Economic Model ](https://beincrypto.com/wormhole-linking-metaverse-space-explorations-metaverse-multiplanetary-economy/)(2021); 
- [Get Ready for the 2022 Metaverse Real Estate Boom ](https://www.coindesk.com/author/irina-karagyaur/)(2021); 
- [The Power of Ownership](https://fibree.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/Fibree-Industry-Report-2021-Digital.pdf) (2021); 


To channel my work in an organizational structure I co-founded BQ9, which is an ecosystem growth agency and a boutique advisory firm on a mission to “turn great ideas into great Web3 products”. My company works on business model creation, product ideation and development & Ecosystem Strategy. 

Currently I’m collaborating with  Energy Web on Web3 growth strategy and Global Leaders new community program. While I’m also the  **creator** and a host of [The Business Case for Polkadot](https://www.linkedin.com/showcase/the-business-case-for-polkadot/?viewAsMember=true) podcast & [DOT4Business](https://x.com/DOT4Business) community in partnership with [Polkadot Blockchain Academy](https://www.youtube.com/@polkadotblockchainacademy).


**Why vote Aye? Future plans.**

I will consistently represent Polkadot at key events at the international level: International Telecommunications Union, United Nations, UNESCO, COP29, EU. Later this year, I will be representing Polkadot and speaking at [an international event in Warsaw](https://x.com/EuLeadership/status/1803004792718946379) in July alongside the members of European Parliament, Countries representatives to EU (ex. Former Cabinet Minister of the Netherlands), European Policy Center, European Innovation Council and some of the world's largest tech enterprises. I will also continue representing the Polkadot ecosystem at key industry events worldwide. Jointly with the PBA we will continue hosting The Business Case for Polkadot podcast and grow DOT4Business community. 

My main focus will be ecosystem growth and onboarding of B2B and B2G players into the ecosystem. Therefore, my ongoing BD proposal includes:

- [Museum Week Loyalty program for museums and cultural institutions.](https://museumweek2h1r4.substack.com/p/reinventing-loyalty-with-web30-tech)

- [Collaboration with the Founder Institute, world’s largest pre-seed accelerator.](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/referenda/755) Organic press coverage by [Crypto Daily](https://cryptodaily.co.uk/2024/05/founder-institute-partners-with-polkadot-to-empower-web3-startup-founders) and [Binance](https://www.binance.com/en-IN/square/post/8226603469209).

- Onboarding 734,366 new users to the Polkadot ecosystem, with the potential of reaching 60 million active users in the Tap Nation ecosystem through this [collaboration](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/post/2330).

And many more exciting announcements yet to be made public in the coming month. 

I believe in the potential of Polkadot technology and the power of the Polkadot community. Through my experience, I know the strength and dedication of this community. I am committed to continuing to build a thriving ecosystem by onboarding competent and passionate Senior Ambassadors and Ambassadors. My mission is to make this program a success and our ecosystem the default choice for builders, larger enterprises, and governments. I aim to make Polkadot an example of the practical benefits that Web3 brings to the world.

history.content:
![HA 2024.png](https://subsquare.infura-ipfs.io/ipfs/QmWsJat422JJ9YpzhGVGE455sejJSZKErzyThobfiPzSbG)

Greetings dear Polkadot community!

I’m [Irina Karagyaur](https://www.linkedin.com/in/irina-karagyaur/) ([X](https://x.com/IrinaKaragyaur)) and this is my application for the Polkadot Head Ambassador position.

I want to begin this application by sharing a little about my journey in this wonderful ecosystem. First, I was honored to join the Polkadot community back in August 2020 and began advocating for it in my local community in London UK where I was based at the time. Those days I held many activities during that summer, and as a result I was invited to my first interview about Polkadot on [Cryptonites TV](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=17_1yyqYkd8) in September 2020. 

Considering my background in management consulting and business development, my primary focus in the Polkadot ecosystem has always been on identifying the growth and development opportunities while consistently connecting active members of the Polkadot ecosystem with my business network. Thanks to that work, I was deeply humbled to be promoted to Polkadot Head Ambassador for Western Europe.

Since joining the program, I have provided systematic support to the Web3 Foundation Collaborations team and later to the Parity BD team, always looking forward to bringing new opportunities into the Polkadot ecosystem. This included:

- Onboarding new ambassadors for Western Europe, 
- Onboarding to a [Thousand Validators program](https://wiki.polkadot.network/docs/thousand-validators), 
- Introducing the Foundation for International Blockchain and Real Estate Expertise in my capacity as a Co-Chair for London to Polkadot (Organized and hosted the first [DeFi & Real Estate ](https://www.ucl.ac.uk/bartlett/real-estate/events/2021/mar/defi-real-estate-mechanics-decentralised-trust) academic event in partnership with [UCL](https://www.ucl.ac.uk/) & [FIBREE](https://fibree.org/)). 
- I have a proven track record of onboarding new parachain teams and DApps into the Polkadot ecosystem. 

Additionally I have contributed to Polkadot by:

- Facilitating the creation of the report [Polkadot & Cosmos for Enterprise](https://www.blockchainresearchinstitute.org/project/cosmos-and-polkadot-for-the-enterprise/)
- Moderation of  several events, for example [Polkadot Decoded Impact Stage](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DMqvJjrhISg), contributing to the event's success.
- Creator of [PolkaOscar ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x01EfSESigA)
- Representation of Polkadot at the International level in various events. First at the **United Nations COP26** (first in history NFT collection presented at the United Nations). Then later in the **United Nations COP27** where I included Polkadot as the main sponsor and program partner for the Digital Innovation Pavilion. In that location, I helped with a hybrid panel discussion about Polkadot technology and sustainability. Last year in **COP28** I co-hosted the **Digital Innovation Pavilion **and represented Polkadot in my capacity as Head Ambassador as well while I held a hybrid fireside with Polkadot Blockchain Academy. Apart from those activities, at the  **UNESCO HQ** in Paris with the invaluable help of Polkadot treasury (Gov1 model) I contributed to, organize and curate the first ever Web3 & NFT exhibition called “Reconciliation with the Living”, which is a milestone in the art world. Represented Polkadot as HA and introduced Web3 and Decentralization concept and narrative at the  ITU HQ in Geneva; represented Polkadot at [UN Geneva Forum 2022](https://www.osi-genevaforum.org/United-Nations-2022-December-13-Smart-Finance-Cryptocurrencies-for-Peace-and.html)

In the <ins>curation</ins> field I served as a Sub-Curator for events bounty and currently serve as a curator for BD Bounty and Games Bounty. Very recently, I was honored to be selected as a [W3F Decentralized Voices Cohort II delegate](https://medium.com/web3foundation/decentralized-voices-cohort-2-b10ddb7c71cc).

As a <ins>volunteer</ins> as an editor and expert contributor to International Telecommunications Union (ITU) Focus Group on Metaverse (FG-MV), and served as a mentor for the UN Women Mentorship Program, Member and Expert Contributor of the Culture and Creative Industries (CCI) Taskforce UN Climate Change Global Innovation Hub (UNFCCC), EU Climate Pact Ambassador for Spain at the European Commission.

Fortunately my work has been acknowledged with several awards and recognitions. I was named one of the [Top 100 Women of the Future](https://womenofthefuture.com/global-vol-1/).  Winner of the [2022 Rising Women in Crypto Power List by Wirex and The Cryptonomist](https://wirexapp.com/blog/post/winners-of-the-rising-women-in-crypto-power-list-2022-announced-0684). Distinguished in [Asia's 100 Women Power Leaders](https://www.whitepageinternational.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/CXO-Global-Book-2023.pdf) list. Winner of [Women of Web3 Changemakers 2023 by Near Foundation](https://www.cryptotimes.io/2023/06/30/near-foundation-celebrates-top-women-changemakers-in-web3/). Mentioned as one of the Top 20 Women Blockchain Leaders in 2023 by Whizlabs. [Featured activist at COP28](https://action.cop28.com/project/irina-karagyaur). LinkedIn Top Strategy & Metaverse Voice 2024. Mentioned as one of the Top 20 women in blockchain 2024 by Mural. Mentioned as one of the Top 20  Women Blockchain Leaders in 2024 by Whizlabs.

Since I consider communication and education a main priority:

- I Delivered a **TEDx talk** ["Knowledge Communities are Shaping the Metaverse"](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zR_rYCwcq-4) at TEDxMaviliSquare 2023.

- **Featured in** Entrepreneur India, Arab Finance ([Top 15 viral interviews of 2022](https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:7013780938497134592/)), CoinDesk, Cointelegraph, BeInCrypto, Financial Times, Harvard Business Review Turkey, [Missions Publiques](https://missionspubliques.org/we-can-mirror-our-society-in-the-virtual-world-and-tackle-real-problems-were-facing-in-the-physical-one/?lang=en), [Museum Week Magazine](https://museumweek2h1r4.substack.com/p/reinventing-loyalty-with-web30-tech), GeckoCon by CoinGecko, Benzinga, NFT NYC and more.

Made several **publications**: 
- [Building the Future of Real Estate with NFTs: It’s the Business Model, Stupid! ](https://fibree.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/FIBREE-Industry-Report-2022-EN.pdf)(2022); 
- [Collaboration For Transformative Digital Climate Innovations Stocktake Report and Next Strategy for the Climate Chain Coalition](https://climatechaincoalition.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/CCC-COP27-Stocktake-and-Next-Strategy-November-2022.pdf) (2022); 
- [A Wormhole Linking the Metaverse and Space Explorations: The Metaverse Multiplanetary Economic Model ](https://beincrypto.com/wormhole-linking-metaverse-space-explorations-metaverse-multiplanetary-economy/)(2021); 
- [Get Ready for the 2022 Metaverse Real Estate Boom ](https://www.coindesk.com/author/irina-karagyaur/)(2021); 
- [The Power of Ownership](https://fibree.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/Fibree-Industry-Report-2021-Digital.pdf) (2021); 


To channel my work in an organizational structure I co-founded BQ9, which is an ecosystem growth agency and a boutique advisory firm on a mission to “turn great ideas into great Web3 products”. My company works on business model creation, product ideation and development & Ecosystem Strategy. 

Currently I’m collaborating with  Energy Web on Web3 growth strategy and Global Leaders new community program. While I’m also the  **creator** and a host of [The Business Case for Polkadot](https://www.linkedin.com/showcase/the-business-case-for-polkadot/?viewAsMember=true) podcast & [DOT4Business](https://x.com/DOT4Business) community in partnership with [Polkadot Blockchain Academy](https://www.youtube.com/@polkadotblockchainacademy).


**Why vote Aye? Future plans.**

I will consistently represent Polkadot at key events at the international level: International Telecommunications Union, United Nations, UNESCO, COP29, EU. Later this year, I will be representing Polkadot and speaking at [an international event in Warsaw](https://x.com/EuLeadership/status/1803004792718946379) in July alongside the members of European Parliament, Countries representatives to EU (ex. Former Cabinet Minister of the Netherlands), European Policy Center, European Innovation Council and some of the world's largest tech enterprises. I will also continue representing the Polkadot ecosystem at key industry events worldwide. Jointly with the PBA we will continue hosting The Business Case for Polkadot podcast and grow DOT4Business community. 

My main focus will be ecosystem growth and onboarding of B2B and B2G players into the ecosystem. Therefore, my ongoing BD proposal includes:

- [Museum Week Loyalty program for museums and cultural institutions.](https://museumweek2h1r4.substack.com/p/reinventing-loyalty-with-web30-tech)

- [Collaboration with the Founder Institute, world’s largest pre-seed accelerator.](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/referenda/755) Organic press coverage by [Crypto Daily](https://cryptodaily.co.uk/2024/05/founder-institute-partners-with-polkadot-to-empower-web3-startup-founders) and [Binance](https://www.binance.com/en-IN/square/post/8226603469209).

- Onboarding 734,366 new users to the Polkadot ecosystem, with the potential of reaching 60 million active users in the Tap Nation ecosystem through this [collaboration](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/post/2330).

And many more exciting announcements yet to be made public in the coming month. 

I believe in the potential of Polkadot technology and the power of the Polkadot community. Through my experience, I know the strength and dedication of this community. I am committed to continuing to build a thriving ecosystem by onboarding competent and passionate Senior Ambassadors and Ambassadors. My mission is to make this program a success and our ecosystem the default choice for builders, larger enterprises, and governments. I aim to make Polkadot an example of the practical benefits that Web3 brings to the world.

items.title: Polkadot Head Ambassador Application: Ezio Rojas
items.content:
Hello Polkadot community!

I would like to present my application to be a Head Ambassador in the Polkadot ecosystem.

I am Ezio Rojas, I currently serve as curator of the [Spanish Bounty](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/bounty/42), [AMI Bounty Program](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/bounty/46) and the [Business Development Polkadot in Spain & Andorra Bounty](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/bounty/40).

I am in the Polkadot ecosystem since 2021. I worked at Parity Technologies from December 2021 to January 2024, where I served as Community and Social Media Manager for Latin America and Spain, from where I was leading the Spanish-speaking community within the Polkadot ecosystem.

In these years I have been involved in different activities within the Polkadot ecosystem, including participating as a speaker at major global conferences such as Labitconf 2022 edition in the talk “[How to choose the right Blockchain for my company or project?](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MirwzS_6uUM&t=1994s)” also participating in talks at CriptoLatinFest 2023 edition and a side event of Bitcoin Miami 2022 edition.

I have also been involved in major Polkadot events, such as Polkadot Decoded, where [I participated as a speaker in 2022 ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XRw7tjuLkUw&t=2s), as well as other community events in Argentina, Venezuela, Colombia, Mexico and Spain, from where the Hispanic Polkadot community has grown arduously in recent years. 

**Background in crypto ecosystem**

I started as a user in the crypto ecosystem in 2017. In 2019 I started working with Cointelegraph, where I reached by 2021 the position of Editor in Chief of the Spanish version.
Having a background in the media industry has helped me to get space for Polkadot in different cryptocurrency media in Spanish. Here is a list of the publications where I have managed to get Polkadot's presence:

[El precio de DOT se encuentra en una importante zona de soporte](https://es.cointelegraph.com/news/dot-price-is-in-an-important-support-zone)

[Predicción Polkadot: ¿Qué esperar del precio de DOT a corto plazo?](https://criptotendencia.com/2023/08/22/prediccion-polkadot-que-esperar-del-precio-de-dot-a-corto-plazo/)

[Conoce la actualidad, planes y perspectivas de Polkadot para el 2023](https://es.cointelegraph.com/news/learn-about-the-news-perspectives-and-plans-of-polkadot-for-2023)

[Interoperabilidad hacia un sistema web interconectado](https://es.cointelegraph.com/news/interoperability-towards-an-interconnected-web-system)

[La Zona Tres: Layer1 Talk & Polka Dot Ezio Rojas](https://www.talent-republic.tv/developer/desarrollo-de-software/la-zona-tres-layer1-talk-polka-dot-ezio-rojas/)

[Episodio 56: ¿Qué es Polkadot y Cuál es su propuesta de valor? Entrevista con Ezio Rojas](https://www.criptotendencias.com/podcast/episodio-56-que-es-polkadot-y-cual-es-su-propuesta-de-valor-entrevista-con-ezio-rojas/)

[Se dan a conocer los proyectos ganadores del Polkadot Hackathon LATAM 2022](https://www.criptotendencias.com/actualidad/ganadores-del-polkadot-hackathon-latam-2022/)

[Se anunciaron los proyectos ganadores del Polkadot Hackathon LATAM 2022](https://es.cointelegraph.com/news/the-winners-of-the-polkadot-hackathon-latam-2022-were-announced)

[Deloitte aprovecha la Blockchain Kilt del ecosistema Polkadot para mejorar sus servicios](https://criptotendencia.com/2023/12/08/deloitte-aprovecha-la-blockchain-kilt-del-ecosistema-polkadot-para-mejorar-sus-servicios/)

[Polkadot presenta reporte de 2023 con crecimiento](https://es.cointelegraph.com/news/polkadot-reports-2023-with-growth)

[La Web3 toma la UBA: Dr. Gavin Wood presenta JAM, el protocolo que revolucionará el futuro de Internet](https://criptoinforme.com/eventos/la-web3-toma-la-uba-dr-gavin-wood-presenta-jam-el-protocolo-que-revolucionara-el-futuro-de-internet/)

[La revolución de la Web3: Dr. Gavin Wood elige a la UBA para lanzar JAM ](https://www.criptotendencias.com/criptoeventos/la-revolucion-de-la-web3-dr-gavin-wood-elige-a-la-uba-para-lanzar-jam/)

[Argentina: Comenzó en Buenos Aires “Polkadot Blockchain Academy”](https://es.cointelegraph.com/news/argentina-polkadot-blockchain-academy-has-begun-in-buenos-aires)

Also, in 2022 I co-founded the [Caracas Blockchain Week](https://caracasblockchainweek.com/), the largest Web3 conference in Venezuela and one of the largest in Latin America, with more than 3000 attendees in 5 days. In 2023 we had the second edition, reaching 3200 attendees and the first crypto-hackathon in Venezuela. 

In both editions, given my role as co-founder, Polkadot appeared as a sponsor of the event, without representing an expense for the ecosystem. Its appearance was totally free.

Also, delving into my background within the crypto ecosystem, I should mention that in the year 2022 I was listed as one of the personalities of the cryptocurrency ecosystem in Latin America that year, an [award given by the BeInCrypto team](https://es-beincrypto-com.webpkgcache.com/doc/-/s/es.beincrypto.com/top-personalidades-ecosistema-cripto-america-latina-2022/).

**Goals to develop**

Beyond everything I have already executed and accomplished in the ecosystem, I have a clear vision of the future for the functions I hope to perform as Head Ambassador. 

My pillars as Head Ambassador will be 3:

1. Expansion of Polkadot's Reach:
- Focus on key audiences: Prioritize the dissemination of Polkadot in scenarios aimed at entrepreneurs, Venture Capital firms and other relevant players in this market within the Spanish-speaking ecosystem.
- Strategic communication: Implement effective communication strategies to amplify knowledge about Polkadot, highlighting its competitive advantages and disruptive potential.

2. Drive Adoption:
- Promotion of parachains and appchains: Encourage the adoption of Polkadot's parachains, appchains and end products among the Spanish-speaking public, with the objective of increasing the active user base on the network.
- Educational campaigns: Develop and implement face-to-face educational campaigns aimed at end users, highlighting the benefits and practical use cases of Polkadot-based solutions.

3. Development Promotion:
- Creation of training spaces: Facilitate the creation of training spaces for Spanish-speaking developers interested in building on Polkadot and its parachains.
- Community building: Encourage collaboration and knowledge sharing among developers, fostering the growth of a vibrant community interested in building on Polkadot.

In order to materialize my vision in the established pillars, I will carry out the following actions:

**Visibility and Outreach:**
- Presence in relevant events: Ensure Polkadot's participation in major conferences and Web3 events within the Spanish-speaking ecosystem. Facilitate the presence of parachains, appchains and final products developed in the network.
- Events for end users: Promote the realization of meetings where Polkadot, its parachains, appchains and end products are presented.
- Hackathons and training: Encourage the participation of Polkadot in hackathons in the region and organize workshops and training spaces for developers interested in the technology.
**Marketing and Adoption:**
- Marketing campaigns: Collaboration for the development of marketing campaigns focused on end users within the region, disseminating information about parachains, appchains and end products of the network.
- Community Promotion: Revitalize the local Spanish-speaking community, integrating new ambassadors and enhancing the work of current ambassadors.
**Communication and Diffusion:**
- Media publications: Manage the publication of press releases related to the Polkadot ecosystem and its parachains in the region's media, both specialized and general interest.

**My team**

In order to achieve these goals, a multidisciplinary team with extensive experience in the region has been established. I will be accompanied by:

Carlos Rodriguez

Developer relations, Blockchain and web3 builder and Polkadot & Astar technical ambassador

Roberto Heredia

Data Scientist by training and self-taught Web Developer. Physics and Mathematics teacher. Enthusiast and disseminator of Blockchain technology and cryptocurrencies. Ambassador of Polkadot Colombia.

Santiago Guzman

Business Growth Manager Colombia on CoinX Global. CEO and Founder of Cripto Latin Fest. Independent event consultant. Crypto and blockchain educator in Latam universities.

Joann Cruz

Crypto enthusiast with 3 years of research. Certified by sena in blockchain, by platzi in AI, studying with web3 communities of the Universidad Nacional and Jorge Tadeo Lozano de Bogotá in blockchain programming and cryptocurrencies, student and mentor of the defi academy of Colombia Wakeup and Project Manager of an idea in creation as Academia DeFi in polkadot.

items.title: Polkadot Head Ambassador Application: six / David Pethes
items.content:
**Greetings Polkadot!**

My name is "Six" / David Pethes and I am applying for the Head Ambassador position. I joined the ecosystem in 2021 as an Ambassador Candidate, climbed the ladder to become a Head Ambassador and I'd like to keep contributing through this role.

Regarding background, my expertise in information security began in my early years and has continuously evolved, complementing my entrepreneurial endeavors since 2019 (Founded [CCTF DAO](https://cryptoctf.org/landingpage/6-2/) and Co-Founded [G6 Networks](https://www.g6.network/)). I excel as a facilitator, bridging gaps between diverse entities. I value personal freedom and individuality, advocating against centralized control. I prioritize action over rhetoric; thus, my proposal is straightforward and requires only a brief review to understand my commitment and capabilities.

**Current activity**
I am working on onboarding large entities to the Polkadot ecosystem such as financial institutions, governments and enterprise companies. I am actively participating in Polkadot BD meetings/events, founded G6 Networks so we can provide actual solutions to those who want to enter the ecosystem and also support Mandala Chain, Mosaic chain and other teams with their initiatives.

You can find me speaking at events such as sub0, Decoded, BDAY, Hacktivity, HITB and others. 

I am taking responsibility of those I brought to the ecosystem, including Senior Ambassadors, Ambassadors and others being part of Eastern Europe region and Polkadot Hungary.

I am an active participant on OpenGov where you can see me not just voting, but also providing useful feedback.

**Some of my past contributions to the Polkadot ecosystem**
- Joined the Ambassador Program in 2021 and I am active since.
- Started Polkadot Hungary in 2021 - an active community with monthly meetups running since
- In 2023 I have handod over Polkadot Hungary to Senior Ambassador Vikk
- Organized many Polkadot events in: Budapest, Berlin, Amsterdam, Dubai, Bali.
- Presented Polkadot in the Hungarian TV and Radio channels (multiple times between 2022-2023)
- Kickstarted the Polkadot meetups and ambassdorship in Indonesia with Senior Ambassador Gabo
- Four new ecosystems projects joined with my help: Mosaic Chain, Mandala Chain, G6 Networks and CCTF DAO
- Co-Founded the Polkadot Hubs project and brought two free physical office spaces to our ecosystem: Bali and Budapest.
- Introduced Polkadot to security conferences: Hacktivity and HackInTheBox
- Signed agreements with Dubai Blockchain Center and Bali Blockchain Center for future collaboration and free event/workspaces exclusive to Polkadot.
- Initiated the MOU signing process for Hong Kong, Cyberport.

**Why vote Aye!?**

For more achievements as before and institutional onboarding at Polkadot, vote "Aye!".

items.title: Proposal: Promotion to "VII Dan: Free Master" for Gavin Wood - Evidence below
items.content:
## Member Details

- Member e-mail: gavin@parity.io
- Polkadot address: 16SDAKg9N6kKAbhgDyxBXdHEwpwHUHs2CNEiLNGeZV55qHna
- Current rank: "VI Dan: Grand Architect" (to be promoted to "VII Dan:  Free Master", as per the [Fellowship manifesto](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/manifesto/blob/main/manifesto.pdf): requirements and obligations in the document) 
- Date of initial induction: November 2022
- Area(s) of Expertise/Interest: Technical design, Protocol evolution, Socio-political direction

## Reporting period
Start date: 2023/05/16
End date: 2024/05/28

## Areas of contribution

**Polkadot SDK:**

- Specification & implementation of Agile Coretime (brokerage system).
Specification of Agile Coretime (interface). [RFC 1](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/RFCs/blob/main/text/0001-agile-coretime.md) & [PR 14568](https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/14568), [RFC 5](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/RFCs/blob/main/text/0005-coretime-interface.md).

**Improvements to XCM:** 

- Tools for uniquely referencing messages, [PR 7234](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot/pull/7234)
- Bound number of assets which can be withdrawn to pay for execution, [PR 7641](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot/pull/7641).

**Improvements to FRAME:**

- FRAME: Revamp Preimage pallet to use Consideration, [PR 1363](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot-sdk/pull/1363)
- FRAME: Create `TransactionExtension` as a replacement for `SignedExtension`,  [PR 2280](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot-sdk/pull/2280).

**Roadmap/Vision:** 

- Specification for JAM Protocol, [Graypaper](https://graypaper.com/) and [ongoing refinements](https://github.com/gavofyork/graypaper).

**In-depth conversations on the philosophy behind Polkadot:** 

- Within the ecosystem: Polkadot Decoded 2023, sub0 Asia 2024 ([Keynote: Gavin Wood sees Polkadot as a global Supercomputer](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GIB1WeVuJD0), [Keynote: JAM A-Z](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tdvqkKdFTlw)). 2) with the general public: Space Monkeys, [Gavin Wood - Is Polkadot OpenGov’s Democratic? Games & Consensus](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RvbsSq1a_8g), [Behind the Code: The Graypaper interview](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O3kRAVBTkfs). 

**Presentations on the Polkadot network and protocol:** 

- With peers from other ecosystems and/or industries: [Decentralized Lugano](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Yw3mQNJ5UJQ),[ sub0 Asia 2024](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_gpFm0IZ34M), [Token2049 Dubai 2024](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xTMiE0UcZUo).
- With the wider academic community and/or industry: [Protocol Berg](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j7b8Upipmeg), [The Journey Man](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9SAxnF2sys8). 

**Comment(s):**

- Gav was originally meant to be seeded into the Fellowship at Rank 7. However, this could not happen as the manifesto specifies that induction at Rank 7 can only be done via the community vote: more specifically on Fellowship Admin track. For any members to be promoted to rank VII a vote from the community needs to happen. 
- Gav's contributions to the ecosystem are invaluable and his work has shown a clear vision with regards to where Polkadot should be in the future, what the challenges and the opportunities are in the industry and how a truly unstoppable, scalable and interoperable network should look like.


Make sure to review the above and cast your vote!

history.title: Proposal: Promotion to "Rank VII Dan: Free Master" for Gavin Wood - Evidence below

items.title: Approve Current Fellowship V and VI Dan Members
items.content:
With the introduction of the Core Fellowship pallet, each Fellow enrolled in the pallet must defend their rank periodically. This referendum approves all rank V and VI members (lower ranks can be approved by the Fellowship itself) at the same block number, to synchronize member defense periods.

Note to Fellows: You must `import` yourself into the Core Fellowship pallet for this call to have any affect.

The call is scheduled to enact on 5 February.
